verses.sanskrit: तवं हयग्ने परथमो मनोतास्या धियो अभवो दस्म होता तवं सीं वर्षन्नक्र्णोर्दुष्टरीतु सहो विश्वस्मै सहसे सहध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne prathamo manotāsyā dhiyo abhavo dasma hotā tvaṃ sīṃ vṛṣannakṛṇorduṣṭarītu saho viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai

translations.griffith: THOU, first inventor of this prayer, O Agni, Worker of Marvels, hast become our Herald.  Thou, Bull, hast made us strength which none may conquer, strength that shall overcome all other prowess.

verses.sanskrit: अधा होता नयसीदो यजीयानिळस पद इषयन्नीड्यः सन तं तवा नरः परथमं देवयन्तो महो राये चितयन्तो अनु गमन |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hotā nyasīdo yajīyāniḷas pada iṣayannīḍyaḥ san taṃ tvā naraḥ prathamaṃ devayanto maho rāye citayanto anu ghman

translations.griffith: As Priest thou sattest at the seat of worship, furthering us, best Offerer, meet for honour.  So first to thee have pious men resorted, turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.

verses.sanskrit: वर्तेव यन्तं बहुभिर्वसव्यैस्त्वे रयिं जाग्र्वांसो अनु गमन रुशन्तमग्निं दर्शतं बर्हन्तं वपावन्तं विश्वहा दीदिवांसम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛteva yantaṃ bahubhirvasavyaistve rayiṃ jāghṛvāṃso anu ghman ruśantamaghniṃ darśataṃ bṛhantaṃ vapāvantaṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam

translations.griffith: In thee, still watching, they have followed riches, who goest with much wealth as with an army,  The radiant Agni, lofty, fair to look on, worshipped with marrow, evermore resplendent.

verses.sanskrit: पदं देवस्य नमसा वयन्तः शरवस्यवः शरव आपन्नम्र्क्तम नामानि चिद दधिरे यज्ञियानि भद्रायां ते रणयन्तसन्द्र्ष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: padaṃ devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śrava āpannamṛktam nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyāṃ te raṇayantasandṛṣṭau

translations.griffith: They who approached the God's abode with homage, eager for glory, won them perfect glory:  Yea, they gained even sacrificial titles, and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.

verses.sanskrit: तवां वर्धन्ति कषितयः पर्थिव्यां तवां राय उभयासो जनानाम तवं तराता तरणे चेत्यो भूः पिता माता सदमिन मानुषाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tvāṃ rāya ubhayāso janānām tvaṃ trātā taraṇe cetyo bhūḥ pitā mātā sadamin mānuṣāṇām

translations.griffith: On earth the people magnify thee greatly, thee their celestial and terrestrial riches.  Thou, Helper, must be known as our Preserver, Father and Mother of mankind for ever.

verses.sanskrit: सपर्येण्यः स परियो विक्ष्वग्निर्होता मन्द्रो नि षसादा यजीयान तं तवा वयं दम आ दीदिवांसमुप जञुबाधो नमसा सदेम |||
verses.transliteration: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyo vikṣvaghnirhotā mandro ni ṣasādā yajīyān taṃ tvā vayaṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsamupa jñubādho namasā sadema

translations.griffith: Dear priest among mankind, adorable Agni hath seated him, joy-giver, skilled in worship.  Let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling, kneeling upon our knees, with adoration.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा वयं सुध्यो नव्यमग्ने-सुम्नायव ईमहे देवयन्तः तवं विशो अनयो दीद्यानो दिवो अग्ने बर्हता रोचनेन |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudhyo navyamaghne-sumnāyava īmahe devayantaḥ tvaṃ viśo anayo dīdyāno divo aghne bṛhatā rocanena

translations.griffith: Longing for bliss, pure-minded, God-devoted, Agni, we seek thee, such, meet to be lauded.  Thou, Agni, leddest forth our men to battle, refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour.

verses.sanskrit: विशां कविं विश्पतिं शश्वतीनां नितोशनं वर्षभं चर्षणीनाम परेतीषणिमिषयन्तं पावकं राजन्तमग्निं यजतं रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ śaśvatīnāṃ nitośanaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām pretīṣaṇimiṣayantaṃ pāvakaṃ rājantamaghniṃ yajataṃ rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Sage of mankind, all peoples' Lord and Master, the Bull of men, the sender down of blessings,  Still pressing on, promoting, purifying, Agni the Holy One, the Lord of riches.

verses.sanskrit: सो अग्न ईजे शशमे च मर्तो यस्त आनट समिधा हव्यदातिम य आहुतिं परि वेदा नमोभिर्विश्वेत स वामा दधतेत्वोतः |||
verses.transliteration: so aghna īje śaśame ca marto yasta ānaṭ samidhā havyadātim ya āhutiṃ pari vedā namobhirviśvet sa vāmā dadhatetvotaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped, brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel,  And well knows sacrifice with adoration, gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा उ ते महि महे विधेम नमोभिरग्ने समिधोत हव्यैः वेदी सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैरा ते भद्रायां सुमतौयतेम |||
verses.transliteration: asmā u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhiraghne samidhota havyaiḥ vedī sūno sahaso ghīrbhirukthairā te bhadrāyāṃ sumatauyatema

translations.griffith: Mightily let us worship thee the Mighty, with reverence, Agni! fuel and oblations,  With songs, O Son of Strength, with hymns, with altar: so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्ततन्थ रोदसी वि भासा शरवोभिश्च शरवस्यस्तरुत्रः बर्हद्भिर्वाजै सथविरेभिरस्मे रेवद्भिरग्ने वितरं वि भाहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā yastatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiśca śravasyastarutraḥ bṛhadbhirvājai sthavirebhirasme revadbhiraghne vitaraṃ vi bhāhi

translations.griffith: Thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories, glorious and triumphant.  Continue thou to shine on us, O Agni, with strength abundant, rich, and long enduring.

verses.sanskrit: नर्वद वसो सदमिद धेह्यस्मे भूरि तोकाय तनयाय पश्वः पूर्वीरिषो बर्हतीरारेघा अस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: nṛvad vaso sadamid dhehyasme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ pūrvīriṣo bṛhatīrāreaghā asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us ever, as man needs, O Vasu, abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring.  Food noble, plenteous, far from sin and evil, he with us, and fair fame to make us happy.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूण्यग्ने पुरुधा तवाया वसूनि राजन वसुता ते अश्याम पुरूणि हि तवे पुरुवार सन्त्यग्ने वसु विधते राजनि तवे |||
verses.transliteration: purūṇyaghne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasutā te aśyām purūṇi hi tve puruvāra santyaghne vasu vidhate rājani tve

translations.griffith: May I obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace, King Agni;  For in thee Bounteous One, in thee the Sovran, Agni, are many boons for him who serves thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि कषैतवद यशो.अग्ने मित्रो न पत्यसे तवं विचर्षणे शरवो वसो पुष्टिं न पुष्यसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi kṣaitavad yaśo.aghne mitro na patyase tvaṃ vicarṣaṇe śravo vaso puṣṭiṃ na puṣyasi

translations.griffith: THOU, Agni, even as Mitra, hast a princely glory of thine own.  Thou, active Vasu, makest fame increase like full prosperity.

verses.sanskrit: तवां हि षमा चर्षणयो यज्ञेभिर्गीर्भिरीळते तवां वाजी यात्यव्र्को रजस्तूर्विश्वचर्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ hi ṣmā carṣaṇayo yajñebhirghīrbhirīḷate tvāṃ vājī yātyavṛko rajastūrviśvacarṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: For, verily, men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs.  To thee the Friendly Courser, seen of all, comes speeding through the air.

verses.sanskrit: सजोषस्त्वा दिवो नरो यज्ञस्य केतुमिन्धते यद ध सय मानुषो जनः सुम्नायुर्जुह्वे अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: sajoṣastvā divo naro yajñasya ketumindhate yad dha sya mānuṣo janaḥ sumnāyurjuhve adhvare

translations.griffith: Of one accord men kindle thee Heaven's signal of the sacrifice,  When, craving bliss, this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.

verses.sanskrit: रधद यस्ते सुदानवे धिया मर्तः शशमते ऊती ष बर्हतो दिवो दविषो अंहो न तरति |||
verses.transliteration: ṛdhad yaste sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate ūtī ṣa bṛhato divo dviṣo aṃho na tarati

translations.griffith: Let the man thrive who travails sore, in prayer, far thee the Bountiful.  He with the help of lofty Dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity.

verses.sanskrit: समिधा यस्त आहुतिं निशितिं मर्त्यो नशत वयावन्तंस पुष्यति कषयमग्ने शतायुषम |||
verses.transliteration: samidhā yasta āhutiṃ niśitiṃ martyo naśat vayāvantaṃsa puṣyati kṣayamaghne śatāyuṣam

translations.griffith: The mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee,  Supports a house with many a branch, Agni, to live a hundred years.

verses.sanskrit: तवेषस्ते धूम रण्वति दिवि षञ्छुक्र आततः सूरो न हि दयुता तवं कर्पा पावक रोचसे |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣaste dhūma ṛṇvati divi ṣañchukra ātataḥ sūro na hi dyutā tvaṃ kṛpā pāvaka rocase

translations.griffith: Thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft, and far-extended shines in heaven.  For, Purifier! like the Sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow.

verses.sanskrit: अधा हि विक्ष्वीड्यो.असि परियो नो अतिथिः रण्वः पुरीव जूर्यः सूनुर्न तरययाय्यः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hi vikṣvīḍyo.asi priyo no atithiḥ raṇvaḥ purīva jūryaḥ sūnurna trayayāyyaḥ

translations.griffith: For in men's houses thou must be glorified as a well-loved guest,  Gay like an elder in a fort, claiming protection like a son.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वा हि दरोणे अज्यसे.अग्ने वाजी न कर्त्व्यः परिज्मेवस्वधा गयो.अत्यो न हवार्यः शिशुः |||
verses.transliteration: kratvā hi droṇe ajyase.aghne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ parijmevasvadhā ghayo.atyo na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, like an able steed, art urged by wisdom in the wood.  Thou art like wind; food, home art thou, like a young horse that runs astray.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तया चिदच्युताग्ने पशुर्न यवसे धामा ह यत ते अजर वना वर्श्चन्ति शिक्वसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyā cidacyutāghne paśurna yavase dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ

translations.griffith: E’en things imperishable, thou, O Agni, like a gazing ox,  Eatest, when hosts, Eternal One! of thee the Mighty rend the woods.

verses.sanskrit: वेषि हयध्वरीयतामग्ने होता दमे विशाम सम्र्धो विश्पते कर्णु जुषस्व हव्यमङगिरः |||
verses.transliteration: veṣi hyadhvarīyatāmaghne hotā dame viśām samṛdho viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyamaṅghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, thou enterest as Priest the home of men who sacrifice.  Lord of the people, prosper them. Accept the ofrering, Aṅgiras!

verses.sanskrit: अछा नो मित्रमहो देव देवानग्ने वोचः सुमतिं रोदस्योः वीहि सवस्तिं सुक्षितिं दिवो नॄन दविषो अंहांसि दुरितातरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम |||
verses.transliteration: achā no mitramaho deva devānaghne vocaḥ sumatiṃ rodasyoḥ vīhi svastiṃ sukṣitiṃ divo nṝn dviṣo aṃhāṃsi duritātarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema

translations.griffith: O Agni, God with Mitra's might, call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven.  Bring weal from heaven, that men may dwell securely. May we o’ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o’ercome them, through thy help o’ercome them.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने स कषेषद रतपा रतेजा उरु जयोतिर्नशते देवयुष टे यं तवं मित्रेण वरुणः सजोषा देव पासि तयजसा मर्तमंहः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne sa kṣeṣad ṛtapā ṛtejā uru jyotirnaśate devayuṣ ṭe yaṃ tvaṃ mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣā deva pāsi tyajasā martamaṃhaḥ

translations.griffith: TRUE, guardian of the Law, thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace, O Agni,  Whom thou, as Varuṇa in accord with Mitra, guardest, O God, by banishing his trouble.

verses.sanskrit: ईजे यज्ञेभिह शशमे शमीभिर्र्धद्वारायाग्नये ददाश एवा चन तं यशसामजुष्टिर्नांहो मर्तं नशते न परद्र्प्तिः |||
verses.transliteration: īje yajñebhih śaśame śamībhirṛdhadvārāyāghnaye dadāśa evā cana taṃ yaśasāmajuṣṭirnāṃho martaṃ naśate na pradṛptiḥ

translations.griffith: He hath paid sacrifices, toiled in worship, and offered gifts to wealth-increasing Agni.  Him the displeasure of the famous moves not, outrage and scorn affect not such a mortal.

verses.sanskrit: सूरो न यस्य दर्शतिररेपा भीमा यदेति शुचतस्त आ धीः हेषस्वतः शुरुधो नायमक्तोः कुत्रा चिद रण्वो वसतिर्वनेजाः |||
verses.transliteration: sūro na yasya dṛśatirarepā bhīmā yadeti śucatasta ā dhīḥ heṣasvataḥ śurudho nāyamaktoḥ kutrā cid raṇvo vasatirvanejāḥ

translations.griffith: Bright God, whose look is free from stain like Sūrya's, thou, swift, what time thou earnestly desirest,  Hast gear to give us. Come with joy at evening, where, Child of Wood, thou mayest also tarry.

verses.sanskrit: तिग्मं चिदेम महि वर्पो अस्य भसदश्वो न यमसान आसा विजेहमानः परशुर्न जिह्वां दरविर्न दरावयति दारु धक्षत |||
verses.transliteration: tighmaṃ cidema mahi varpo asya bhasadaśvo na yamasāna āsā vijehamānaḥ paraśurna jihvāṃ dravirna drāvayati dāru dhakṣat

translations.griffith: Fierce is his gait and vast his wondrous body: he champeth like a horse with bit and bridle,  And, darting forth his tongue, as ’twere a hatchet, burning the woods, smelteth them like a smelter.

verses.sanskrit: स इदस्तेव परति धादसिष्यञ्छिशीत तेजो.अयसो न धाराम चित्रध्रजतिररतिर्यो अक्तोर्वेर्न दरुषद्वा रघुपत्मजंहाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa idasteva prati dhādasiṣyañchiśīta tejo.ayaso na dhārām citradhrajatiraratiryo aktorverna druṣadvā raghupatmajaṃhāḥ

translations.griffith: Archer-like, fain toshoot, he sets his arrow, and whets his splendour like the edge of iron:  The messenger of night with brilliant pathway, like a tree-roosting bird of rapid pinion.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं रेभो न परति वस्त उस्राः शोचिषा रारपीति मित्रमहाः नक्तं य ईमरुषो यो दिवा नॄनमर्त्यो अरुषो यो दिवा नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ rebho na prati vasta usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitramahāḥ naktaṃ ya īmaruṣo yo divā nṝnamartyo aruṣo yo divā nṝn

translations.griffith: In beams of morn he clothes him like the singer, and bright as Mitra with his splendour crackles.  Red in the night, by day the men's possession: red, he belongs to men by day, Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो न यस्य विधतो नवीनोद वर्षा रुक्ष ओषधीषु नूनोत घर्णा न यो धरजसा पत्मना यन्ना रोदसी वसुनादं सुपत्नी |||
verses.transliteration: divo na yasya vidhato navīnod vṛṣā rukṣa oṣadhīṣu nūnot ghṛṇā na yo dhrajasā patmanā yannā rodasī vasunādaṃ supatnī

translations.griffith: Like Heaven's when scattering beams his voice was uttered: among the plants the radiant Hero shouted,  Who with his glow in rapid course came hither to fill both worlds, well-wedded Dames, with treasure.

verses.sanskrit: धायोभिर्वा यो युज्येभिरर्कैर्विद्युन न दविद्योत सवेभिःशुष्मैह शर्धो वा यो मरुतां ततक्ष रभुर्न तवेषोरभसानो अद्यौत |||
verses.transliteration: dhāyobhirvā yo yujyebhirarkairvidyun na davidyot svebhiḥśuṣmaih śardho vā yo marutāṃ tatakṣa ṛbhurna tveṣorabhasāno adyaut

translations.griffith: Who, with supporting streams and rays that suit him, hath flashed like lightning with his native vigour.  Like the deft Maker of the band of Maruts, the bright impetuous One hath shone refulgent.

verses.sanskrit: यथा होतर्मनुषो देवताता यज्ञेभिः सूनो सहसो यजासि एवा नो अद्य समना समानानुशन्नग्न उशतो यक्षि देवान |||
verses.transliteration: yathā hotarmanuṣo devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajāsi evā no adya samanā samānānuśannaghna uśato yakṣi devān

translations.griffith: As at man's service of the Gods, Invoker, thou, Son of Strength, dost sacrifice and worship,  So bring for us to-day all Gods together, bring willingly the willing Gods, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: स नो विभावा चक्षणिर्न वस्तोरग्निर्वन्दारु वेद्यश्चनो धात विश्वायुर्यो अम्र्तो मर्त्येषूषर्भुद भूदतिथिर्जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa no vibhāvā cakṣaṇirna vastoraghnirvandāru vedyaścano dhāt viśvāyuryo amṛto martyeṣūṣarbhud bhūdatithirjātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: May Agni, radiant Herald of the morning, meet to be known, accept our praise with favour.  Dear to all life, mid mortal men Immortal, our guest, awake at dawn, is Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: दयावो न यस्य पनयन्त्यभ्वं भासांसि वस्ते सूर्यो न शुक्रः वि य इनोत्यजरः पावको.अश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत पूर्व्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvo na yasya panayantyabhvaṃ bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryo na śukraḥ vi ya inotyajaraḥ pāvako.aśnasya cicchiśnathat pūrvyāṇi

translations.griffith: Whose might the very heavens regard with wonder: bright as the Sun he clothes himself with lustre.  He who sends forth,, Eternal Purifier, hath shattered e’en the ancient works of Aśna.

verses.sanskrit: वद्मा हि सूनो अस्यद्मसद्वा चक्रे अग्निर्जनुषाज्मान्नम स तवं न ऊर्जसन ऊर्जं धा राजेव जेरव्र्के कषेष्यन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: vadmā hi sūno asyadmasadvā cakre aghnirjanuṣājmānnam sa tvaṃ na ūrjasana ūrjaṃ dhā rājeva jeravṛke kṣeṣyantaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou art a Singer, Son! our feast-companion: Agni at birth prepared his food and pathway.  Therefore vouchsafe us strength, O Strength-bestower. Win like a King: foes trouble not thy dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: नितिक्ति यो वारणमन्नमत्ति वायुर्न राष्ट्र्यत्येत्यक्तून तुर्याम यस्त आदिशामरातीरत्यो न हरुतः पततः परिह्रुत |||
verses.transliteration: nitikti yo vāraṇamannamatti vāyurna rāṣṭryatyetyaktūn turyāma yasta ādiśāmarātīratyo na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut

translations.griffith: Even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftness,and overtakes the nights as Vāyu kingdoms.  May we o’ercome those who resist thine orders, like a steed casting down the flying foemen.

verses.sanskrit: आ सूर्यो न भानुमद्भिरर्कैरग्ने ततन्थ रोदसी वि भासा चित्रो नयत परि तमांस्यक्तः शोचिषा पत्मन्नौशिजो न दीयन |||
verses.transliteration: ā sūryo na bhānumadbhirarkairaghne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā citro nayat pari tamāṃsyaktaḥ śociṣā patmannauśijo na dīyan

translations.griffith: Like Sūrya with his fulgent rays, O Agni, thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour.  Decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness, like Auśija, with clear flame swifily flying.

verses.sanskrit: तवां हि मन्द्रतममर्कशोकैर्वव्र्महे महि नः शरोष्यग्ने इन्द्रं न तवा शवसा देवता वायुं पर्णन्ति राधसान्र्तमाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ hi mandratamamarkaśokairvavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣyaghne indraṃ na tvā śavasā devatā vāyuṃ pṛṇanti rādhasānṛtamāḥ

translations.griffith: We have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams' glow: hear our great laud, O Agni.  The best men praise thee as the peer of Indra in strength, mid Gods, like Viyu in thy bounty.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो अग्ने.अव्र्केभिः सवस्ति वेषि रायः पथिभिः पर्ष्यंहः ता सूरिभ्यो गर्णते रासि सुम्नं मदेम शतहिमाःसुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: nū no aghne.avṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣyaṃhaḥ tā sūribhyo ghṛṇate rāsi sumnaṃ madema śatahimāḥsuvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Agni, on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal: save us from sorrow.  Grant chiefs and bard this boon. May we live happy, with hero children, through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: हुवे वः सूनुं सहसो युवानमद्रोघवाचं मतिभिर्यविष्ठम य इन्वति दरविणानि परचेता विश्ववाराणि पुरुवारोध्रुक |||
verses.transliteration: huve vaḥ sūnuṃ sahaso yuvānamadroghavācaṃ matibhiryaviṣṭham ya invati draviṇāni pracetā viśvavārāṇi puruvāroadhruk

translations.griffith: I INVOCATE your Son of Strength, the Youthful, with hymns, the Youngest God, whose speech is guileless;  Sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure, bringer of many boons, devoid of malice.

verses.sanskrit: तवे वसूनि पुर्वणीक होतर्दोषा वस्तोरेरिरे यज्ञियासः कषामेव विश्वा भुवनानि यस्मिन सं सौभगानि दधिरेपावके |||
verses.transliteration: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotardoṣā vastorerire yajñiyāsaḥ kṣāmeva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin saṃ saubhaghāni dadhirepāvake

translations.griffith: At eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts, O Priest of many aspects,  On whom, the Purifier, all things living as on firm. ground their happiness have stablished.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विक्षु परदिवः सीद आसु करत्वा रथीरभवो वार्याणाम अत इनोषि विधते चिकित्वो वयानुषग जातवेदो वसूनि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ vikṣu pradivaḥ sīda āsu kratvā rathīrabhavo vāryāṇām ata inoṣi vidhate cikitvo vyānuṣagh jātavedo vasūni

translations.griffith: Thou from of old hast dwelt among these people, by mental power the charioteer of blessings.  Hence sendest thou, O sapient Jātavedas, to him who serves thee treasures in succession.

verses.sanskrit: यो नः सनुत्यो अभिदासदग्ने यो अन्तरो मित्रमहो वनुष्यात तमजरेभिर्व्र्षभिस्तव सवैस्तपा तपिष्ठ तपसा तपस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ sanutyo abhidāsadaghne yo antaro mitramaho vanuṣyāt tamajarebhirvṛṣabhistava svaistapā tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān

translations.griffith: Agni, whoever secretly attacks us, the neighbour, thou with Mitra's might! who harms us,  Burn him with thine own Steers for ever youthful, burning with burning heat, thou fiercest burner.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते यज्ञेन समिधा य उक्थैरर्केभिः सूनो सहसो ददाशत स मर्त्येष्वम्र्त परचेता राया दयुम्नेन शरवसा वि भाति |||
verses.transliteration: yaste yajñena samidhā ya ukthairarkebhiḥ sūno sahaso dadāśat sa martyeṣvamṛta pracetā rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti

translations.griffith: He who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel, with hymn, O Son of Strength, and chanted praises,  Shines out, Immortal! in the midst of mortals, a sage, with wealth, with splendour and with glory.

verses.sanskrit: स तत कर्धीषितस्तूयमग्ने सप्र्धो बाधस्व सहसा सहस्वान यच्छस्यसे दयुभिरक्तो वचोभिस्तज्जुषस्व जरितुर्घोषि मन्म |||
verses.transliteration: sa tat kṛdhīṣitastūyamaghne spṛdho bādhasva sahasā sahasvān yacchasyase dyubhirakto vacobhistajjuṣasva jariturghoṣi manma

translations.griffith: Do this, O Agni, when we urge thee, quickly, triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen.  When thou art praised with words and decked with brightness, accept this chanted hymn, the singer's worship.

verses.sanskrit: अश्याम तं काममग्ने तवोती अश्याम रयिं रयिवः सुवीरम अश्याम वाजमभि वाजयन्तो.अश्याम दयुम्नमजराजरं ते |||
verses.transliteration: aśyāma taṃ kāmamaghne tavotī aśyāma rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīram aśyāma vājamabhi vājayanto.aśyāma dyumnamajarājaraṃ te

translations.griffith: Help us, that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes.  Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory.

verses.sanskrit: पर नव्यसा सहसः सूनुमछा यज्ञेन गातुमव इछमानः वर्श्चद्वनं कर्ष्णयामं रुशन्तं वीती होतारन्दिव्यं जिगाति |||
verses.transliteration: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnumachā yajñena ghātumava ichamānaḥ vṛścadvanaṃ kṛṣṇayāmaṃ ruśantaṃ vītī hotārandivyaṃ jighāti

translations.griffith: HE who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the Son of Strength with newest worship,  Calling the heavenly Priest to share the banquet, who rends the wood, bright, with his blackened pathway.

verses.sanskrit: स शवितानस्तन्यतू रोचनस्था अजरेभिर्नानदद्भिर्यविष्ठः यः पावकः पुरुतमः पुरूणि पर्थून्यग्निरनुयाति भर्वन |||
verses.transliteration: sa śvitānastanyatū rocanasthā ajarebhirnānadadbhiryaviṣṭhaḥ yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūnyaghniranuyāti bharvan

translations.griffith: White-hued and thundering he dwells in splendour, Most Youthful, with the loudvoiced and eternal-  Agni, most variform, the Purifier, who follows crunching many ample forests.

verses.sanskrit: वि ते विष्वग वातजूतासो अग्ने भामासः शुचे शुचयश्चरन्ति तुविम्रक्षासो दिव्या नवग्वा वना वनन्ति धर्षता रुजन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: vi te viṣvagh vātajūtāso aghne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaścaranti tuvimrakṣāso divyā navaghvā vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ

translations.griffith: Incited by the wind thy flames, O Agni, move onward, Pure One! pure, in all directions.  Thy most destructive heavenly Navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते शुक्रासः शुचयः शुचिष्मः कषां वपन्ति विषितासो अश्वाः अध भरमस्त उर्विया वि भाति यातयमानो अधि सानु पर्श्नेः |||
verses.transliteration: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣāṃ vapanti viṣitāso aśvāḥ adha bhramasta urviyā vi bhāti yātayamāno adhi sānu pṛśneḥ

translations.griffith: Thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened: O Radiant One, they shear the ground beneath them,  And far and wide shines out thy flame, and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges.

verses.sanskrit: अध जिह्वा पापतीति पर वर्ष्णो गोषुयुधो नाशनिः सर्जाना शूरस्येव परसितिः कषातिरग्नेर्दुर्वर्तुर्भीमो दयते वनानि |||
verses.transliteration: adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇo ghoṣuyudho nāśaniḥ sṛjānā śūrasyeva prasitiḥ kṣātiraghnerdurvarturbhīmo dayate vanāni

translations.griffith: Forth darts the Bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle.  Agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset: dread and resistless he destroys the forests.

verses.sanskrit: आ भानुना पार्थिवानि जरयांसि महस्तोदस्य धर्षता ततन्थ स बाधस्वाप भया सहोभि सप्र्धो वनुष्यन वनुषो नि जूर्व |||
verses.transliteration: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṃsi mahastodasya dhṛṣatā tatantha sa bādhasvāpa bhayā sahobhi spṛdho vanuṣyan vanuṣo ni jūrva

translations.griffith: Thou with the sunlight of the great Impeller hast boldly over-spread the earth's expanses.  So drive away with conquering might all perils. fighting out foemen burn up those who harm us.

verses.sanskrit: स चित्र चित्रं चितयन्तमस्मे चित्रक्षत्र चित्रतमं वयोधाम चन्द्रं रयिं पुरुवीरं बर्हन्तं चन्द्र चन्द्राभिर्ग्र्णते युवस्व |||
verses.transliteration: sa citra citraṃ citayantamasme citrakṣatra citratamaṃ vayodhām candraṃ rayiṃ puruvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ candra candrābhirghṛṇate yuvasva

translations.griffith: Wondrous! of wondrous power! give to the singer wealth wondrous, marked, most wonderful, life-giving.  Wealth bright, O Bright One, vast, with many heroes, give with thy bright flames to the man who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit: मूर्धानं दिवो अरतिं पर्थिव्या वैश्वानरं रत आ जातमग्निम कविं सम्राजमतिथिं जनानामासन्ना पात्रं जनयन्त देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratiṃ pṛthivyā vaiśvānaraṃ ṛta ā jātamaghnim kaviṃ samrājamatithiṃ janānāmāsannā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ

translations.griffith: Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaiśvānara, born in holy Order,  The Sage, the King, the guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated.

verses.sanskrit: नाभिं यज्ञानां सदनं रयीणां महामाहावमभिसं नवन्त वैश्वानरं रथ्यमध्वराणां यज्ञस्य केतुं जनयन्त देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: nābhiṃ yajñānāṃ sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ mahāmāhāvamabhisaṃ navanta vaiśvānaraṃ rathyamadhvarāṇāṃ yajñasya ketuṃ janayanta devāḥ

translations.griffith: Him have they praised, mid-point of sacrifices, great cistern of libations, seat of riches.  Vaiśvānara, conveyer of oblations, ensign of worship, have the Gods engendered.

verses.sanskrit: तवद विप्रो जायते वाज्यग्ने तवद वीरासो अभिमातिषाहः वैश्वानर तवमस्मासु धेहि वसूनि राजन सप्र्हयाय्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: tvad vipro jāyate vājyaghne tvad vīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ vaiśvānara tvamasmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi

translations.griffith: From thee, O Agni, springs the mighty singer, from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman.  O King, Vaiśvānara, bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.

verses.sanskrit: तवां विश्वे अम्र्त जायमानं शिशुं न देवा अभि सं नवन्ते तव करतुभिरम्र्तत्वमायन वैश्वानर यत पित्रोरदीदेः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ viśve amṛta jāyamānaṃ śiśuṃ na devā abhi saṃ navante tava kratubhiramṛtatvamāyan vaiśvānara yat pitroradīdeḥ

translations.griffith: To thee, Immortal! when to life thou springest, all the Gods sing for joy as to their infant.  They by thy mental powers were made immortal, Vaiśvānara, when thou shonest from thy Parents.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानर तव तानि वरतानि महान्यग्ने नकिरा दधर्ष यज्जायमानः पित्रोरुपस्थे.अविन्दः केतुं वयुनेष्वह्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahānyaghne nakirā dadharṣa yajjāyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe.avindaḥ ketuṃ vayuneṣvahnām

translations.griffith: Agni Vaiśvānara, no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances,  When thou, arising from thy Parents' bosom, foundest the light for days' appointed courses.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरस्य विमितानि चक्षसा सानूनि दिवो अम्र्तस्य केतुना तस्येदु विश्वा भुवनाधि मूर्धनि वया इव रुरुहुःसप्त विस्रुहः |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divo amṛtasya ketunā tasyedu viśvā bhuvanādhi mūrdhani vayā iva ruruhuḥsapta visruhaḥ

translations.griffith: The summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the Immortal's light, Vaiśvānara's brilliancy.  All creatures in existence rest upon his head. The Seven swift-flowing Streams have grown like branches forth,

verses.sanskrit: वि यो रजांस्यमिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो वि दिवो रोचना कविः परि यो विश्वा भुवनानि पप्रथे.अदब्धो गोपा अम्र्तस्य रक्षिता |||
verses.transliteration: vi yo rajāṃsyamimīta sukraturvaiśvānaro vi divo rocanā kaviḥ pari yo viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe.adabdho ghopā amṛtasya rakṣitā

translations.griffith: Vaiśvānara, who measured out the realms of air, Sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven,  The Undeceivable who spread out all the worlds, keeper is he and guard of immortality.

verses.sanskrit: पर्क्षस्य वर्ष्णो अरुषस्य नू सहः पर नु वोचं विदथाजातवेदसः वैश्वानराय मतिर्नव्यसी शुचिः सोम इवपवते चारुरग्नये |||
verses.transliteration: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇo aruṣasya nū sahaḥ pra nu vocaṃ vidathājātavedasaḥ vaiśvānarāya matirnavyasī śuciḥ soma ivapavate cāruraghnaye

translations.griffith: AT Jātavedas' holy gathering I will tell aloud the conquering might of the swift red-hued Steer.  A pure and fresher hymn flows to Vaiśvānara, even as for Agni lovely Soma is made pure.

verses.sanskrit: स जायमानः परमे वयोमनि वरतान्यग्निर्व्रतपा अरक्षत वयन्तरिक्षममिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो महिना नाकमस्प्र्शत |||
verses.transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratānyaghnirvratapā arakṣata vyantarikṣamamimīta sukraturvaiśvānaro mahinā nākamaspṛśat

translations.griffith: That Agni, when in loftiest heaven he sprang to life, Guardian of Holy Laws, kept and observed them well.  Exceeding wise, he measured out the firmament. Vaiśvānara attained to heaven by mightiness.

verses.sanskrit: वयस्तभ्नाद रोदसी मित्रो अद्भुतो.अन्तर्वावदक्र्णोज्ज्योतिषा तमः वि चर्मणीव धिषणे अवर्तयद वैश्वानरो विश्वमधत्त वर्ष्ण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vyastabhnād rodasī mitro adbhuto.antarvāvadakṛṇojjyotiṣā tamaḥ vi carmaṇīva dhiṣaṇe avartayad vaiśvānaro viśvamadhatta vṛṣṇyam

translations.griffith: Wonderful Mitra propped the heaven and earth apart, and covered and concealed  the darkness with his light.  He made the two bowls part asunder like two skins. Vaiśvānara put forth all his creative power.

verses.sanskrit: अपामुपस्थे महिषा अग्र्भ्णत विशो राजानमुप तस्थुर्र्ग्मियम आ दूतो अग्निमभरद विवस्वतो वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वा परावतः |||
verses.transliteration: apāmupasthe mahiṣā aghṛbhṇata viśo rājānamupa tasthurṛghmiyam ā dūto aghnimabharad vivasvato vaiśvānaraṃ mātariśvā parāvataḥ

translations.griffith: The Migbty seized him in the bosom of the floods: the people waited on the King who should be praised.  As envoy of Vivasvān MatariSvan brought Agni Vaiśvānara hither from far away.

verses.sanskrit: युगे-युगे विदथ्यं गर्णद्भ्यो.अग्ने रयिं यशसं धेहि नव्यसीम पव्येव राजन्नघशंसमजर नीचा नि वर्श्च वनिनं न तेजसा |||
verses.transliteration: yughe-yughe vidathyaṃ ghṛṇadbhyo.aghne rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehi navyasīm pavyeva rājannaghaśaṃsamajara nīcā ni vṛśca vaninaṃ na tejasā

translations.griffith: In every age bestow upon the singers wealth, worthy of holy synods, glorious, ever new.  King, undecaying, as it were with sharpened bolt, smite down the sinner like a tree with lightning-flash.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमग्ने मघवत्सु धारयानामि कषत्रमजरं सुवीर्यम वयं जयेम शतिनं सहस्रिणं वैश्वानर वाजमग्ने तवोतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamaghne maghavatsu dhārayānāmi kṣatramajaraṃ suvīryam vayaṃ jayema śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ vaiśvānara vājamaghne tavotibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Do thou bestow, O Agni, on our wealthy chiefs, rule, with good heroes, undecaying, bending not.  So may we win for us strength. O Vaiśvānara, hundredfold, thousandfold, O Agni, by thy help.

verses.sanskrit: अदब्धेभिस्तव गोपाभिरिष्टे.अस्माकं पाहि तरिषधस्थ सूरीन रक्षा च नो ददुषां शर्धो अग्ने वैश्वानर पर चतारी सतवानः |||
verses.transliteration: adabdhebhistava ghopābhiriṣṭe.asmākaṃ pāhi triṣadhastha sūrīn rakṣā ca no daduṣāṃ śardho aghne vaiśvānara pra catārī stavānaḥ

translations.griffith: O thou who dwellest in three places, Helper, keep with effective guards our princely patrons.  Keep our band, Agni, who have brought thee presents. Lengthen their lives, Vaiśvānara, when lauded.

verses.sanskrit: अहश्च कर्ष्णमहरर्जुनं च वि वर्तेते रजसी वेद्याभिः वैश्वानरो जायमानो न राजावातिरज्ज्योतिषाग्निस्तमांसि |||
verses.transliteration: ahaśca kṛṣṇamahararjunaṃ ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ vaiśvānaro jāyamāno na rājāvātirajjyotiṣāghnistamāṃsi

translations.griffith: ONE half of day is dark, and bright the other: both atmospheres move on by sage devices.  Agni Vaiśvānara, when born as Sovran, hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं तन्तुं न वि जानाम्योतुं न यं वयन्ति समरेऽतमानाः कस्य सवित पुत्र इह वक्त्वानि परो वदात्यवरेण पित्रा |||
verses.transliteration: nāhaṃ tantuṃ na vi jānāmyotuṃ na yaṃ vayanti samare'tamānāḥ kasya svit putra iha vaktvāni paro vadātyavareṇa pitrā

translations.griffith: I know not either warp or woof, I know not the web they weave when moving to the contest.  Whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the Father near him?

verses.sanskrit: स इत तन्तुं स वि जानात्योतुं स वक्त्वान्य रतुथा वदाति य ईं चिकेतदम्र्तस्य गोपा अवश्चरन परो अन्येन पश्यन |||
verses.transliteration: sa it tantuṃ sa vi jānātyotuṃ sa vaktvāny ṛtuthā vadāti ya īṃ ciketadamṛtasya ghopā avaścaran paro anyena paśyan

translations.griffith: For both the warp and woof he understandeth, and in due time shall speak what should be spoken,  Who knoweth as the immortal world's Protector, descending, seeing with no aid from other.

verses.sanskrit: अयं होता परथमः पश्यतेममिदं जयोतिरम्र्तं मर्त्येषु अयं स जज्ञे धरुव आ निषत्तो.अमर्त्यस्तन्वा वर्धमानः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ hotā prathamaḥ paśyatemamidaṃ jyotiramṛtaṃ martyeṣu ayaṃ sa jajñe dhruva ā niṣatto.amartyastanvā vardhamānaḥ

translations.griffith: He is the Priest, the first of all: behold him. Mid mortal men he is the light immortal.  Here was he born, firm-seated in his station Immortal, ever waxing in his body.

verses.sanskrit: धरुवं जयोतिर्निहितं दर्शये कं मनो जविष्ठं पतयत्स्वन्तः विश्वे देवाः समनसः सकेता एकं करतुमभिवि यन्ति साधु |||
verses.transliteration: dhruvaṃ jyotirnihitaṃ dṛśaye kaṃ mano javiṣṭhaṃ patayatsvantaḥ viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ saketā ekaṃ kratumabhivi yanti sādhu

translations.griffith: A firm light hath been set for men to look on: among all things that fly the mind is swiftest.  All Gods of one accord, with one intention, move unobstructed to a single purpose.

verses.sanskrit: वि मे कर्णा पतयतो वि चक्षुर्वीदं जयोतिर्ह्र्दय आहितं यत वि मे मनश्चरति दूराधीः किं सविद वक्ष्यामिकिमु नू मनिष्ये |||
verses.transliteration: vi me karṇā patayato vi cakṣurvīdaṃ jyotirhṛdaya āhitaṃ yat vi me manaścarati dūraādhīḥ kiṃ svid vakṣyāmikimu nū maniṣye

translations.griffith: Mine ears unclose to hear, mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens.  Far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance. What shall I speak, what shall I now imagine?

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवा अनमस्यन भियानास्त्वामग्ने तमसि तस्थिवांसम वैश्वानरो.अवतूतये नो.अमर्त्यो.अवतूतये नः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devā anamasyan bhiyānāstvāmaghne tamasi tasthivāṃsam vaiśvānaro.avatūtaye no.amartyo.avatūtaye naḥ

translations.griffith: All the Gods bowed them down in fear before thee, Agni, when thou wast dwelling in the darkness.  Vaiśvānara be gracious to assist us, may the Immortal favour us and help us.

verses.sanskrit: पुरो वो मन्द्रं दिव्यं सुव्र्क्तिं परयति यज्ञे अग्निमध्वरेदधिध्वम पुर उक्थेभिः स हि नो विभावा सवध्वरा करति जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: puro vo mandraṃ divyaṃ suvṛktiṃ prayati yajñe aghnimadhvaredadhidhvam pura ukthebhiḥ sa hi no vibhāvā svadhvarā karati jātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: INSTALL at sacrifice, while the rite advances, your pleasant, heavenly Agni, meet for praises.  With hymns-for he illumines us-install him. He, Jātavedas, makes our rites successful.

verses.sanskrit: तमु दयुमः पुर्वणीक होतरग्ने अग्निभिर्मनुष इधानः सतोमं यमस्मै ममतेव शूषं घर्तं न शुचि मतयः पवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: tamu dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hotaraghne aghnibhirmanuṣa idhānaḥ stomaṃ yamasmai mamateva śūṣaṃ ghṛtaṃ na śuci matayaḥ pavante

translations.griffith: Hear this laud, Radiant Priest of many aspects, O Agni with the fires of man enkindled,  Laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter, strength to this man, as ’twere for self-advantage.

verses.sanskrit: पीपाय स शरवसा मर्त्येषु यो अग्नये ददाश विप्र उक्थैः चित्राभिस्तमूतिभिश्चित्रशोचिर्व्रजस्य साता गोमतो दधाति |||
verses.transliteration: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yo aghnaye dadāśa vipra ukthaiḥ citrābhistamūtibhiścitraśocirvrajasya sātā ghomato dadhāti

translations.griffith: Mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to Agni,  And the God, wondrous bright, with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.

verses.sanskrit: आ यः पप्रौ जायमान उर्वी दूरेद्र्शा भासा कर्ष्णाध्वा अध बहु चित तम ऊर्म्यायास्तिरः शोचिषा दद्र्शे पावकः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamāna urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇādhvā adha bahu cit tama ūrmyāyāstiraḥ śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ

translations.griffith: He, at his birth, whose path is black behind him, filled heaven and earth with far-apparent splendour:  And he himself hath been. through night's thick darkness, made manifest by light, the Purifier.

verses.sanskrit: नू नश्चित्रं पुरुवाजाभिरूती अग्ने रयिं मघवद्भ्यश्च धेहि ये राधसा शरवसा चात्यन्यान सुवीर्येभिश्चाभि सन्ति जनान |||
verses.transliteration: nū naścitraṃ puruvājābhirūtī aghne rayiṃ maghavadbhyaśca dhehi ye rādhasā śravasā cātyanyān suvīryebhiścābhi santi janān

translations.griffith: With thy most mighty aid, confer, O Agni, wonderful wealth on us and on our princes,  Who stand preeminent, surpassing others in liberal gifts, in fame, and hero virtues.

verses.sanskrit: इमं यज्ञं चनो धा अग्न उशन यं त आसानो जुहुते हविष्मान भरद्वाजेषु दधिषे सुव्र्क्तिमवीर्वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ cano dhā aghna uśan yaṃ ta āsāno juhute haviṣmān bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktimavīrvājasya ghadhyasya sātau

translations.griffith: Agni, accept this sacrifice with gladness, which, seated here, the worshipper presenteth.  Fair hymns hadst thou among the Bharadvājas, and holpest them to gain abundant vigour.

verses.sanskrit: वि दवेषांसीनुहि वर्धयेळां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
verses.transliteration: vi dveṣāṃsīnuhi vardhayeḷāṃ madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Scatter our foes, increase our store. May we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons.

verses.sanskrit: यजस्व होतरिषितो यजीयानग्ने बाधो मरुतां न परयुक्ति आ नो मित्रावरुणा नासत्या दयावा होत्राय पर्थिवी वव्र्त्याः |||
verses.transliteration: yajasva hotariṣito yajīyānaghne bādho marutāṃ na prayukti ā no mitrāvaruṇā nāsatyā dyāvā hotrāya pṛthivī vavṛtyāḥ

translations.griffith: EAGERLY Sacrifice thou, most skilful, Agni! Priest, pressing on as if the Maruts sent thee.  To our oblation bring the two Nāsatyas, Mitra and Varuṇa and Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तवं होता मन्द्रतमो नो अध्रुगन्तर्देवो विदथा मर्त्येषु पावकया जुह्वा वह्निरासाग्ने यजस्व तन्वं तव सवाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hotā mandratamo no adhrughantardevo vidathā martyeṣu pāvakayā juhvā vahnirāsāghne yajasva tanvaṃ tava svām

translations.griffith: Thou art our guileless, most delightful Herald, the God, among mankind, of holy synods.  A Priest with purifying tongue, O Agni, sacrifice with thy mouth to thine own body.

verses.sanskrit: धन्या चिद धि तवे धिषणा वष्टि पर देवाञ जन्म गर्णते यजध्यै वेपिष्ठो अङगिरसां यद ध विप्रो मधु छन्दो भनति रेभ इष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: dhanyā cid dhi tve dhiṣaṇā vaṣṭi pra devāñ janma ghṛṇate yajadhyai vepiṣṭho aṅghirasāṃ yad dha vipro madhu chando bhanati rebha iṣṭau

translations.griffith: For even the blessed longing that is in thee would bring the Gods down to the singer's worship,  When the Aṅgirases' sagest Sage, the Poet, sings the sweet measure at the solemn service.

verses.sanskrit: अदिद्युतत सवपाको विभावाग्ने यजस्व रोदसी उरूची आयुं न यं नमसा रातहव्या अञ्जन्ति सुप्रयसं पञ्च जनाः |||
verses.transliteration: adidyutat svapāko vibhāvāghne yajasva rodasī urūcī āyuṃ na yaṃ namasā rātahavyā añjanti suprayasaṃ pañca janāḥ

translations.griffith: Bright hath he beamed, the wise, the far-refulgent. Worship the two widespreading Worlds, O Agni,  Whom as the Living One rich in oblations the Five Tribes, bringing gifts, adorn with homage.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ञ्जे ह यन नमसा बर्हिरग्नावयामि सरुग घर्तवती सुव्र्क्तिः अम्यक्षि सद्म सदने पर्थिव्या अश्रायि यज्ञः सूर्ये न चक्षुः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛñje ha yan namasā barhiraghnāvayāmi srugh ghṛtavatī suvṛktiḥ amyakṣi sadma sadane pṛthivyā aśrāyi yajñaḥ sūrye na cakṣuḥ

translations.griffith: When I with reverence clip the grass for Agni, when the trimmed ladle, fullof oil, is lifted,  Firm on the seat of earth is based the altar: eye-like, the sacrifice is directed Sun-ward.

verses.sanskrit: दशस्या नः पुर्वणीक होतर्देवेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिधानः रायः सूनो सहसो वावसाना अति सरसेम वर्जनं नांहः |||
verses.transliteration: daśasyā naḥ purvaṇīka hotardevebhiraghne aghnibhiridhānaḥ rāyaḥ sūno sahaso vāvasānā ati srasema vṛjanaṃ nāṃhaḥ

translations.griffith: Enrich us, O thou Priest of many aspects, with the Gods, Agni, with thy fires, enkindled.  O Son of Strength, clad in the robe of riches, may we escape from woe as from  a prison.

verses.sanskrit: मध्ये होता दुरोणे बर्हिषो राळ अग्निस्तोदस्य रोदसी यजध्यै अयं स सूनुः सहस रतावा दूरात सूर्यो न शोचिषा ततान |||
verses.transliteration: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣo rāḷ aghnistodasya rodasī yajadhyai ayaṃ sa sūnuḥ sahasa ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryo na śociṣā tatāna

translations.griffith: KING of trimmed grass, Herald within the dwelling, may Agni worship the Impeller's World-halves.  He, Son of Strength, the Holy, from a distance hath spread himself abroad with light like Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्मिन तवे सवपाके यजत्र यक्षद राजन सर्वतातेव नुद्यौः तरिषधस्थस्ततरुषो न जंहो हव्या मघानि मानुषा यजध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: ā yasmin tve svapāke yajatra yakṣad rājan sarvatāteva nudyauḥ triṣadhasthastataruṣo na jaṃho havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai

translations.griffith: In thee, most wise, shall Dyaus, for full perfection, King! Holy One! pronounce the call to worship.  Found in three places, like the Speeder's footstep, come to present men's riches as oblations!

verses.sanskrit: तेजिष्ठा यस्यारतिर्वनेराट तोदो अध्वन न वर्धसानो अद्यौत अद्रोघो न दरविता चेतति तमन्नमर्त्यो.अवर्त्र ओषधीषु |||
verses.transliteration: tejiṣṭhā yasyāratirvanerāṭ todo adhvan na vṛdhasāno adyaut adrogho na dravitā cetati tmannamartyo.avartra oṣadhīṣu

translations.griffith: Whose blaze most splendid, sovran in the forest, shines waxing on his way like the - Impeller.  He knows himself, like as a guileless smelter, not to be stayed among the plants, Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: सास्माकेभिरेतरी न शूषैरग्नि षटवे दम आ जातवेदाः दर्वन्नो वन्वन करत्वा नार्वोस्रः पितेव जारयायि यज्ञैः |||
verses.transliteration: sāsmākebhiretarī na śūṣairaghni ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ drvanno vanvan kratvā nārvosraḥ piteva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ

translations.griffith: Our friends extol him like a steed for vigour even Agni in the dwelling, jatave~as.  Trce-fed, he fights with power as doth a champion, like Dawn's Sire to be praised with sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: अध समास्य पनयन्ति भासो वर्था यत तक्षदनुयाति पर्थ्वीम सद्यो यः सयन्द्रो विषितो धवीयान रणो न तायुरति धन्वा राट |||
verses.transliteration: adha smāsya panayanti bhāso vṛthā yat takṣadanuyāti pṛthvīm sadyo yaḥ syandro viṣito dhavīyān ṛṇo na tāyurati dhanvā rāṭ

translations.griffith: Men wonder at his shining glows when, paring the woods with case, o’er the broad earth he goeth,  And, like a rushing flood, loosed quickly, burneth, swift as a guilty thief, o’er desert places.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं नो अर्वन निदाया विश्वेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिधानः वेषि रायो वि यासि दुछुना मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ no arvan nidāyā viśvebhiraghne aghnibhiridhānaḥ veṣi rāyo vi yāsi duchunā madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: So mighty thou protectest us from slander, O Champion, Agni! with all fires enkindled.  Bring opulence and drive away affliction. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: तवद विश्वा सुभग सौभगान्यग्ने वि यन्ति वनिनो न वयाः शरुष्टी रयिर्वाजो वर्त्रतूर्ये दिवो वर्ष्टिरीड्यो रीतिरपाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvad viśvā subhagha saubhaghānyaghne vi yanti vanino na vayāḥ śruṣṭī rayirvājo vṛtratūrye divo vṛṣṭirīḍyo rītirapām

translations.griffith: FROM thee, as branches from a tree, O Agni, from thee, Auspicious God! spring all our blessings-  Wealth swiftly, strength in battle with our foemen, the rain besought of heaven, the flow of waters.

verses.sanskrit: तवं भगो न आ हि रत्नमिषे परिज्मेव कषयसि दस्मवर्चाः अग्ने मित्रो न बर्हत रतस्यासि कषत्ता वामस्य देव भूरेः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ bhagho na ā hi ratnamiṣe parijmeva kṣayasi dasmavarcāḥ aghne mitro na bṛhata ṛtasyāsi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ

translations.griffith: Thou art our Bhaga to send wealth thou dwellest, like circumambient air, with wondrous splendour.  Friend art thou of the lofty Law, like Mitra, Controller, Agni! God! of many a blessing.

verses.sanskrit: स सत्पतिः शवसा हन्ति वर्त्रमग्ने विप्रो वि पणेर्भर्तिवाजम यं तवं परचेत रतजात राया सजोषा नप्त्रापां हिनोषि |||
verses.transliteration: sa satpatiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtramaghne vipro vi paṇerbhartivājam yaṃ tvaṃ praceta ṛtajāta rāyā sajoṣā naptrāpāṃ hinoṣi

translations.griffith: Agni! the hero slays with might his foeman; the singer bears away the Paṇi's booty-  Even he whom thou, Sage, born in Law, incitest by wealth, accordant with the Child of Waters.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैर्यज्ञैर्मर्तो निशितिं वेद्यानट विश्वं स देव परति वारमग्ने धत्ते धान्यं पत्यते वसव्यैः |||
verses.transliteration: yaste sūno sahaso ghīrbhirukthairyajñairmarto niśitiṃ vedyānaṭ viśvaṃ sa deva prati vāramaghne dhatte dhānyaṃ patyate vasavyaiḥ

translations.griffith: The man who, Son of Strength 1 with sacrifices, hymns, lauds, attracts thy fervour to the altar,  Enjoys each precious thing, O God, O Agni, gains wealth of corn and is the lord of treasures.

verses.sanskrit: ता नर्भ्य आ सौश्रवसा सुवीराग्ने सूनो सहसः पुष्यसेधाः कर्णोषि यच्छवसा भूरि पश्वो वयो वर्कायारयेजसुरये |||
verses.transliteration: tā nṛbhya ā sauśravasā suvīrāghne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyasedhāḥ kṛṇoṣi yacchavasā bhūri paśvo vayo vṛkāyārayejasuraye

translations.griffith: Grant, Son of Strength, to men for their subsistence such things as bring high fame and hero children.  For thou with might givest much food in cattle even to the wicked wolf when he is hungry.

verses.sanskrit: वद्मा सूनो सहसो नो विहाया अग्ने तोकं तनयं वाजि नो दाः विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरभि पूर्तिमश्यां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: vadmā sūno sahaso no vihāyā aghne tokaṃ tanayaṃ vāji no dāḥ viśvābhirghīrbhirabhi pūrtimaśyāṃ madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Eloquent, Son of Strength, Most Mighty, Agni, vouchsafe us seed and offspring, full of vigour.  May I by all my songs obtain abundance. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ना यो मर्त्यो दुवो धियं जुजोष धीतिभिः भसन नुष पर पूर्व्य इषं वुरीतावसे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnā yo martyo duvo dhiyaṃ jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ bhasan nuṣa pra pūrvya iṣaṃ vurītāvase

translations.griffith: WHOSO to Agni hath endeared his thought and service by his hymns,  That mortal cats before the rest, and finds sufficiency of food.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरिद धि परचेता अग्निर्वेधस्तम रषिः अग्निं होतारमीळते यज्ञेषु मनुषो विशः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirid dhi pracetā aghnirvedhastama ṛṣiḥ aghniṃ hotāramīḷate yajñeṣu manuṣo viśaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, in truth, is passing wise, most skilled in ordering, a Seer.  At sacrifices Manus' sons glorify Agni as their Priest.

verses.sanskrit: नाना हयग्ने.अवसे सपर्धन्ते रायो अर्यः तूर्वन्तो दस्युमायवो वरतैः सीक्षन्तो अव्रतम |||
verses.transliteration: nānā hyaghne.avase spardhante rāyo aryaḥ tūrvanto dasyumāyavo vrataiḥ sīkṣanto avratam

translations.griffith: The foeman's wealth in many a place, Agni, is emulous to help.  Men fight the fiend, and seek by rites to overcome the riteless foe.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरप्सां रतीषहं वीरं ददाति सत्पतिम यस्य तरसन्ति शवसः संचक्षि शत्रवो भिया |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirapsāṃ ṛtīṣahaṃ vīraṃ dadāti satpatim yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṃcakṣi śatravo bhiyā

translations.griffith: Agni bestows the hero chief, winner of waters, firm in fray.  Soon as they look upon his might his enemies tremble in alarm.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्हि विद्मना निदो देवो मर्तमुरुष्यति सहावा यस्याव्र्तो रयिर्वाजेष्वव्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirhi vidmanā nido devo martamuruṣyati sahāvā yasyāvṛto rayirvājeṣvavṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: For with his wisdom Agni, God, protects the mortal from reproach,  Whose conquering wealth is never checked, is never checked in deeds of might.

verses.sanskrit: अछा नो मित्रमहो ... ||
verses.transliteration: achā no mitramaho ...

translations.griffith: O Agni, God with Mitra's might call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven.  Bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely. May we o’ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o’ercome them, through thy help o’ercome them.

verses.sanskrit: इममू षु वो अतिथिमुषर्बुधं विश्वासां विशां पतिम्र्ञ्जसे गिरा वेतीद दिवो जनुषा कच्चिदा शुचिर्ज्योक चिदत्ति गर्भो यदच्युतम |||
verses.transliteration: imamū ṣu vo atithimuṣarbudhaṃ viśvāsāṃ viśāṃ patimṛñjase ghirā vetīd divo januṣā kaccidā śucirjyok cidatti gharbho yadacyutam

translations.griffith: WITH this my song I strive to reach this guest of yours, who wakes at early morn, the Lord of all the tribes.  Each time he comes from heaven, the Pure One from of old: from ancient days the Child cats everlasting food.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रं न यं सुधितं भर्गवो दधुर्वनस्पतावीड्यमूर्ध्वशोचिषम स तवं सुप्रीतो वीतहव्ये अद्भुत परशस्तिभिर्महयसे दिवे दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: mitraṃ na yaṃ sudhitaṃ bhṛghavo dadhurvanaspatāvīḍyamūrdhvaśociṣam sa tvaṃ suprīto vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhirmahayase dive dive

translations.griffith: Whom, well-dis sed, the Blirgus stablished as a rriend, whom men must glorify, high-flaming in the wood.  As such, most friendly, thou art every day extolled in lauds by Vitahavya, O thou wondrous God.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं दक्षस्याव्र्को वर्धो भूरर्यः परस्यान्तरस्य तरुषः रायः सूनो सहसो मर्त्येष्वा छर्दिर्यछ वीतहव्याय सप्रथो भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ dakṣasyāvṛko vṛdho bhūraryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ rāyaḥ sūno sahaso martyeṣvā chardiryacha vītahavyāya sapratho bharadvājāya saprathaḥ

translations.griffith: Be thou the foeless helper of the skilful man, subduer of the enemy near or far away.  Bestow a wealthy home on men, O Son of Strength. Give Vitahavya riches spreading far and wide, give Bharadvāja wide-spread wealth.

verses.sanskrit: दयुतानं वो अतिथिं सवर्णरमग्निं होतारं मनुषः सवध्वरम विप्रं न दयुक्षवचसं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्हव्यवाहमरतिं देवं रञ्जसे |||
verses.transliteration: dyutānaṃ vo atithiṃ svarṇaramaghniṃ hotāraṃ manuṣaḥ svadhvaram vipraṃ na dyukṣavacasaṃ suvṛktibhirhavyavāhamaratiṃ devaṃ ṛñjase

translations.griffith: Him, your refulgent guest, Agni who comes from heaven, the Herald of mankind, well-skilled in sacred rites,  Who, like a holy singer, utters heavenly words, oblation-bearer, envoy, God, I seek with hymns.

verses.sanskrit: पावकया यश्चितयन्त्या कर्पा कषामन रुरुच उषसो न भानुना तूर्वन न यामन्नेतशस्य नू रण आ यो घर्णे न तत्र्षाणो अजरः |||
verses.transliteration: pāvakayā yaścitayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā tūrvan na yāmannetaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ

translations.griffith: Who with his purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon the earth as with the light of Dawn;  Who speeding on, as in the fight of Etaia, cometh, untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निम-अग्निं वः समिधा दुवस्यत परियम-परियं वो अतिथिं गर्णीषणि उप वो गीर्भिरम्र्तं विवासत देवो देवेषु वनते हि वार्यं देवो देवेषु वनते हि नो दुवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnim-aghniṃ vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyam-priyaṃ vo atithiṃ ghṛṇīṣaṇi upa vo ghīrbhiramṛtaṃ vivāsata devo deveṣu vanate hi vāryaṃ devo deveṣu vanate hi no duvaḥ

translations.griffith: Worship ye Agni, Agni, with your log of wood; praise your beloved, your beloved guest with songs.  Invite ye the Immortal hither with your hymns. A God among the Gods, he loveth what is choice, loveth our service, God mid Gods.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धमग्निं समिधा गिरा गर्णे शुचिं पावकं पुरो अध्वरे धरुवम विप्रं होतारं पुरुवारमद्रुहं कविं सुम्नैरीमहे जातवेदसम |||
verses.transliteration: samiddhamaghniṃ samidhā ghirā ghṛṇe śuciṃ pāvakaṃ puro adhvare dhruvam vipraṃ hotāraṃ puruvāramadruhaṃ kaviṃ sumnairīmahe jātavedasam

translations.griffith: Agni inflamed with fuel in my song I sing, pure, Cleanser, steadlast, set in tront at sacrifice.  Wise Jātavedas we implore with prayers for bliss the Priest, the holy Singer, bounteous, void of guile.

verses.sanskrit: तवां दूतमग्ने अम्र्तं युगे-युगे हव्यवाहं दधिरे पायुमीड्यम देवासश्च मर्तासश्च जाग्र्विं विभुं विश्पतिं नमसा नि षेदिरे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ dūtamaghne amṛtaṃ yughe-yughe havyavāhaṃ dadhire pāyumīḍyam devāsaśca martāsaśca jāghṛviṃ vibhuṃ viśpatiṃ namasā ni ṣedire

translations.griffith: Men, Agni, in each age have made thee, Deathiess One, their envoy, offering-bearer, guard adorable.  With reverence Gods and mortals have established thee, the ever-watchful, omnipresent Household Lord.

verses.sanskrit: विभूषन्नग्न उभयाननु वरता दूतो देवानां रजसी समीयसे यत ते धीतिं सुमतिमाव्र्णीमहे.अध समा नस्त्रिवरूथः शिवो भव |||
verses.transliteration: vibhūṣannaghna ubhayānanu vratā dūto devānāṃ rajasī samīyase yat te dhītiṃ sumatimāvṛṇīmahe.adha smā nastrivarūthaḥ śivo bhava

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, ordering the works and ways of both, as envoy of the Gods traversest both the worlds.  When we lay claim to thy regard and gracious fare, be thou to us a thriceprotecting friendly guard.

verses.sanskrit: तं सुप्रतीकं सुद्र्शं सवञ्चमविद्वांसो विदुष्टरं सपेम स यक्षद विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान पर हव्यमग्निरम्र्तेषु वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ supratīkaṃ sudṛśaṃ svañcamavidvāṃso viduṣṭaraṃ sapema sa yakṣad viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyamaghniramṛteṣu vocat

translations.griffith: Him fair of face, rapid, and fair to look on, him very wise may we who know not follow.  Let him who knows all rules invite for worship, Agru announce our offering to the Immortals.

verses.sanskrit: तमग्ने पास्युत तं पिपर्षि यस्त आनट कवये शूर धीतिम यज्ञस्य वा निशितिं वोदितिं वा तमित पर्णक्षि शवसोत राया |||
verses.transliteration: tamaghne pāsyuta taṃ piparṣi yasta ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim yajñasya vā niśitiṃ voditiṃ vā tamit pṛṇakṣi śavasota rāyā

translations.griffith: Him, Agni, thou deliverest and savest who brings him prayer to thee the Wise, O Hero,  The end of sacrifice or its inception; yea, thou endowest him with power and riches.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वनुष्यतो नि पाहि तवमु नः सहसावन्नवद्यात सं तवा धवस्मन्वदभ्येतु पाथः सं रयि सप्र्हयाय्यःसहस्री |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvamu naḥ sahasāvannavadyāt saṃ tvā dhvasmanvadabhyetu pāthaḥ saṃ rayi spṛhayāyyaḥsahasrī

translations.griffith: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us, O thou Victor, from dishonour.  Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable in thousands.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्होता गर्हपतिः स राजा विश्वा वेद जनिमा जातवेदः देवानामुत यो मर्त्यानां यजिष्ठः स पर यजतां रतावा |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirhotā ghṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedaḥ devānāmuta yo martyānāṃ yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatāṃ ṛtāvā

translations.griffith: Agni, the Priest, is King, Lord of the homestead, he, Jatayedas, knows all generations.  Most skilful worshipper mid Gods and mortals, may he begin the sacrifice, the Holy.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने यदद्य विशो अध्वरस्य होतः पावकशोचे वेष टवं हि यज्वा रता यजासि महिना वि यद भूर्हव्या वह यविष्ठ या ते अद्य |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yadadya viśo adhvarasya hotaḥ pāvakaśoce veṣ ṭvaṃ hi yajvā ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yad bhūrhavyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya

translations.griffith: Whate’er to-day thou, bright-flamed Priest, enjoyest from the man's rite-for thou art sacrificer-  Worship, for duly dost thou spread in greatness: bear off thine ofrerings of to-day, Most Youthful.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परयांसि सुधितानि हि खयो नि तवा दधीत रोदसी यजध्यै अवा नो मघवन वाजसातावग्ने विश्वानि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyo ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai avā no maghavan vājasātāvaghne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema

translations.griffith: Look thou upon the viands duly laid for thee. Fain would he set thee here to worship Heaven and,Earth.  Help us, O liberal Agni, in the strife for spoil, so that we may o’ercome all things that trouble us, o’ercome, o’ercome them with thy help.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने विश्वेभिः सवनीक देवैरूर्णावन्तं परथमः सीद योनिम कुलायिनं घर्तवन्तं सवित्रे यज्ञं नय यजमानाय साधु |||
verses.transliteration: aghne viśvebhiḥ svanīka devairūrṇāvantaṃ prathamaḥ sīda yonim kulāyinaṃ ghṛtavantaṃ savitre yajñaṃ naya yajamānāya sādhu

translations.griffith: Together with all Gods, O fair-faced Agni, be seated first upon the woollined altar,  Nest-like, bedewed with oil. Bear this our worship to Savitar who sacrifices rightly.

verses.sanskrit: इममु तयमथर्ववदग्निं मन्थन्ति वेधसः यमङकूयन्तमानयन्नमूरं शयाव्याभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: imamu tyamatharvavadaghniṃ manthanti vedhasaḥ yamaṅkūyantamānayannamūraṃ śyāvyābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Here the arranging priests, as did Atharvan, rub this Agni forth,  Whom, not bewildered, as he moved in winding ways, they brought from gloom.

verses.sanskrit: जनिष्वा देववीतये सर्वताता सवस्तये आ देवान वक्ष्यम्र्तान रताव्र्धो यज्ञं देवेषु पिस्प्र्शः |||
verses.transliteration: janiṣvā devavītaye sarvatātā svastaye ā devān vakṣyamṛtān ṛtāvṛdho yajñaṃ deveṣu pispṛśaḥ

translations.griffith: For the Gods’ banquet be thou born, for full perfection and for weal.  Bring the Immortal Gods who strengthen holy Law: so let our sacrifice reach the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: वयमु तवा गर्हपते जनानामग्ने अकर्म समिधा बर्हन्तम अस्थूरि नो गार्हपत्यानि सन्तु तिग्मेन नस्तेजसा सं शिशाधि |||
verses.transliteration: vayamu tvā ghṛhapate janānāmaghne akarma samidhā bṛhantam asthūri no ghārhapatyāni santu tighmena nastejasā saṃ śiśādhi

translations.griffith: O Agni, Lord and Master of men's homesteads, with kindled fuel we have made thee mighty.  Let not our household gear be found defective. Sharpen us with thy penetrating splendour.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने यज्ञानां होता विश्वेषां हितः देवेभिर्मानुषे जने |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne yajñānāṃ hotā viśveṣāṃ hitaḥ devebhirmānuṣe jane

translations.griffith: PRIEST of all sacrifices hast thou been appointed by the Gods,  Agni, amid the race of man.

verses.sanskrit: स नो मन्द्राभिरध्वरे जिह्वाभिर्यजा महः आ देवान वक्षि यक्षि च |||
verses.transliteration: sa no mandrābhiradhvare jihvābhiryajā mahaḥ ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca

translations.griffith: So with thy joyous tongues for us sacrifice nobly in this rite.  Bring thou the Gods and worship them.

verses.sanskrit: वेत्था हि वेधो अध्वनः पथश्च देवाञ्जसा अग्ने यज्ञेषु सुक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: vetthā hi vedho adhvanaḥ pathaśca devāñjasā aghne yajñeṣu sukrato

translations.griffith: For well, O God, Disposer, thou knowest, straight on, the paths and ways,  Agni, most wise in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तवामीळे अध दविता भरतो वाजिभिः शुनम ईजे यज्ञेयत दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmīḷe adha dvitā bharato vājibhiḥ śunam īje yajñeayat divi

translations.griffith: Thee, too, hath Bhārata of old, with mighty men, implored for bliss.  And worshipped thee the worshipful.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिमा वार्या पुरु दिवोदासाय सुन्वते भरद्वाजाय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: tvamimā vāryā puru divodāsāya sunvate bharadvājāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Thou givest these abundant boons to Divodāsa pouring forth,  To Bharadvāja offering gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तवं दूतो अमर्त्य आ वहा दैव्यं जनम शर्ण्वन विप्रस्य सुष्टुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dūto amartya ā vahā daivyaṃ janam śṛṇvan viprasya suṣṭutim

translations.griffith: Do thou, Immortal Messenger, bring hither the Celestial Folk;  Hearing the singer's eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने सवाध्यो मर्तासो देव वीतये यज्ञेषु देवमीळते |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne svādhyo martāso deva vītaye yajñeṣu devamīḷate

translations.griffith: Mortals with pious thought implore thee, Agni, God, at holy rites,  To come unto the feast of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तव पर यक्षि सन्द्र्शमुत करतुं सुदानवः विश्वे जुषन्त कामिनः |||
verses.transliteration: tava pra yakṣi sandṛśamuta kratuṃ sudānavaḥ viśve juṣanta kāminaḥ

translations.griffith: I glorify thine aspect and the might of thee the Bountilul.  All those who love shall joy in thee,

verses.sanskrit: तवं होता मनुर्हितो वह्निरासा विदुष्टरः अग्ने यक्षिदिवो विशः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hotā manurhito vahnirāsā viduṣṭaraḥ aghne yakṣidivo viśaḥ

translations.griffith: Invoker placed by Manus, thou, Agni, art near, the wisest Priest:  Pay worship to the Tribes of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न आ याहि वीतये गर्णानो हव्यदातये नि होता सत्सि बर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: aghna ā yāhi vītaye ghṛṇāno havyadātaye ni hotā satsi barhiṣi

translations.griffith: Come, Agni, lauded, to the feast; come to the offering of the gifts.  As Priest be seated on the grass.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा समिद्भिरङगिरो घर्तेन वर्धयामसि बर्हच्छोचा यविष्ठ्य |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā samidbhiraṅghiro ghṛtena vardhayāmasi bṛhacchocā yaviṣṭhya

translations.griffith: So, Aṅgiras, we make thee strong with fuel and with holy oil.  Blaze high, thou youngest of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पर्थु शरवाय्यमछा देव विवाससि बर्हदग्ने सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pṛthu śravāyyamachā deva vivāsasi bṛhadaghne suvīryam

translations.griffith: For us thou winnest, Agni, God, heroic strength exceeding great,  Far-spreading and of high renown.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने पुष्करादध्यथर्वा निरमन्थत मूर्ध्नो विश्वस्य वाघतः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne puṣkarādadhyatharvā niramanthata mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, Atharvan brought thee forth, by rubbing, from the lotus-flower,  The head of Visva, of the Priest.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा दध्यंं रषिः पुत्र ईधे अथर्वणः वर्त्रहणं पुरन्दरम |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā dadhyaṃṃ ṛṣiḥ putra īdhe atharvaṇaḥ vṛtrahaṇaṃ purandaram

translations.griffith: Thee. Vṛtra's slayer, breaker down of castles, hath Atharvan's son,  Dadhyac the Ṛṣi, lighted up.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा पाथ्यो वर्षा समीधे दस्युहन्तमम धनंजयं रणे-रणे |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā pāthyo vṛṣā samīdhe dasyuhantamam dhanaṃjayaṃ raṇe-raṇe

translations.griffith: The hero Pathya kindled thee the Dasyus'. most destructive foe,  Winner of spoil in every fight.

verses.sanskrit: एह्यू षु बरवाणि ते.अग्न इत्थेतरा गिरः एभिर्वर्धास इन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ehyū ṣu bravāṇi te.aghna itthetarā ghiraḥ ebhirvardhāsa indubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Come, here, O Agni, will I sing verily other songs to thee,  And with these drops shalt thou grow strong.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र कव च ते मनो दक्षं दधस उत्तरम तत्रा सदः कर्णवसे |||
verses.transliteration: yatra kva ca te mano dakṣaṃ dadhasa uttaram tatrā sadaḥ kṛṇavase

translations.griffith: Where’er thy mind applies itself, vigour preeminent hast thou:  There wilt thou gain a dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit: नहि ते पूर्तमक्षिपद भुवन नेमानां वसो अथा दुवो वनवसे |||
verses.transliteration: nahi te pūrtamakṣipad bhuvan nemānāṃ vaso athā duvo vanavase

translations.griffith: Not for a moment only lasts thy bounty, good to many a one!  Our service therefore shalt thou gain.

verses.sanskrit: आग्निरगामि भारतो वर्त्रहा पुरुचेतनः दिवोदासस्य सत्पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: āghniraghāmi bhārato vṛtrahā purucetanaḥ divodāsasya satpatiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, the Bhārata, hath been sought, the Vṛtra-slayer, marked of all,  Yea, Divodāsa's Hero Lord.

verses.sanskrit: स हि विश्वाति पार्थिवा रयिं दाशन महित्वना वन्वन्नवातो अस्त्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi viśvāti pārthivā rayiṃ dāśan mahitvanā vanvannavāto astṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: For he gave riches that surpass in greatness all the things of earth,  Fighting untroubled, unsubdued.

verses.sanskrit: स परत्नवन नवीयसाग्ने दयुम्नेन संयता बर्हत ततन्थभानुना |||
verses.transliteration: sa pratnavan navīyasāghne dyumnena saṃyatā bṛhat tatanthabhānunā

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, as in days of old, with recent glory, gathered light,  Hast overspread the lofty heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः सखायो अग्नये सतोमं यज्ञं च धर्ष्णुया अर्चगाय च वेधसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ sakhāyo aghnaye stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā arcaghāya ca vedhase

translations.griffith: Bring to your Agni, O my friends, boldly your laud and sacrifice:  Give the Disposer praise and song.

verses.sanskrit: स हि यो मानुषा युगा सीदद धोता कविक्रतुः दूतश्च हव्यवाहनः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi yo mānuṣā yughā sīdad dhotā kavikratuḥ dūtaśca havyavāhanaḥ

translations.griffith: For as sagacious Herald he hath sat through every age of man,  Oblation-bearing messenger.

verses.sanskrit: ता राजाना शुचिव्रतादित्यान मारुतं गणम वसो यक्षीह रोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: tā rājānā śucivratādityān mārutaṃ ghaṇam vaso yakṣīha rodasī

translations.griffith: Bring those Two Kings whose ways are pure, Ādityas, and the Marut host,  Excellent God! and Heaven and Earth.

verses.sanskrit: वस्वी ते अग्ने सन्द्र्ष्टिरिषयते मर्त्याय ऊर्जो नपादम्र्तस्य |||
verses.transliteration: vasvī te aghne sandṛṣṭiriṣayate martyāya ūrjo napādamṛtasya

translations.griffith: For strong and active mortal man, excellent, Agni, is the look Of thee Immortal, Son of Strength

verses.sanskrit: करत्वा दा अस्तु शरेष्ठो.अद्य तवा वन्वन सुरेक्णाः मर्त आनाश सुव्र्क्तिम |||
verses.transliteration: kratvā dā astu śreṣṭho.adya tvā vanvan surekṇāḥ marta ānāśa suvṛktim

translations.griffith: Rich through his wisdom, noblest be the giver serving thee to-day:  The man hath brought his hymn of praise.

verses.sanskrit: ते ते अग्ने तवोता इषयन्तो विश्वमायुः तरन्तो अर्यो अरातीर्वन्वन्तो अर्यो अरातीः |||
verses.transliteration: te te aghne tvotā iṣayanto viśvamāyuḥ taranto aryo arātīrvanvanto aryo arātīḥ

translations.griffith: These, Agni, these are helped by thee, who strong and active all their lives,  O'ercome the malice of the foe, fight down the malice ofthe foe.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निस्तिग्मेन शोचिषा यासद विश्वं नयत्रिणम अग्निर्नोवनते रयिम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnistighmena śociṣā yāsad viśvaṃ nyatriṇam aghnirnovanate rayim

translations.griffith: May Agni with his pointed blaze cast down each fierce devouring fiend  May Agni win us wealth by war.

verses.sanskrit: सुवीरं रयिमा भर जातवेदो विचर्षणे जहि रक्षांसि सुक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: suvīraṃ rayimā bhara jātavedo vicarṣaṇe jahi rakṣāṃsi sukrato

translations.griffith: O active Jātavedas, bring riches with store of hero sons:  Slay thou the demons, O Most Wise.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः पाह्यंहसो जातवेदो अघायतः रक्षा णो बरह्मणस कवे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ pāhyaṃhaso jātavedo aghāyataḥ rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇas kave

translations.griffith: Keep us, O Jātavedas, from the troubling of the man of sin:  Guard us thou Sage who knowest prayer.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो अग्ने दुरेव आ मर्तो वधाय दाशति तस्मान नः पाह्यंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: yo no aghne dureva ā marto vadhāya dāśati tasmān naḥ pāhyaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Whatever sinner, Agni, brings oblations to procure our death,  Save us from woe that he would work.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तं देव जिह्वया परि बाधस्व दुष्क्र्तम मर्तो यो नोजिघांसति |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ taṃ deva jihvayā pari bādhasva duṣkṛtam marto yo nojighāṃsati

translations.griffith: Drive from us with thy tongue, O God, the man who doeth evil deeds,  The mortal who would strike us dead.

verses.sanskrit: भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः शर्म यछ सहन्त्य अग्ने वरेण्यंवसु |||
verses.transliteration: bharadvājāya saprathaḥ śarma yacha sahantya aghne vareṇyaṃvasu

translations.griffith: Give shelter reaching far and wide to Bharadvāja, conquering Lord!  Agni, send wealth most excellent.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्व्र्त्राणि जङघनद दरविणस्युर्विपन्यया समिद्धः शुक्र आहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirvṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad draviṇasyurvipanyayā samiddhaḥ śukra āhutaḥ

translations.griffith: May Agni slay the Vṛtras,—fain for riches, through the lord of song,  Served with oblation, kindled, bright.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भे मातुः पितुष पिता विदिद्युतानो अक्षरे सीदन्न्र्तस्य योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: gharbhe mātuḥ pituṣ pitā vididyutāno akṣare sīdannṛtasya yonimā

translations.griffith: His Father's Father, shining in his Mother's everlasting side,  Set on the seat of holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्म परजावदा भर जातवेदो विचर्षणे अग्ने यद दीद अयद दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: brahma prajāvadā bhara jātavedo vicarṣaṇe aghne yad dīd ayad divi

translations.griffith: O active Jātavedas, bring devotion that wins progeny, Agni, that it may shine to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: उप तवा रण्वसन्द्र्शं परयस्वन्तः सहस्क्र्त अग्ने सस्र्ज्महे गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: upa tvā raṇvasandṛśaṃ prayasvantaḥ sahaskṛta aghne sasṛjmahe ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: O Child of Strength, to thee whose look is lovely we with dainty food,  O Agni, have poured forth our songs.

verses.sanskrit: उप छायामिव घर्णेरगन्म शर्म ते वयम अग्ने हिरण्यसन्द्र्शः |||
verses.transliteration: upa chāyāmiva ghṛṇeraghanma śarma te vayam aghne hiraṇyasandṛśaḥ

translations.griffith: To thee for shelter are we come, as to the shade from fervent heat  Agni, who glitterest like gold.

verses.sanskrit: य उग्र इव शर्यहा तिग्मश्र्ङगो न वंसगः अग्ने पुरो रुरोजिथ |||
verses.transliteration: ya ughra iva śaryahā tighmaśṛṅgho na vaṃsaghaḥ aghne puro rurojitha

translations.griffith: Mighty as one who slays with shafts, or like a bull with sharpened horn,  Agni, thou breakest down the forts.

verses.sanskrit: आ यं हस्ते न खादिनं शिशुं जातं न बिभ्रति विशामग्निं सवध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaṃ haste na khādinaṃ śiśuṃ jātaṃ na bibhrati viśāmaghniṃ svadhvaram

translations.griffith: Whom, like an infant newly born, devourer, in their arms they bear,  Men's Agni, skilled in holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: पर देवं देववीतये भरता वसुवित्तमम आ सवे योनौ नि षीदतु |||
verses.transliteration: pra devaṃ devavītaye bharatā vasuvittamam ā sve yonau ni ṣīdatu

translations.griffith: Bear to the banquet of the Gods the God best finder-out of wealth,  Let him he seated in his place.

verses.sanskrit: आ जातं जातवेदसि परियं शिशीतातिथिम सयोन आ गर्हपतिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā jātaṃ jātavedasi priyaṃ śiśītātithim syona ā ghṛhapatim

translations.griffith: In Jātavedas kindle ye the dear guest who hath now appeared  In a soft place, the homestead's Lord.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने युक्ष्वा हि ये तवाश्वासो देव साधवः अरं वहन्ति मन्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yukṣvā hi ye tavāśvāso deva sādhavaḥ araṃ vahanti manyave

translations.griffith: Harness, O Agni, O thou God, thy steeds which are most excellent:  They bear thee as thy spirit wills.

verses.sanskrit: अछा नो याह्या वहाभि परयांसि वीतये आ देवान सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: achā no yāhyā vahābhi prayāṃsi vītaye ā devān somapītaye

translations.griffith: Come hither, bring the Gods to us to taste the sacrificial feast,  To drink the draught of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: उदग्ने भारत दयुमदजस्रेण दविद्युतत शोचा वि भाह्यजर |||
verses.transliteration: udaghne bhārata dyumadajasreṇa davidyutat śocā vi bhāhyajara

translations.griffith: O Agni of the Bharatas, blaze high with everlasting might,  Shine forth and gleam, Eternal One.

verses.sanskrit: वीती यो देवं मर्तो दुवस्येदग्निमीळीताध्वरे हविष्मान होतारं सत्ययजं रोदस्योरुत्तानहस्तो नमसा विवासेत |||
verses.transliteration: vītī yo devaṃ marto duvasyedaghnimīḷītādhvare haviṣmān hotāraṃ satyayajaṃ rodasyoruttānahasto namasā vivāset

translations.griffith: The mortal man who serves the God with banquet, and, bringing gifts at sacrifice, lauds Agni,  May well attract, with prayer and hands uplifted, the Priest of Heaven and Earth, true Sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते अग्न रचा हविर्ह्र्दा तष्टं भरामसि ते ते भवन्तूक्षण रषभासो वशा उत |||
verses.transliteration: ā te aghna ṛcā havirhṛdā taṣṭaṃ bharāmasi te te bhavantūkṣaṇa ṛṣabhāso vaśā uta

translations.griffith: Agni, we bring thee, with our hymn, oblation fashioned in the heart.  Let these be oxen unto thee, let these be bulls and kine to thee.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं देवासो अग्रियमिन्धते वर्त्रहन्तमम येना वसून्याभ्र्ता तर्ळ्हा रक्षांसि वाजिनाषु यज्ञियम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ devāso aghriyamindhate vṛtrahantamam yenā vasūnyābhṛtā tṛḷhā rakṣāṃsi vājināṣu yajñiyam

translations.griffith: The Gods enkindle Agni, best slayer of Vṛtra, first in rank,  The Mighty, One who brings us wealth and crushes down the Rākṣasas.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा सोममभि यमुग्र तर्द ऊर्वं गव्यं महि गर्णानैन्द्र वि यो धर्ष्णो वधिषो वज्रहस्त विश्वा वर्त्रममित्रिया शवोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pibā somamabhi yamughra tarda ūrvaṃ ghavyaṃ mahi ghṛṇānaindra vi yo dhṛṣṇo vadhiṣo vajrahasta viśvā vṛtramamitriyā śavobhiḥ

translations.griffith: DRINK Soma, Mighty One, for which, when lauded, thou breakest through the cattle-stall, O Indra;  Thou who, O Bold One, armed with thunder smotest Vṛtra with might, and every hostile being.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं पाहि य रजीषी तरुत्रो यः शिप्रवान वर्षभो यो मतीनाम यो गोत्रभिद वज्रभ्र्द यो हरिष्ठाः स इन्द्र चित्रानभि तर्न्धि वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ pāhi ya ṛjīṣī tarutro yaḥ śipravān vṛṣabho yo matīnām yo ghotrabhid vajrabhṛd yo hariṣṭhāḥ sa indra citrānabhi tṛndhi vājān

translations.griffith: Drink it thou God who art impetuous victor, Lord of our hymns, with beauteousjaws, the Hero,  Render of kine-stalls, car-borne, thunder-wielding, so pierce thy way to wondrous strength, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: एवा पाहि परत्नथा मन्दतु तवा शरुधि बरह्म वाव्र्धस्वोतगीर्भिः आविः सूर्यं कर्णुहि पीपिहीषो जहि शत्रून्रभि गा इन्द्र तर्न्धि |||
verses.transliteration: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvotaghīrbhiḥ āviḥ sūryaṃ kṛṇuhi pīpihīṣo jahi śatrūnrabhi ghā indra tṛndhi

translations.griffith: Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee. hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee.  Make the Sun visible, make food abundant, slaughter the foes, pierce through and free the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: ते तवा मदा बर्हदिन्द्र सवधाव इमे पीता उक्षयन्त दयुमन्तम महामनूनं तवसं विभूतिं मत्सरासो जर्ह्र्षन्त परसाहम |||
verses.transliteration: te tvā madā bṛhadindra svadhāva ime pītā ukṣayanta dyumantam mahāmanūnaṃ tavasaṃ vibhūtiṃ matsarāso jarhṛṣanta prasāham

translations.griffith: These gladdening drops, O Indra, Self-sustainer, quaffed shall augment thee in thy mighty splendour.  Yea, let the cheering drops delight thee greatly, great, perfect, strong, powerful, all-subduing.

verses.sanskrit: येभिः सूर्यमुषसं मन्दसानो.अवासयो.अप दर्ल्हानि दर्द्रत महामद्रिं परि गा इन्द्र सन्तं नुत्था अच्युतं सदसस परि सवात |||
verses.transliteration: yebhiḥ sūryamuṣasaṃ mandasāno.avāsayo.apa dṛlhāni dardrat mahāmadriṃ pari ghā indra santaṃ nutthā acyutaṃ sadasas pari svāt

translations.griffith: Gladdened whereby, bursting the firm enclosures, thou gavest splendour to the Sun and Morning.  The mighty rock that compassed in the cattle, ne’er moved, thou shookest from its seat, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: तव करत्वा तव तद दंसनाभिरामासु पक्वं शच्या नि दीधः और्णोर्दुर उस्रियाभ्यो वि दर्ळ्होदूर्वाद गा अस्र्जो अङगिरस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: tava kratvā tava tad daṃsanābhirāmāsu pakvaṃ śacyā ni dīdhaḥ aurṇordura usriyābhyo vi dṛḷhodūrvād ghā asṛjo aṅghirasvān

translations.griffith: Thou with thy wisdom, power, and works of wonder, hast stored the ripe milk in the raw cows' udders  Unbarred the firm doors for the kine of Morning, and, with the Aṅgirases, set free the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: पप्राथ कषां महि दण्सो वयुर्वीमुप दयां रष्वो बर्हदिन्द्र सतभायः अधारयो रोदसी देवपुत्रे परत्ने मातरा यह्वी रतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: paprātha kṣāṃ mahi daṇso vyurvīmupa dyāṃ ṛṣvo bṛhadindra stabhāyaḥ adhārayo rodasī devaputre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya

translations.griffith: Thou hast spread out wide earth, a mighty marvel, and, high thyself, propped lofty heaven, O Indra.  Both worlds, whose Sons are Gods, thou hast supported, young, Mothers from old time ofholy Order.

verses.sanskrit: अध तवा विश्वे पुर इन्द्र देवा एकं तवसं दधिरे भराय अदेवो यदभ्यौहिष्ट देवान सवर्षाता वर्णत इन्द्रमत्र |||
verses.transliteration: adha tvā viśve pura indra devā ekaṃ tavasaṃ dadhire bharāya adevo yadabhyauhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇata indramatra

translations.griffith: Yea, Indra, all the Deities installed thee their one strong Champion in the van for battle.  What time the godless was the Gods’ assailant, Indra they chose to win the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अध दयौश्चित ते अप सा नु वज्राद दवितानमद भियसा सवस्य मन्योः अहिं यदिन्द्रो अभ्योहसानं नि चिद विश्वायुः शयथे जघान |||
verses.transliteration: adha dyauścit te apa sā nu vajrād dvitānamad bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ ahiṃ yadindro abhyohasānaṃ ni cid viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna

translations.griffith: Yea, e’en that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt, in terror of its anger,  When Indra, life of every living creature, smote down within his lair the assailing Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: अध तवष्टा ते मह उग्र वज्रं सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिं वव्र्तच्छताश्रिम निकाममरमणसं येन नवन्तमहिं सं पिणग्र्जीषिन |||
verses.transliteration: adha tvaṣṭā te maha ughra vajraṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ vavṛtacchatāśrim nikāmamaramaṇasaṃ yena navantamahiṃ saṃ piṇaghṛjīṣin

translations.griffith: Yea, Strong One! Tvaṣṭar turned for thee, the Mighty, the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges,  Eager and prompt at will, wherewith thou crushedst the boasting Dragon, O impetuous Hero.

verses.sanskrit: वर्धान यं विश्वे मरुतः सजोषाः पचच्छतं महिषानिन्द्र तुभ्यम पूषा विष्णुस्त्रीणि सरांसि धावन वर्त्रहणं मदिरमंशुमस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: vardhān yaṃ viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacacchataṃ mahiṣānindra tubhyam pūṣā viṣṇustrīṇi sarāṃsi dhāvan vṛtrahaṇaṃ madiramaṃśumasmai

translations.griffith: He dressed a hundred buffaloes, O Indra, for thee whom all accordant Maruts strengthen.  He, Pūṣan Viṣṇu, poured forth three great vessels to him, the juice that cheers, that slaughters Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: आ कषोदो महि वर्तं नदीनां परिष्ठितमस्र्ज ऊर्मिमपाम तासामनु परवत इन्द्र पन्थां परार्दयो नीचीरपसः समुद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: ā kṣodo mahi vṛtaṃ nadīnāṃ pariṣṭhitamasṛja ūrmimapām tāsāmanu pravata indra panthāṃ prārdayo nīcīrapasaḥ samudram

translations.griffith: Thou settest free the rushing wave of waters, the floods' great swell encompassed and obstructed.  Along steep slopes their course thou tumedst, Indra, directed downward, speeding to the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: एवा ता विश्वा चक्र्वांसमिन्द्रं महामुग्रमजुर्यं सहोदाम सुवीरं तवा सवायुधं सुवज्रमा बरह्म नव्यमवसे वव्र्त्यात |||
verses.transliteration: evā tā viśvā cakṛvāṃsamindraṃ mahāmughramajuryaṃ sahodām suvīraṃ tvā svāyudhaṃ suvajramā brahma navyamavase vavṛtyāt

translations.griffith: So may our new prayer bring thee to protect us, thee well-armed Hero with thy bolt of thunder,  Indra, who made these worlds, the Strong, the ty, who never groweth old, the victory-giver.

verses.sanskrit: स नो वाजाय शरवस इषे च राये धेहि दयुमत इन्द्र विप्रान भरद्वाजे नर्वत इन्द्र सूरीन दिवि च समैधि पार्ये न इन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: sa no vājāya śravasa iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumata indra viprān bharadvāje nṛvata indra sūrīn divi ca smaidhi pārye na indra

translations.griffith: So, Indra, form us brilliant holy singers for strength, for glory, and for food and riches.  Give Bharadvāja hero patrons, Indra Indra, be ours upon the day of trial.

verses.sanskrit: अया वाजं देवहितं सनेम मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ||
verses.transliteration: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
