translations.griffith: With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: तमु षटुहि यो अभिभूत्योजा वन्वन्नवातः पुरुहूत इन्द्रः अषाळ्हमुग्रं सहमानमाभिर्गीर्भिर्वर्ध वर्षभं चर्षणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tamu ṣṭuhi yo abhibhūtyojā vanvannavātaḥ puruhūta indraḥ aṣāḷhamughraṃ sahamānamābhirghīrbhirvardha vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām

translations.griffith: GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured.  Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.

verses.sanskrit: स युध्मः सत्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा तुविम्रक्षो नदनुमान रजीषी बर्हद्रेणुश्च्यवनो मानुषीणामेकः कर्ष्टीनामभवत सहावा |||
verses.transliteration: sa yudhmaḥ satvā khajakṛt samadvā tuvimrakṣo nadanumān ṛjīṣī bṛhadreṇuścyavano mānuṣīṇāmekaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmabhavat sahāvā

translations.griffith: He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer,  Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.

verses.sanskrit: तवं ह नु तयददमायो दस्यून्रेकः कर्ष्टीरवनोरार्याय अस्ति सविन नु वीर्यं तत त इन्द्र न सविदस्ति तद रतुथा वि वोचः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ha nu tyadadamāyo dasyūnrekaḥ kṛṣṭīravanorāryāya asti svin nu vīryaṃ tat ta indra na svidasti tad ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Ārya.  In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.

verses.sanskrit: सदिद धि ते तुविजातस्य मन्ये सहः सहिष्ठ तुरतस्तुरस्य उग्रमुग्रस्य तवसस्तवीयो.अरध्रस्य रध्रतुरो बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: sadid dhi te tuvijātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turatasturasya ughramughrasya tavasastavīyo.aradhrasya radhraturo babhūva

translations.griffith: For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor;  Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.

verses.sanskrit: तन नः परत्नं सख्यमस्तु युष्मे इत्था वदद्भिर्वलमङगिरोभिः हन्नच्युतच्युद दस्मेषयन्तं रणोः पुरो वि दुरोस्य विश्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: tan naḥ pratnaṃ sakhyamastu yuṣme itthā vadadbhirvalamaṅghirobhiḥ hannacyutacyud dasmeṣayantaṃ ṛṇoḥ puro vi duroasya viśvāḥ

translations.griffith: Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Aṅgirases here who speak of Vala.  Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and castles.

verses.sanskrit: स हि धीभिर्हव्यो अस्त्युग्र ईशानक्र्न महति वर्त्रतूर्ये स तोकसाता तनये स वज्री वितन्तसाय्यो अभवत समत्सु |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi dhībhirhavyo astyughra īśānakṛn mahati vṛtratūrye sa tokasātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyo abhavat samatsu

translations.griffith: With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vṛtra.  He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.

verses.sanskrit: स मज्मना जनिम मानुषाणाममर्त्येन नाम्नाति पर सर्स्रे स दयुम्नेन स शवसोत राया स वीर्येण नर्तमः समोकाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇāmamartyena nāmnāti pra sarsre sa dyumnena sa śavasota rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ

translations.griffith: He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations.  He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.

verses.sanskrit: स यो न मुहे न मिथू जनो भूत सुमन्तुनामा चुमुरिं धुनिं च वर्णक पिप्रुं शम्बरं शुष्णमिन्द्रः पुरांच्यौत्नाय शयथाय नू चित |||
verses.transliteration: sa yo na muhe na mithū jano bhūt sumantunāmā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca vṛṇak pipruṃ śambaraṃ śuṣṇamindraḥ purāṃcyautnāya śayathāya nū cit

translations.griffith: Stranger to guile, who ne’er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered,  Indra crushed Cumuri, Dhuni, Śambara, Pipru, and Śuṣṇa, that their castles fell in ruin.

verses.sanskrit: उदावता तवक्षसा पन्यसा च वर्त्रहत्याय रथमिन्द्र तिष्ठ धिष्व वज्रं हस्त आ दक्षिणत्राभि पर मन्द पुरुदत्र मायाः |||
verses.transliteration: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtrahatyāya rathamindra tiṣṭha dhiṣva vajraṃ hasta ā dakṣiṇatrābhi pra manda purudatra māyāḥ

translations.griffith: With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vṛtra.  In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्न शुष्कं वनमिन्द्र हेती रक्षो नि धक्ष्यशनिर्न भीमा गम्भीरय रष्वया यो रुरोजाध्वानयद दुरिता दम्भयच्च |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirna śuṣkaṃ vanamindra hetī rakṣo ni dhakṣyaśanirna bhīmā ghambhīraya ṛṣvayā yo rurojādhvānayad duritā dambhayacca

translations.griffith: As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra;  Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.

verses.sanskrit: आ सहस्रं पथिभिरिन्द्र राया तुविद्युम्न तुविवाजेभिरर्वाक याहि सूनो सहसो यस्य नू चिददेव ईशे पुरुहूत योतोः |||
verses.transliteration: ā sahasraṃ pathibhirindra rāyā tuvidyumna tuvivājebhirarvāk yāhi sūno sahaso yasya nū cidadeva īśe puruhūta yotoḥ

translations.griffith: With wealth, by thousand paths come hither, Agni, paths that bring ample strength, O thou Most Splendid.  Come, Son of Strength, o’er whom, Invoked of many! the godless hath no power to keep thee distant.

verses.sanskrit: पर तुविद्युम्नस्य सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेर्दिवो ररप्शे महिमा पर्थिव्याः नास्य शत्रुर्न परतिमानमस्ति न परतिष्ठिःपुरुमायस्य सह्योः |||
verses.transliteration: pra tuvidyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣverdivo rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ nāsya śatrurna pratimānamasti na pratiṣṭhiḥpurumāyasya sahyoḥ

translations.griffith: From heaven, from earth is bruited forth the greatness of him the firm, the fiery, the resplendent.  No foe hath he, no counterpart, no refuge is there from him the Conqueror full of wisdom

verses.sanskrit: पर तत ते अद्या करणं कर्तं भूत कुत्सं यदायुमतिथिग्वमस्मै पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशा अभि कषामुत तूर्वयाणं धर्षता निनेथ |||
verses.transliteration: pra tat te adyā karaṇaṃ kṛtaṃ bhūt kutsaṃ yadāyumatithighvamasmai purū sahasrā ni śiśā abhi kṣāmut tūrvayāṇaṃ dhṛṣatā ninetha

translations.griffith: This day the deed that thou hast done is famous, when thou, for him, with many thousand others  Laidest low Kutsa, Āyu, Atithigva, and boldly didst deliver Tūrvayāṇa.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तवाहिघ्ने अध देव देवा मदन विश्वे कवितमं कवीनाम करो यत्र वरिवो बाधिताय दिवे जनाय तन्वे गर्णानः |||
verses.transliteration: anu tvāhighne adha deva devā madan viśve kavitamaṃ kavīnām karo yatra varivo bādhitāya dive janāya tanve ghṛṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: In thee, O God, the wisest of the Sages, all Gods were joyful when thou slewest Ahi.  When lauded for thyself, thou gavest freedom to sore-afflicted Heaven and to the people.

verses.sanskrit: अनु दयावाप्र्थिवी तत त ओजो.अमर्त्या जिहत इन्द्र देवाः कर्ष्वा कर्त्नो अक्र्तं यत ते अस्त्युक्थं नवीयो जनयस्व यज्ञैः |||
verses.transliteration: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat ta ojo.amartyā jihata indra devāḥ kṛṣvā kṛtno akṛtaṃ yat te astyukthaṃ navīyo janayasva yajñaiḥ

translations.griffith: This power of thine both heaven and earth acknowledge, the deathless Gods acknowledge it, O Indra.  Do what thou ne’er hast done, O Mighty Worker: beget a new hymn at thy sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: महानिन्द्रो नर्वदा चर्षणिप्रा उत दविबर्हा अमिनः सहोभिः अस्मद्र्यग वाव्र्धे विर्यायोरुः पर्थुः सुक्र्तः कर्त्र्भिर्भूत |||
verses.transliteration: mahānindro nṛvadā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminaḥ sahobhiḥ asmadryagh vāvṛdhe viryāyoruḥ pṛthuḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhirbhūt

translations.griffith: GREAT, hero-like controlling men is Indra, unwasting in his powers, doubled in vastness.  He, turned to us, hath grown to hero vigour: broad, wide, he hath been decked by those who serve him.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमेव धिषणा सातये धाद बर्हन्तं रष्वमजरं युवानम अषाळ्हेन सवसा शूशुवांसं सद्यश्चिद यो वाव्र्धे असामि |||
verses.transliteration: indrameva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhād bṛhantaṃ ṛṣvamajaraṃ yuvānam aṣāḷhena savasā śūśuvāṃsaṃ sadyaścid yo vāvṛdhe asāmi

translations.griffith: The bowl made Indra swift to gather booty, the High, the Lofty, Youthful, Undecaying,  Him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer, and even at once grown to complete perfection.

verses.sanskrit: पर्थू करस्ना बहुला गभस्ती अस्मद्र्यक सं मिमीहि शरवांसि यूथेव पश्वः पशुपा दमूना अस्मानिन्द्राभ्या वव्र्त्स्वाजौ |||
verses.transliteration: pṛthū karasnā bahulā ghabhastī asmadryak saṃ mimīhi śravāṃsi yūtheva paśvaḥ paśupā damūnā asmānindrābhyā vavṛtsvājau

translations.griffith: Stretch out those hands of thine, extend to us-ward thy wide capacious arms, and grant us glory.  Like as the household herdsman guards the cattle, so move thou round about us in the combat.

verses.sanskrit: तं व इन्द्रं चतिनमस्य शाकैरिह नूनं वाजयन्तो हुवेम यथा चित पूर्वे जरितार आसुरनेद्या अनवद्या अरिष्टाः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ va indraṃ catinamasya śākairiha nūnaṃ vājayanto huvema yathā cit pūrve jaritāra āsuranedyā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, fain for strength, let us invite your Indra hither, who lieth hidden with his Heroes,—  Free from all blame, without reproach, uninjured, e’en as were those who sang, of old, his praises.

verses.sanskrit: धर्तव्रतो धनदाः सोमव्र्द्धः स हि वामस्य वसुनः पुरुक्षुः सं जग्मिरे पथ्या रायो अस्मिन समुद्रे न सिन्धवो यादमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: dhṛtavrato dhanadāḥ somavṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ saṃ jaghmire pathyā rāyo asmin samudre na sindhavo yādamānāḥ

translations.griffith: With steadfast laws, wealth-giver, strong through Soma, he hath much fair and precious food to feed us.  In him unite all paths that lead to riches, like rivers that commingle with the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: शविष्ठं न आ भर शूर शव ओजिष्ठमोजो अभिभूतौग्रम विश्वा दयुम्ना वर्ष्ण्या मानुषाणामस्मभ्यं दाहरिवो मादयध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: śaviṣṭhaṃ na ā bhara śūra śava ojiṣṭhamojo abhibhūtaughram viśvā dyumnā vṛṣṇyā mānuṣāṇāmasmabhyaṃ dāharivo mādayadhyai

translations.griffith: Bring unto us the mightiest might, O Hero, strong and most potent force, thou great Subduer!  All splendid vigorous powers of men vouchsafe us, Lord of Bay Steeds, that they may make us joyful.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते मदः पर्तणाषाळ अम्र्ध्र इन्द्र तं न आ भर शूशुवांसम येन तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ मंसीमहि जिगीवांसस्त्वोताः |||
verses.transliteration: yaste madaḥ pṛtaṇāṣāḷ amṛdhra indra taṃ na ā bhara śūśuvāṃsam yena tokasya tanayasya sātau maṃsīmahi jighīvāṃsastvotāḥ

translations.griffith: Bring us, grown mighty in its strength, O Indra, thy friendly rapturous joy that wins the battle,  Wherewith by thee assisted and triumphant, we may laud thee in gaining seed and offspring.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो भर वर्षणं शुष्ममिन्द्र धनस्प्र्तं शूशुवांसं सुदक्षम येन वंसाम पर्तनासु शत्रून तवोतिभिरुत जामीन्रजामीन |||
verses.transliteration: ā no bhara vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmamindra dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃ sudakṣam yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śatrūn tavotibhiruta jāmīnrajāmīn

translations.griffith: Indra, bestow on us the power heroic skilled and exceeding strong, that wins the booty,  Wherewith, by thine assistance, we may conquer our foes in battle, be they kin or stranger.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते शुष्मो वर्षभ एतु पश्चादोत्तरादधरादा पुरस्तात आ विश्वतो अभि समेत्वर्वां इन्द्र दयुम्नं सवर्वद धेह्यस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: ā te śuṣmo vṛṣabha etu paścādottarādadharādā purastāt ā viśvato abhi sametvarvāṃ indra dyumnaṃ svarvad dhehyasme

translations.griffith: Let thine heroic strength come from behind us, before us, from above us or below us.  From every side may it approach us, Indra. Give us the glory of the realm of splendour.

verses.sanskrit: नर्वत त इन्द्र नर्तमाभिरूती वंसीमहि वामं शरोमतेभिः ईक्षे हि वस्व उभयस्य राजन धा रत्नं महि सथूरं बर्हन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: nṛvat ta indra nṛtamābhirūtī vaṃsīmahi vāmaṃ śromatebhiḥ īkṣe hi vasva ubhayasya rājan dhā ratnaṃ mahi sthūraṃ bṛhantam

translations.griffith: With most heroic aid from thee, like heroes Indra, may we win wealth by deeds glory.  Thou, King, art Lord of earthly, heavenly treasure: vouchsafe us riches vast, sublime, and lasting.

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्वन्तं वर्षभं ... ||
verses.transliteration: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ ...

translations.griffith: The Bull, whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the Celestial Ruler,  Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

verses.sanskrit: जनं वज्रिन महि चिन मन्यमानमेभ्यो नर्भ्यो रन्धया येष्वस्मि अधा हि तवा पर्थिव्यां शूरसातौ हवामहे तनयेगोष्वप्सु |||
verses.transliteration: janaṃ vajrin mahi cin manyamānamebhyo nṛbhyo randhayā yeṣvasmi adhā hi tvā pṛthivyāṃ śūrasātau havāmahe tanayeghoṣvapsu

translations.griffith: Give up the people who are high and haughty to these men and to me, O Thunder-wielder!  Therefore upon the earth do we invoke thee, where heroes win, for sons and kine and waters.

verses.sanskrit: वयं त एभिः पुरुहूत सख्यैः शत्रोः-शत्रोरुत्तर इत्स्याम घनन्तो वर्त्राण्युभयानि शूर राया मदेम बर्हतात्वोताः |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ ta ebhiḥ puruhūta sakhyaiḥ śatroḥ-śatroruttara itsyāma ghnanto vṛtrāṇyubhayāni śūra rāyā madema bṛhatātvotāḥ

translations.griffith: Through these thy friendships, God invoked of many! may we be victors over every foeman.  Slaying both kinds of foe, may we, O Hero, be happy, helped by thee, with ample riches.

verses.sanskrit: दयौर्न य इन्द्राभि भूमार्यस्तस्थौ रयिः शवसा पर्त्सु जनान तं नः सहस्रभरमुर्वरासां दद्धि सूनो सहसो वर्त्रतुरम |||
verses.transliteration: dyaurna ya indrābhi bhūmāryastasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān taṃ naḥ sahasrabharamurvarāsāṃ daddhi sūno sahaso vṛtraturam

translations.griffith: GIVE us wealth, Indra, that with might, as heaven o’ertops the earth, o’ercomes our foes in battle  Wealth that brings thousands and that wins the corn-lands, wealth, Son of Strength! that vanquishes the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो न तुभ्यमन्विन्द्र सत्रासुर्यं देवेभिर्धायि विश्वम अहिं यद वर्त्रमपो वव्रिवांसं हन्न्र्जीषिन विष्णुनासचानः |||
verses.transliteration: divo na tubhyamanvindra satrāsuryaṃ devebhirdhāyi viśvam ahiṃ yad vṛtramapo vavrivāṃsaṃ hannṛjīṣin viṣṇunāsacānaḥ

translations.griffith: Even as the power of Dyaus, to thee, O Indra, all Asura sway was by the Gods entrusted,  When thou, Impetuous! leagued with Viṣṇu, slewest Vṛtra the Dragon who enclosed the waters.

verses.sanskrit: तूर्वन्नोजीयान तवसस्तवीयान कर्तब्रह्मेन्द्रो वर्द्धमहाः राजाभवन मधुनः सोम्यस्य विश्वासां यत पुरां दर्त्नुमावत |||
verses.transliteration: tūrvannojīyān tavasastavīyān kṛtabrahmendro vṛddhamahāḥ rājābhavan madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsāṃ yat purāṃ dartnumāvat

translations.griffith: Indra, Strong, Victor, Mightier than the mighty, addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour,  Lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces, became the King of the sweet juice of Soma..

verses.sanskrit: शतैरपद्रन पणय इन्द्रात्र दशोणये कवये.अर्कसातौ वधैः शुष्णस्याशुषस्य मायाः पित्वो नारिरेचीत किंचन पर |||
verses.transliteration: śatairapadran paṇaya indrātra daśoṇaye kavaye.arkasātau vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasyāśuṣasya māyāḥ pitvo nārirecīt kiṃcana pra

translations.griffith: There, Indra, while the light was won, the Paṇis f1ed, 'neath a hundred blows, for wise Dasoni,  And greedy Śuṣṇa's magical devices nor left he any of their food remaining.

verses.sanskrit: महो दरुहो अप विश्वायु धायि वज्रस्य यत पतने पादि शुष्णः उरु ष सरथं सारथये करिन्द्रः कुत्साय सूर्यस्य सातौ |||
verses.transliteration: maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi vajrasya yat patane pādi śuṣṇaḥ uru ṣa sarathaṃ sārathaye karindraḥ kutsāya sūryasya sātau

translations.griffith: What time the thunder fell and Śuṣṇa perished, all life's support from the great Druh was taken.  Indra made room for his car-drivcr Kutsa who sate beside him, when he gained the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit: पर शयेनो न मदिरमंशुमस्मै शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर्मथायन परावन नमीं साप्यं ससन्तं पर्णग राया समिषा सं सवस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: pra śyeno na madiramaṃśumasmai śiro dāsasya namucermathāyan prāvan namīṃ sāpyaṃ sasantaṃ pṛṇagh rāyā samiṣā saṃ svasti

translations.griffith: As the Hawk rent for him the stalk that gladdens, he wrenched the head from Namuci the Dāsa.  He guarded Nam, Sayya's son, in slumber, and sated him with food, success, and riches.

verses.sanskrit: वि पिप्रोरहिमायस्य दर्ळ्हाः पुरो वज्रिञ्छवसा न दर्दः सुदामन तद रेक्णो अप्रम्र्ष्यं रजिश्वने दात्रं दाशुषे दाः |||
verses.transliteration: vi piprorahimāyasya dṛḷhāḥ puro vajriñchavasā na dardaḥ sudāman tad rekṇo apramṛṣyaṃ ṛjiśvane dātraṃ dāśuṣe dāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, thunder-armed, with thy great might hast shattered Pipru's strong forts who knew the wiles of serpents.  Thou gavest to thy worshipper Ṛjiśvan imperishable Wealth, O Bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit: स वेतसुं दशमायं दशोणिं तूतुजिमिन्द्रः सवभिष्टिसुम्नः आ तुग्रं शश्वदिभं दयोतनाय मातुर्न सीमुप सर्जा इयध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: sa vetasuṃ daśamāyaṃ daśoṇiṃ tūtujimindraḥ svabhiṣṭisumnaḥ ā tughraṃ śaśvadibhaṃ dyotanāya māturna sīmupa sṛjā iyadhyai

translations.griffith: The crafty Vetasu, the swift Dasni, and Tugra speedily with all his servants,  Hath Indra, gladdening with strong assistance, forced near as ’twere to glorify the Mother.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं सप्र्धो वनते अप्रतीतो बिभ्रद वज्रं वर्त्रहणं गभस्तौ तिष्ठद धरी अध्यस्तेव गर्ते वचोयुजा वहत इन्द्रं रष्वम |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ spṛdho vanate apratīto bibhrad vajraṃ vṛtrahaṇaṃ ghabhastau tiṣṭhad dharī adhyasteva gharte vacoyujā vahata indraṃ ṛṣvam

translations.griffith: Resistless, with the hosts he battles, bearing in both his arms the Vṛtra-slaying thunder.  He mounts his Bays, as the car-seat an archer: yoked at a word they bear the lofty Indra.

verses.sanskrit: सनेम ते.अवसा नव्य इन्द्र पर पूरव सतवन्त एना यज्ञैः सप्त यत पुरः शर्म शारदीर्दर्द धन दासीः पुरुकुत्साय शिक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: sanema te.avasā navya indra pra pūrava stavanta enā yajñaiḥ sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīrdard dhan dāsīḥ purukutsāya śikṣan

translations.griffith: May we, O Indra, gain by thy new favour: so Parus laud thee, with their sacrifices,  That thou hast wrecked seven autumn forts, their shelter, slain Dāsa tribes and aided Purukutsa.

verses.sanskrit: तवं वर्ध इन्द्र पूर्व्यो भूर्वरिवस्यन्नुशने काव्याय परा नववास्त्वमनुदेयं महे पित्रे ददाथ सवं नपातम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ vṛdha indra pūrvyo bhūrvarivasyannuśane kāvyāya parā navavāstvamanudeyaṃ mahe pitre dadātha svaṃ napātam

translations.griffith: Favouring Uśanā the son of Kavi, thou wast his ancient strengthener, O Indra.  Thou gavest Navavāstva. as a present, to the great father gavest back his grandson.

verses.sanskrit: तवं धुनिरिन्द्र ... ||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dhunirindra ...

translations.griffith: Thou, roaring Indra, drovest on the waters that made a roaring sound like rushing rivers,  What time, O Hero, o’er the sea thou broughtest, in safety broughtest Turvaśa and Yadu.

verses.sanskrit: तव ह तयदिन्द्र विष्वमाजौ सस्तो धुनीचुमुरी या ह सिष्वप दीदयदित तुभ्यं सोमेभिः सुन्वन दभीतिरिध्मभ्र्तिः पक्थ्यर्कैः |||
verses.transliteration: tava ha tyadindra viṣvamājau sasto dhunīcumurī yā ha siṣvap dīdayadit tubhyaṃ somebhiḥ sunvan dabhītiridhmabhṛtiḥ pakthyarkaiḥ

translations.griffith: This Indra, was thy work in war: thou sentest Dhuni and Cumuri to sleep and slumber.  Dabhīti lit the flame for thee, and worshipped with fuel, hymns, poured Soma, dressed oblations.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ तवा पुरुतमस्य कारोर्हव्यं वीर हव्या हवन्ते धियो रथेष्ठामजरं नवीयो रयिर्विभूतिरीयते वचस्या |||
verses.transliteration: imā u tvā purutamasya kārorhavyaṃ vīra havyā havante dhiyo ratheṣṭhāmajaraṃ navīyo rayirvibhūtirīyate vacasyā

translations.griffith: THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero;  Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit: तमु सतुष इन्द्रं यो विदानो गिर्वाहसं गीर्भीर्यज्ञव्र्द्धम यस्य दिवमति मह्ना पर्थिव्याः पुरुमायस्य रिरिचेमहित्वम |||
verses.transliteration: tamu stuṣa indraṃ yo vidāno ghirvāhasaṃ ghīrbhīryajñavṛddham yasya divamati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ purumāyasya riricemahitvam

translations.griffith: I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices,  Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.

verses.sanskrit: स इत तमो.अवयुनं ततन्वत सूर्येण वयुनवच्चकार कदा ते मर्ता अम्र्तस्य धामेयक्षन्तो न मिनन्ति सवधावः |||
verses.transliteration: sa it tamo.avayunaṃ tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavaccakāra kadā te martā amṛtasya dhāmeyakṣanto na minanti svadhāvaḥ

translations.griffith: He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless.  Mortals who yearn to worship ne’er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ता चकार स कुह सविदिन्द्रः कमा जनं चरति कासु विक्षु कस्ते यज्ञो मनसे शं वराय को अर्क इन्द्रकतमः स होता |||
verses.transliteration: yastā cakāra sa kuha svidindraḥ kamā janaṃ carati kāsu vikṣu kaste yajño manase śaṃ varāya ko arka indrakatamaḥ sa hotā

translations.griffith: And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit?  What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?

verses.sanskrit: इदा हि ते वेविषतः पुराजाः परत्नास आसुः पुरुक्र्त सखायः ये मध्यमास उत नूतनास उतावमस्य पुरुहूत बोधि |||
verses.transliteration: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsa āsuḥ purukṛt sakhāyaḥ ye madhyamāsa uta nūtanāsa utāvamasya puruhūta bodhi

translations.griffith: Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker.  Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.

verses.sanskrit: तं पर्छन्तो.अवरासः पराणि परत्ना त इन्द्र शरुत्यानु येमुः अर्चामसि वीर बरह्मवाहो यादेव विद्म तात तवा महान्तम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ pṛchanto.avarāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā ta indra śrutyānu yemuḥ arcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yādeva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam

translations.griffith: Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions.  Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा पाजो रक्षसो वि तस्थे महि जज्ञानमभि तत सु तिष्ठ तव परत्नेन युज्येन सख्या वज्रेण धर्ष्णो अपता नुदस्व |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā pājo rakṣaso vi tasthe mahi jajñānamabhi tat su tiṣṭha tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apatā nudasva

translations.griffith: The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet it.  With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.

verses.sanskrit: स तु शरुधीन्द्र नूतनस्य बरह्मण्यतो वीर कारुधायः तवं हयापिः परदिवि पितॄणां शश्वद बभूथ सुहव एष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: sa tu śrudhīndra nūtanasya brahmaṇyato vīra kārudhāyaḥ tvaṃ hyāpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇāṃ śaśvad babhūtha suhava eṣṭau

translations.griffith: Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer.  For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.

verses.sanskrit: परोतये वरुणं मित्रमिन्द्रं मरुतः कर्ष्वावसे नो अद्य पर पूषणं विष्णुमग्निं पुरन्धिं सवितारमोषधीः पर्वतांश्च |||
verses.transliteration: protaye varuṇaṃ mitramindraṃ marutaḥ kṛṣvāvase no adya pra pūṣaṇaṃ viṣṇumaghniṃ purandhiṃ savitāramoṣadhīḥ parvatāṃśca

translations.griffith: Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuṇa, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts,  Pūṣan and Viṣṇu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.

verses.sanskrit: इम उ तवा पुरुशाक परयज्यो जरितारो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः शरुधी हवमा हुवतो हुवानो न तवावानन्यो अम्र्त तवदस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ima u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritāro abhyarcantyarkaiḥ śrudhī havamā huvato huvāno na tvāvānanyo amṛta tvadasti

translations.griffith: The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy.  Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!

verses.sanskrit: नू म आ वाचमुप याहि विद्वान विश्वेभिः सूनो सहसो यजत्रैः ये अग्निजिह्वा रतसाप आसुर्ये मनुं चक्रुरुपरं दसाय |||
verses.transliteration: nū ma ā vācamupa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajatraiḥ ye aghnijihvā ṛtasāpa āsurye manuṃ cakruruparaṃ dasāya

translations.griffith: Now to my words come quickly thou who knowest, O Son of Strength, with all who claim our worship,  Who visit sacred rites, whose tongue is Agni, Gods who made Manu stronger than the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit: स नो बोधि पुरेता सुगेषूत दुर्गेषु पथिक्र्द विदानः ये अश्रमास उरवो वहिष्ठास्तेभिर्न इन्द्राभि वक्षि वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: sa no bodhi puraetā sugheṣūta durgheṣu pathikṛd vidānaḥ ye aśramāsa uravo vahiṣṭhāstebhirna indrābhi vakṣi vājam

translations.griffith: On good and evil ways be thou our Leader, thou who art known to all as Path-preparer.  Bring power to us, O Indra, with thy Horses, Steeds that are best to draw, broad-backed, unwearied.

verses.sanskrit: य एक इद धव्यश्चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं तं गीर्भिरभ्यर्च आभिः यः पत्यते वर्षभो वर्ष्ण्यावान सत्यः सत्वा पुरुमायः सहस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: ya eka id dhavyaścarṣaṇīnāmindraṃ taṃ ghīrbhirabhyarca ābhiḥ yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān

translations.griffith: WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals,  The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: तमु नः पूर्वे पितरो नवग्वाः सप्त विप्रासो अभि वाजयन्तः नक्षद्दाभं ततुरिं पर्वतेष्ठामद्रोघवाचं मतिभिः शविष्ठम |||
verses.transliteration: tamu naḥ pūrve pitaro navaghvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ nakṣaddābhaṃ taturiṃ parvateṣṭhāmadroghavācaṃ matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham

translations.griffith: Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him,  Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.

verses.sanskrit: तमीमह इन्द्रमस्य रायः पुरुवीरस्य नर्वतः पुरुक्षोः यो अस्क्र्धोयुरजरः सवर्वान तमा भर हरिवो मादयध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: tamīmaha indramasya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ yo askṛdhoyurajaraḥ svarvān tamā bhara harivo mādayadhyai

translations.griffith: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes.  Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो वि वोचो यदि ते पुरा चिज्जरितार आनशुः सुम्नमिन्द्र कस्ते भागः किं वयो दुध्र खिद्वः पुरुहूत पुरूवसो.असुरघ्नः |||
verses.transliteration: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cijjaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnamindra kaste bhāghaḥ kiṃ vayo dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso.asuraghnaḥ

translations.griffith: Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune,  What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?

verses.sanskrit: तं पर्छन्ती वज्रहस्तं रथेष्ठामिन्द्रं वेपी वक्वरीयस्य नू गीः तुविग्राभं तुविकूर्मिं रभोदां गातुमिषे नक्षते तुम्रमछ |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ pṛchantī vajrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhāmindraṃ vepī vakvarīyasya nū ghīḥ tuvighrābhaṃ tuvikūrmiṃ rabhodāṃ ghātumiṣe nakṣate tumramacha

translations.griffith: He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent,  Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अया ह तयं मायया वाव्र्धानं मनोजुवा सवतवः पर्वतेन अच्युता चिद वीळिता सवोजो रुजो वि दर्ळ्हा धर्षता विरप्शिन |||
verses.transliteration: ayā ha tyaṃ māyayā vāvṛdhānaṃ manojuvā svatavaḥ parvatena acyutā cid vīḷitā svojo rujo vi dṛḷhā dhṛṣatā virapśin

translations.griffith: Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee,  And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.

verses.sanskrit: तं वो धिया नव्यस्या शविष्ठं परत्नं परत्नवत परितंसयध्यै स नो वक्षदनिमानः सुवह्मेन्द्रो विश्वान्यतिदुर्गहाणि |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭhaṃ pratnaṃ pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai sa no vakṣadanimānaḥ suvahmendro viśvānyatidurghahāṇi

translations.griffith: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner.  So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o’er all places hard to traverse.

verses.sanskrit: आ जनाय दरुह्वणे पार्थिवानि दिव्यानि दीपयो.अन्तरिक्षा तपा वर्षन विश्वतः शोचिषा तान बरह्मद्विषे शोचय कषामपश्च |||
verses.transliteration: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayo.antarikṣā tapā vṛṣan viśvataḥ śociṣā tān brahmadviṣe śocaya kṣāmapaśca

translations.griffith: Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven.  With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them: heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.

verses.sanskrit: भुवो जनस्य दिव्यस्य राजा पार्थिवस्य जगतस्त्वेषसन्द्र्क धिष्व वज्रं दक्षिण इन्द्र हस्ते विश्वा अजुर्य दयसे वि मायाः |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvo janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jaghatastveṣasandṛk dhiṣva vajraṃ dakṣiṇa indra haste viśvā ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ

translations.griffith: Of all the Heavenly Folk, of earthly creatures thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect.  In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp die thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.

verses.sanskrit: आ संयतमिन्द्र णः सवस्तिं शत्रुतूर्याय बर्हतीमम्र्ध्राम यया दासान्यार्याणि वर्त्रा करो वज्रिन सुतुका नाहुषाणि |||
verses.transliteration: ā saṃyatamindra ṇaḥ svastiṃ śatrutūryāya bṛhatīmamṛdhrām yayā dāsānyāryāṇi vṛtrā karo vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi

translations.griffith: Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing.  Strengthen therewith the Ārya's hate and Dāsa's, and let the arms of Nahusas be mighty.

verses.sanskrit: स नो नियुद्भिः पुरुहूत वेधो विश्ववाराभिरा गहि परयज्यो न या अदेवो वरते न देव आभिर्याहि तूयमा मद्र्यद्रिक |||
verses.transliteration: sa no niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvavārābhirā ghahi prayajyo na yā adevo varate na deva ābhiryāhi tūyamā madryadrik

translations.griffith: Come with thy team which brings all blessings hither, Disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy.  Thou whom no fiend, no God can stay or hinder, come swittly with these Steeds in my direction.

verses.sanskrit: सुत इत तवं निमिश्ल इन्द्र सोमे सतोमे बरह्मणि शस्यमानौक्थे यद वा युक्ताभ्यां मघवन हरिभ्यां बिभ्रद वज्रम्बाह्वोरिन्द्र यासि |||
verses.transliteration: suta it tvaṃ nimiśla indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamānaukthe yad vā yuktābhyāṃ maghavan haribhyāṃ bibhrad vajrambāhvorindra yāsi

translations.griffith: THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted;  Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा दिवि पार्ये सुष्विमिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये.अवसि शूरसातौ यद वा दक्षस्य बिभ्युषो अबिभ्यदरन्धयः शर्धत इन्द्र दस्यून |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā divi pārye suṣvimindra vṛtrahatye.avasi śūrasātau yad vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣo abibhyadarandhayaḥ śardhata indra dasyūn

translations.griffith: Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vṛtra's slaughter;  Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं परणेनीरुग्रो जरितारमूती कर्ता वीराय सुष्वय उ लोकं दाता वसु सतुवते कीरये चित |||
verses.transliteration: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ praṇenīrughro jaritāramūtī kartā vīrāya suṣvaya u lokaṃ dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit

translations.griffith: Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises.  He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.

verses.sanskrit: गन्तेयान्ति सवना हरिभ्यां बभ्रिर्वज्रं पपिः सोमं ददिर्गाः कर्ता वीरं नर्यं सर्ववीरं शरोता हवंग्र्णत सतोमवाहाः |||
verses.transliteration: ghanteyānti savanā haribhyāṃ babhrirvajraṃ papiḥ somaṃ dadirghāḥ kartā vīraṃ naryaṃ sarvavīraṃ śrotā havaṃghṛṇata stomavāhāḥ

translations.griffith: E’en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle.  He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मै वयं यद वावान तद विविष्म इन्द्राय यो नः परदिवो अपस कः सुते सोमे सतुमसि शंसदुक्थेन्द्राय बरह्म वर्धनं यथासत |||
verses.transliteration: asmai vayaṃ yad vāvāna tad viviṣma indrāya yo naḥ pradivo apas kaḥ sute some stumasi śaṃsadukthendrāya brahma vardhanaṃ yathāsat

translations.griffith: What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service.  While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्माणि हि चक्र्षे वर्धनानि तावत त इन्द्र मतिभिर्विविष्मः सुते सोमे सुतपाः शन्तमानि रान्द्र्या करियास्म वक्षणानि यज्ञैः |||
verses.transliteration: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat ta indra matibhirviviṣmaḥ sute some sutapāḥ śantamāni rāndryā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra.  May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.

verses.sanskrit: स नो बोधि पुरोळाशं रराणः पिबा तु सोमं गोर्जीकमिन्द्र एदं बर्हिर्यजमानस्य सीदोरुं कर्धि तवायत उ लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: sa no bodhi puroḷāśaṃ rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somaṃ ghoṛjīkamindra edaṃ barhiryajamānasya sīdoruṃ kṛdhi tvāyata u lokam

translations.griffith: Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled.  Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.

verses.sanskrit: स मन्दस्वा हयनु जोषमुग्र पर तवा यज्ञास इमे अश्नुवन्तु परेमे हवासः पुरुहूतमस्मे आ तवेयं धीरवस इन्द्र यम्याः |||
verses.transliteration: sa mandasvā hyanu joṣamughra pra tvā yajñāsa ime aśnuvantu preme havāsaḥ puruhūtamasme ā tveyaṃ dhīravasa indra yamyāḥ

translations.griffith: O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee;  And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.

verses.sanskrit: तं वः सखायः सं यथा सुतेषु सोमेभिरीं पर्णता भोजमिन्द्रम कुवित तस्मा असति नो भराय न सुष्विमिन्द्रो.अवसे मर्धाति |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ saṃ yathā suteṣu somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram kuvit tasmā asati no bharāya na suṣvimindro.avase mṛdhāti

translations.griffith: Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma.  Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.

verses.sanskrit: एवेदिन्द्रः सुते अस्तावि सोमे भरद्वाजेषु कषयदिन मघोनः असद यथा जरित्र उत सूरिरिन्द्रो रायो विश्ववारस्य दाता |||
verses.transliteration: evedindraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayadin maghonaḥ asad yathā jaritra uta sūririndro rāyo viśvavārasya dātā

translations.griffith: While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvājas,  That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा मद इन्द्रे शलोक उक्था सचा सोमेषु सुतपा रजीषी अर्चत्र्यो मघवा नर्भ्य उक्थैर्द्युक्षो राजा गिरामक्षितोतिः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā mada indre śloka ukthā sacā someṣu sutapā ṛjīṣī arcatryo maghavā nṛbhya ukthairdyukṣo rājā ghirāmakṣitotiḥ

translations.griffith: STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma:  That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.

verses.sanskrit: ततुरिर्वीरो नर्यो विचेताः शरोता हवं गर्णत उर्व्यूतिः वसुः शंसो नरां कारुधाया वाजी सतुतो विदथे दाति वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: taturirvīro naryo vicetāḥ śrotā havaṃ ghṛṇata urvyūtiḥ vasuḥ śaṃso narāṃ kārudhāyā vājī stuto vidathe dāti vājam

translations.griffith: He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him.  Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षो न चक्र्योः शूर बर्हन पर ते मह्ना रिरिचे रोदस्योः वर्क्षस्य नु ते पुरुहूत वया वयूतयो रुरुहुरिन्द्र पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: akṣo na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayā vyūtayo ruruhurindra pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness.  Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: शचीवतस्ते पुरुशाक शाका गवामिव सरुतयः संचरणीः वत्सानां न तन्तयस्त इन्द्र दामन्वन्तो अदामानः सुदामन |||
verses.transliteration: śacīvataste puruśāka śākā ghavāmiva srutayaḥ saṃcaraṇīḥ vatsānāṃ na tantayasta indra dāmanvanto adāmānaḥ sudāman

translations.griffith: Strong Lord, thine energies, endowed with vigour, are like the paths of kine converging homeward.  Like bonds of cord, Indra, that bind the younglings, no bonds are they, O thou of boundless bounty.

verses.sanskrit: अन्यदद्य कर्वरमन्यदु शवो.असच्च सन मुहुराचक्रिरिन्द्रः मित्रो नो अत्र वरुणश्च पूषार्यो वशस्य पर्येतास्ति |||
verses.transliteration: anyadadya karvaramanyadu śvo.asacca san muhurācakririndraḥ mitro no atra varuṇaśca pūṣāryo vaśasya paryetāsti

translations.griffith: One act to-day, another act tomorrow oft Indra makes what is not yet existeni.  Here have we Mitra, Varuṇa, and Pūṣan to overcome the foeman's domination.

verses.sanskrit: वि तवदापो न पर्वतस्य पर्ष्ठादुक्थेभिरिन्द्रानयन्त यज्ञैः तं तवाभिः सुष्टुतिभिर्वाजयन्त आजिं न जग्मुर्गिर्वाहो अश्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: vi tvadāpo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhādukthebhirindrānayanta yajñaiḥ taṃ tvābhiḥ suṣṭutibhirvājayanta ājiṃ na jaghmurghirvāho aśvāḥ

translations.griffith: By song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee, as from a mountain's ridge, O Indra.  Urging thy might, with these fair lauds they seek thee, O theme of song, as horses rush tobattle.

verses.sanskrit: न यं जरन्ति शरदो न मासा न दयाव इन्द्रमवकर्शयन्ति वर्द्धस्य चिद वर्धतामस्य तनू सतोमेभिरुक्थैश्चशस्यमाना |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ jaranti śarado na māsā na dyāva indramavakarśayanti vṛddhasya cid vardhatāmasya tanū stomebhirukthaiścaśasyamānā

translations.griffith: That Indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age, nor fleeting days enfeeble,—  Still may his body Wax, e’en now so mighty, glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.

verses.sanskrit: न वीळवे नमते न सथिराय न शर्धते दस्युजूताय सतवान अज्रा इन्द्रस्य गिरयश्चिद रष्वा गम्भीरे चिद भवतिगाधमस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: na vīḷave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyujūtāya stavān ajrā indrasya ghirayaścid ṛṣvā ghambhīre cid bhavatighādhamasmai

translations.griffith: Extolled, he bends not to the strong, the steadfast, nor to the bold incited by the Dasyu.  High mountains are as level plains to Indra: even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.

verses.sanskrit: गम्भीरेण न उरुणामत्रिन परेषो यन्धि सुतपावन वाजान सथा ऊ षु ऊर्ध्व ऊती अरिषण्यन्नक्तोर्व्युष्टौ परितक्म्यायाम |||
verses.transliteration: ghambhīreṇa na uruṇāmatrin preṣo yandhi sutapāvan vājān sthā ū ṣu ūrdhva ūtī ariṣaṇyannaktorvyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām

translations.griffith: Impetuous Speeder through all depth and distance, give strengthening food, thou drinker of the juices.  Stand up erect to help us, unreluctant, what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.

verses.sanskrit: सचस्व नायमवसे अभीक इतो वा तमिन्द्र पाहि रिषः अमा चैनमरण्ये पाहि रिषो मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: sacasva nāyamavase abhīka ito vā tamindra pāhi riṣaḥ amā cainamaraṇye pāhi riṣo madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Hasting to help, come hither and protect him, keep him from harm when he is here, O Indra.  At home, abroad, from injury preserve him. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: या त ऊतिरवमा या परमा या मध्यमेन्द्र शुष्मिन्नस्ति ताभिरू षु वर्त्रहत्ये.अवीर्न एभिश्च वाजैर्महान्न उग्र |||
verses.transliteration: yā ta ūtiravamā yā paramā yā madhyamendra śuṣminnasti tābhirū ṣu vṛtrahatye.avīrna ebhiśca vājairmahānna ughra

translations.griffith: WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,—  Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: आभि सप्र्धो मिथतीररिषण्यन्नमित्रस्य वयथया मन्युमिन्द्र आभिर्विश्वा अभियुजो विषूचीरार्याय विशो.अव तारीर्दासीः |||
verses.transliteration: ābhi spṛdho mithatīrariṣaṇyannamitrasya vyathayā manyumindra ābhirviśvā abhiyujo viṣūcīrāryāya viśo.ava tārīrdāsīḥ

translations.griffith: With these discomfit hosts that fight against us, and check the opponent's wrath, thyself uninjured.  With these chase all our foes to every quarter: subdue the tribes of Dāsas to the Ārya.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र जामय उत ये.अजामयो.अर्वाचीनासो वनुषो युयुज्रे तवमेषां विथुरा शवांसि जहि वर्ष्ण्यानि कर्णुही पराचः |||
verses.transliteration: indra jāmaya uta ye.ajāmayo.arvācīnāso vanuṣo yuyujre tvameṣāṃ vithurā śavāṃsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhī parācaḥ

translations.griffith: Those who array themselves as foes to smite us, O Indra, be they kin or be they strangers,—  Strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble, and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.

verses.sanskrit: शूरो वा शूरं वनते शरीरैस्तनूरुचा तरुषि यत कर्ण्वैते तोके वा गोषु तनये यदप्सु वि करन्दसी उर्वरासु बरवैते |||
verses.transliteration: śūro vā śūraṃ vanate śarīraistanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite toke vā ghoṣu tanaye yadapsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite

translations.griffith: With strength of limb the hero slays the hero, when bright in arms they range them for the combat.  When two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring, waters, kine, or corn-lands.

verses.sanskrit: नहि तवा शूरो न तुरो न धर्ष्णुर्न तवा योधो मन्यमानो युयोध इन्द्र नकिष टवा परत्यस्त्येषां विश्वा जातान्यभ्यसि तानि |||
verses.transliteration: nahi tvā śūro na turo na dhṛṣṇurna tvā yodho manyamāno yuyodha indra nakiṣ ṭvā pratyastyeṣāṃ viśvā jātānyabhyasi tāni

translations.griffith: Yet no strong man hath conquered thee, no hero, no brave, no warrior trusting in his valour.  Not one of these is match for thee, O Indra. Thou far surpassest all these living creatures.

verses.sanskrit: स पत्यत उभयोर्न्र्म्णमयोर्यदी वेधसः समिथे हवन्ते वर्त्रे वा महो नर्वति कषये वा वयचस्वन्ता यदि वितन्तसैते |||
verses.transliteration: sa patyata ubhayornṛmṇamayoryadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante vṛtre vā maho nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite

translations.griffith: He is the Lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict:  When with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.

verses.sanskrit: अध समा ते चर्षणयो यदेजानिन्द्र तरातोत भवा वरूता अस्माकासो ये नर्तमासो अर्य इन्द्र सूरयो दधिरे पुरोनः |||
verses.transliteration: adha smā te carṣaṇayo yadejānindra trātota bhavā varūtā asmākāso ye nṛtamāso arya indra sūrayo dadhire puronaḥ

translations.griffith: And when the people stir themselves for battle, be thou their saviour, Indra, and protector,  And theirs, thy manliest of our friends, the pious, the chiefs who have installed us priests, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अनु ते दायि मह इन्द्रियाय सत्रा ते विष्वमनु वर्त्रहत्ये अनु कषत्रमनु सहो यजत्रेन्द्र देवेभिरनु ते नर्षह्ये |||
verses.transliteration: anu te dāyi maha indriyāya satrā te viṣvamanu vṛtrahatye anu kṣatramanu saho yajatrendra devebhiranu te nṛṣahye

translations.griffith: To thee for high dominion hath been for evermore, for slaughtering the Vṛtras,  All lordly power and might, O Holy Indra, given by Gods for victory in battle.

verses.sanskrit: एवा न सप्र्धः समजा समत्स्विन्द्र रारन्धि मिथतीरदेवीः विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गर्णन्तो भरद्वाजा उत त इन्द्र नूनम |||
verses.transliteration: evā na spṛdhaḥ samajā samatsvindra rārandhi mithatīradevīḥ vidyāma vastoravasā ghṛṇanto bharadvājā uta ta indra nūnam

translations.griffith: So urge our hosts together in the combats: yield up the godless bands that fight against us.  Singing, at morn may we find thee with favour, yea, Indra, and e’en now, we Bharadvājas.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी न इन्द्र हवयामसि तवा महो वाजस्य सातौ वाव्र्षाणाः सं यद विशो.अयन्त शूरसाता उग्रं नो.अवः पार्ये अहन दाः |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī na indra hvayāmasi tvā maho vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ saṃ yad viśo.ayanta śūrasātā ughraṃ no.avaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ

translations.griffith: O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour.  Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.

verses.sanskrit: तवां वाजी हवते वाजिनेयो महो वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ तवां वर्त्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं तरुत्रं तवां चष्टे मुष्टिहा गोषु युध्यन |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ vājī havate vājineyo maho vājasya ghadhyasya sātau tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ tarutraṃ tvāṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā ghoṣu yudhyan

translations.griffith: The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty:  To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.

verses.sanskrit: तवं कविं चोदयो.अर्कसातौ तवं कुत्साय शुष्णं दाशुषे वर्क तवं शिरो अमर्मणः पराहन्नतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ kaviṃ codayo.arkasātau tvaṃ kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ dāśuṣe vark tvaṃ śiro amarmaṇaḥ parāhannatithighvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan

translations.griffith: Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Śuṣṇa for the pious Kutsa.  The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Atithigva.

verses.sanskrit: तवं रथं पर भरो योधं रष्वमावो युध्यन्तं वर्षभं दशद्युम तवं तुग्रं वेतसवे सचाहन तवं तुजिं गर्णन्तमिन्द्र तूतोः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ rathaṃ pra bharo yodhaṃ ṛṣvamāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum tvaṃ tughraṃ vetasave sacāhan tvaṃ tujiṃ ghṛṇantamindra tūtoḥ

translations.griffith: The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Dasadyu the strong when fighting.  Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तदुक्थमिन्द्र बर्हणा कः पर यच्छता सहस्राशूर दर्षि अव गिरेर्दासं शम्बरं हन परावो दिवोदासं चित्राभिरूती |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tadukthamindra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yacchatā sahasrāśūra darṣi ava ghirerdāsaṃ śambaraṃ han prāvo divodāsaṃ citrābhirūtī

translations.griffith: Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero,  Slewest the Dāsa Śambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodāsa.

verses.sanskrit: तवं शरद्धाभिर्मन्दसानः सोमैर्दभीतये चुमुरिमिन्द्रसिष्वप तवं रजिं पिठीनसे दशस्यन षष्टिं सहस्राशच्या सचाहन |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ śraddhābhirmandasānaḥ somairdabhītaye cumurimindrasiṣvap tvaṃ rajiṃ piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrāśacyā sacāhan

translations.griffith: Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Cumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhīti.  Thou, kindly giving Raji to Pithinas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.

verses.sanskrit: अहं चन तत सूरिभिरानश्यां तव जयाय इन्द्र सुम्नमोजः तवया यत सतवन्ते सधवीर वीरास्त्रिवरूथेन नहुषा शविष्ठ |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ cana tat sūribhirānaśyāṃ tava jyāya indra sumnamojaḥ tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrāstrivarūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha

translations.griffith: May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination,  When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahuṣa heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते अस्यामिन्द्र दयुम्नहूतौ सखायः सयाम महिन परेष्ठाः परातर्दनिः कषत्रश्रीरस्तु शरेष्ठो घने वर्त्राणां सनये धनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te asyāmindra dyumnahūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ prātardaniḥ kṣatraśrīrastu śreṣṭho ghane vṛtrāṇāṃ sanaye dhanānām

translations.griffith: So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation.  Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.

verses.sanskrit: किमस्य मदे किं वस्य पीताविन्द्रः किमस्य सख्ये चकार रणा वा ये निषदि किं ते अस्य पुर विविद्रे किमु नूतनासः |||
verses.transliteration: kimasya made kiṃ vasya pītāvindraḥ kimasya sakhye cakāra raṇā vā ye niṣadi kiṃ te asya pura vividre kimu nūtanāsaḥ

translations.griffith: WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma?  What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

verses.sanskrit: सदस्य मदे सद वस्य पितविन्द्रः सदस्य सख्ये चकार रणा वा ये निषदि सत ते अस्य पुर विविद्रे सदु नूतनासः |||
verses.transliteration: sadasya made sad vasya pitavindraḥ sadasya sakhye cakāra raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya pura vividre sadu nūtanāsaḥ

translations.griffith: In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship.  His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.

verses.sanskrit: नहि नु ते महिमनः समस्य न मघवन मघवत्त्वस्य विद्म न राधसो-राधसो नूतनस्येन्द्र नकिर्दद्र्श इन्द्रियं ते |||
verses.transliteration: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavattvasya vidma na rādhaso-rādhaso nūtanasyendra nakirdadṛśa indriyaṃ te

translations.griffith: All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance.  No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: एतत तयत त इन्द्रियमचेति येनावधीर्वरशिखस्य शेषः वज्रस्य यत ते निहतस्य शुष्मात सवनाच्चिदिन्द्र परमोददार |||
verses.transliteration: etat tyat ta indriyamaceti yenāvadhīrvaraśikhasya śeṣaḥ vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāccidindra paramodadāra

translations.griffith: This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varasikha's children,  When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere solund, their boldest was demolished.

verses.sanskrit: वधीदिन्द्रो वरशिखस्य शेषो.अभ्यावर्तिने चायमानाय शिक्षन वर्चीवतो यद धरियूपीयायां हन पूर्वे अर्धे भियसापरो दर्त |||
verses.transliteration: vadhīdindro varaśikhasya śeṣo.abhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan vṛcīvato yad dhariyūpīyāyāṃ han pūrve ardhe bhiyasāparo dart

translations.griffith: In aid of Abhyavartin Cayamana, Indra destroyed the seed of Varasikha.  At Hariyupiya he smote the vanguard of the Vrcivans, and the rear fled frighted.

verses.sanskrit: तरिंशच्छतं वर्मिण इन्द्र साकं यव्यावत्यां पुरुहूत शरवस्या वर्चीवन्तः शरवे पत्यमानाः पात्रा भिन्दानन्यर्थान्यायन |||
verses.transliteration: triṃśacchataṃ varmiṇa indra sākaṃ yavyāvatyāṃ puruhūta śravasyā vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānanyarthānyāyan

translations.griffith: Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyavati, O much-sought Indra,  Vrcivan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य गावावरुषा सूयवस्यू अन्तरू षु चरतो रेरिहाणा स सर्ञ्जयाय तुर्वशं परादाद वर्चीवतो दैववातायशिक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: yasya ghāvāvaruṣā sūyavasyū antarū ṣu carato rerihāṇā sa sṛñjayāya turvaśaṃ parādād vṛcīvato daivavātāyaśikṣan

translations.griffith: He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven,  Gave Turvaśa to Sṛñjaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vrcivans up to Daivavata.

verses.sanskrit: दवयानग्ने रथिनो विंशतिं गा वधूमतो मघवा मह्यं सम्राट अभ्यावर्ती चायमानो ददाति दूणाशेयं दक्षिणा पार्थवानाम |||
verses.transliteration: dvayānaghne rathino viṃśatiṃ ghā vadhūmato maghavā mahyaṃ samrāṭ abhyāvartī cāyamāno dadāti dūṇāśeyaṃ dakṣiṇā pārthavānām

translations.griffith: Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhydvartin Cayamdna,  The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Prthu's seed is hard to win from others.

verses.sanskrit: आ गावो अग्मन्नुत भद्रमक्रन सीदन्तु गोष्ठे रणयन्त्वस्मे परजावतीः पुरुरूपा इह सयुरिन्द्राय पूर्वीरुषसो दुहानाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghāvo aghmannuta bhadramakran sīdantu ghoṣṭhe raṇayantvasme prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syurindrāya pūrvīruṣaso duhānāḥ

translations.griffith: THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us.  Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो यज्वने पर्णते च शिक्षत्युपेद ददाति न सवं मुषायति भूयो-भूयो रयिमिदस्य वर्धयन्नभिन्ने खिल्ये निदधाति देवयुम |||
verses.transliteration: indro yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣatyuped dadāti na svaṃ muṣāyati bhūyo-bhūyo rayimidasya vardhayannabhinne khilye nidadhāti devayum

translations.griffith: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto.  Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.

verses.sanskrit: न ता नशन्ति न दभाति तस्करो नासामामित्रो वयथिरादधर्षति देवांश्च याभिर्यजते ददाति च जयोगित ताभिः सचते गोपतिः सह |||
verses.transliteration: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsāmāmitro vyathirādadharṣati devāṃśca yābhiryajate dadāti ca jyoghit tābhiḥ sacate ghopatiḥ saha

translations.griffith: These are ne’er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them.  The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: न ता अर्वा रेणुककाटो अश्नुते न संस्क्र्तत्रमुप यन्ति ता अभि उरुगायमभयं तस्य ता अनु गावो मर्तस्य विचरन्ति यज्वनः |||
verses.transliteration: na tā arvā reṇukakāṭo aśnute na saṃskṛtatramupa yanti tā abhi urughāyamabhayaṃ tasya tā anu ghāvo martasya vicaranti yajvanaḥ

translations.griffith: The charger with his dusty brow o’ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way.  These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.

verses.sanskrit: गावो भगो गाव इन्द्रो मे अछान गावः सोमस्य परथमस्य भक्षः इमा या गावः स जनास इन्द्र इछामीद धर्दामनसा चिदिन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: ghāvo bhagho ghāva indro me achān ghāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ imā yā ghāvaḥ sa janāsa indra ichāmīd dhṛdāmanasā cidindram

translations.griffith: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma.  These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं गावो मेदयथा कर्शं चिदश्रीरं चित कर्णुथा सुप्रतीकम भद्रं गर्हं कर्णुथ भद्रवाचो बर्हद वो वय उच्यते सभासु |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ ghāvo medayathā kṛśaṃ cidaśrīraṃ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam bhadraṃ ghṛhaṃ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu

translations.griffith: O Cows, ye fatten e’en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on.  Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.

verses.sanskrit: परजावतीः सूयवसं रिशन्तीः शुद्धा अपः सुप्रपाणेपिबन्तीः मा व सतेन ईशत माघशंसः परि वो हेती रुद्रस्य वर्ज्याः |||
verses.transliteration: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasaṃ riśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇepibantīḥ mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ

translations.griffith: Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places.  Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.

verses.sanskrit: उपेदमुपपर्चनमासु गोषूप पर्च्यताम उप रषभस्य रेतस्युपेन्द्र तव वीर्ये |||
verses.transliteration: upedamupaparcanamāsu ghoṣūpa pṛcyatām upa ṛṣabhasya retasyupendra tava vīrye

translations.griffith: Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows,  Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वो नरः सख्याय सेपुर्महो यन्तः सुमतये चकानाः महो हि दाता वज्रहस्तो अस्ति महामु रण्वमवसे यजध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vo naraḥ sakhyāya sepurmaho yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ maho hi dātā vajrahasto asti mahāmu raṇvamavase yajadhvam

translations.griffith: YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him.  For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्मिन हस्ते नर्या मिमिक्षुरा रथे हिरण्यये रथेष्ठाः आ रश्मयो गभस्त्यो सथूरयोराध्वन्नश्वासो वर्षणो युजानाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yasmin haste naryā mimikṣurā rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ ā raśmayo ghabhastyo sthūrayorādhvannaśvāso vṛṣaṇo yujānāḥ

translations.griffith: Him to whose hand, men closely cling, and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed.  With his firm arms he holds the reins; his Horses, the Stallions, are yoked ready for the journey.

verses.sanskrit: शरिये ते पादा दुव आ मिमिक्षुर्ध्र्ष्णुर्वज्री शवसा दक्षिणावान वसानो अत्कं सुरभिं दर्शे कं सवर्ण नर्तविषिरो बभूथ |||
verses.transliteration: śriye te pādā duva ā mimikṣurdhṛṣṇurvajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svarṇa nṛtaviṣiro babhūtha

translations.griffith: Thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory. Bold, thunder-armed, rich, through thy strength, in guerdon,  Robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on, thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.

verses.sanskrit: स सोम आमिश्लतमः सुतो भूद यस्मिन पक्तिः पच्यते सन्तिधानाः इन्द्रं नर सतुवन्तो बरह्मकारा उक्था शंसन्तो देववाततमाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa soma āmiślatamaḥ suto bhūd yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santidhānāḥ indraṃ nara stuvanto brahmakārā ukthā śaṃsanto devavātatamāḥ

translations.griffith: That Soma when effused hath best consistence, for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled;  By which the men who pray, extolling Indra chief favourites of Gods, recite their praises.

verses.sanskrit: न ते अन्तः शवसो धाय्यस्य वि तु बाबधे रोदसी महित्वा आ ता सूरिः पर्णति तूतुजानो यूथेवाप्सु समीजमान ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: na te antaḥ śavaso dhāyyasya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujāno yūthevāpsu samījamāna ūtī

translations.griffith: No limit of thy might hath been appointed, which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven.  These the Prince filleth full with strong endeavour, driving, as ’twere, with help his flocks to waters.

verses.sanskrit: एवेदिन्द्रः सुहव रष्वो अस्तूती अनूती हिरिशिप्रः सत्वा एवा हि जातो असमात्योजाः पुरू च वर्त्रा हनति नि दस्यून |||
verses.transliteration: evedindraḥ suhava ṛṣvo astūtī anūtī hiriśipraḥ satvā evā hi jāto asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn

translations.griffith: So be the lofty Indra prompt to listen, Helper unaided, golden-visored Hero.  Yea, so may he, shown forth in might unequalled, smite down the many Vṛtras and the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: भूय इद वाव्र्धे वीर्यायनेको अजुर्यो दयते वसूनि पर रिरिचे दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्या अर्धमिदस्य परति रोदसी उभे |||
verses.transliteration: bhūya id vāvṛdhe vīryāyaneko ajuryo dayate vasūni pra ririce diva indraḥ pṛthivyā ardhamidasya prati rodasī ubhe

translations.griffith: INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures.  Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अधा मन्ये बर्हदसुर्यमस्य यानि दाधार नकिरा मिनाति दिवे-दिवे सूर्यो दर्शतो भूद वि सद्मान्युर्विया सुक्रतुर्धात |||
verses.transliteration: adhā manye bṛhadasuryamasya yāni dādhāra nakirā mināti dive-dive sūryo darśato bhūd vi sadmānyurviyā sukraturdhāt

translations.griffith: Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined.  Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.

verses.sanskrit: अद्या चिन नू चित तदपो नदीनां यदाभ्यो अरदो गातुमिन्द्र नि पर्वता अद्मसदो न सेदुस्त्वया दर्ळ्हानि सुक्रतो रजांसि |||
verses.transliteration: adyā cin nū cit tadapo nadīnāṃ yadābhyo arado ghātumindra ni parvatā admasado na sedustvayā dṛḷhāni sukrato rajāṃsi

translations.griffith: E’en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage.  Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यमित तन न तवावानन्यो अस्तीन्द्र देवो न मर्त्यो जयायान अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्णो.अवास्र्जो अपो अछा समुद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: satyamit tan na tvāvānanyo astīndra devo na martyo jyāyān ahannahiṃ pariśayānamarṇo.avāsṛjo apo achā samudram

translations.griffith: This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal.  Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.

verses.sanskrit: तवमपो वि दुरो विषूचीरिन्द्र दर्ळ्हमरुजः पर्वतस्य राजाभवो जगतश्चर्षणीनां साकं सूर्यं जनयन दयामुषासम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamapo vi duro viṣūcīrindra dṛḷhamarujaḥ parvatasya rājābhavo jaghataścarṣaṇīnāṃ sākaṃ sūryaṃ janayan dyāmuṣāsam

translations.griffith: Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain.  Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.

verses.sanskrit: अभूरेको रयिपते रयीणामा हस्तयोरधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः वि तोके अप्सु तनये च सूरे.अवोचन्त चर्षणयो विवाचः |||
verses.transliteration: abhūreko rayipate rayīṇāmā hastayoradhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre.avocanta carṣaṇayo vivācaḥ

translations.griffith: SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra!  Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.

verses.sanskrit: तवद भियेन्द्र पार्थिवानि विश्वाच्युता चिच्च्यावयन्ते रजांसि दयावाक्षामा पर्वतासो वनानि विश्वं दर्ळ्हं भयते अज्मन्ना ते |||
verses.transliteration: tvad bhiyendra pārthivāni viśvācyutā ciccyāvayante rajāṃsi dyāvākṣāmā parvatāso vanāni viśvaṃ dṛḷhaṃ bhayate ajmannā te

translations.griffith: Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble.  All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.

verses.sanskrit: तवं कुत्सेनाभि शुष्णमिन्द्राशुषं युध्य कुयवं गविष्टौ दश परपित्वे अध सूर्यस्य मुषायश्चक्रमविवेरपांसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ kutsenābhi śuṣṇamindrāśuṣaṃ yudhya kuyavaṃ ghaviṣṭau daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaścakramaviverapāṃsi

translations.griffith: With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Śuṣṇa, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle.  In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.

verses.sanskrit: तवं शतान्यव शम्बरस्य पुरो जघन्थाप्रतीनि सस्योः अशिक्षो यत्र शच्या शचीवो दिवोदासाय सुन्वते सुतक्रे भरद्वाजाय गर्णते वसूनि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ śatānyava śambarasya puro jaghanthāpratīni sasyoḥ aśikṣo yatra śacyā śacīvo divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya ghṛṇate vasūni

translations.griffith: Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Śambara the Dasyu,  When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodāsa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharadvāja rich who praised thee.

verses.sanskrit: स सत्यसत्वन महते रणाय रथमा तिष्ठ तुविन्र्म्ण भीमम याहि परपथिन्नवसोप मद्रिक पर च शरुत शरावय चर्षणिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sa satyasatvan mahate raṇāya rathamā tiṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhīmam yāhi prapathinnavasopa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly.  Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.

verses.sanskrit: अपूर्व्या पुरुतमान्यस्मै महे वीराय तवसे तुराय विरप्शिने वज्रिणे शन्तमानि वचांस्यासा सथविराय तक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: apūrvyā purutamānyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsyāsā sthavirāya takṣam

translations.griffith: I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious,  For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.

verses.sanskrit: स मातरा सूर्येणा कवीनामवासयद रुजदद्रिं गर्णानः सवाधीभिर्र्क्वभिर्वावशान उदुस्रियाणामस्र्जन निदानम |||
verses.transliteration: sa mātarā sūryeṇā kavīnāmavāsayad rujadadriṃ ghṛṇānaḥ svādhībhirṛkvabhirvāvaśāna udusriyāṇāmasṛjan nidānam

translations.griffith: Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain;  And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.

verses.sanskrit: स वह्निभिर्र्क्वभिर्गोषु शश्वन मितज्ञुभिः पुरुक्र्त्वा जिगाय पुरः पुरोहा सखिभिः सखीयन दर्ळ्हा रुरोज कविभिः कविः सन |||
verses.transliteration: sa vahnibhirṛkvabhirghoṣu śaśvan mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jighāya puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san

translations.griffith: Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle,  And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.

verses.sanskrit: स नीव्याभिर्जरितारमछा महो वाजेभिर्महद्भिश्च शुष्मैः पुरुवीराभिर्व्र्षभ कषितीनामा गिर्वणः सुविताय पर याहि |||
verses.transliteration: sa nīvyābhirjaritāramachā maho vājebhirmahadbhiśca śuṣmaiḥ puruvīrābhirvṛṣabha kṣitīnāmā ghirvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi

translations.griffith: Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises.  Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.

verses.sanskrit: स सर्गेण शवसा तक्तो अत्यैरप इन्द्रो दक्षिणतस्तुराषाट इत्था सर्जाना अनपाव्र्दर्थं दिवे-दिवे विविषुरप्रम्र्ष्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa sargheṇa śavasā takto atyairapa indro dakṣiṇatasturāṣāṭ itthā sṛjānā anapāvṛdarthaṃ dive-dive viviṣurapramṛṣyam

translations.griffith: Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward.  Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.

verses.sanskrit: य ओजिष्ठ इन्द्र तं सु नो दा मदो वर्षन सवभिष्टिर्दास्वान सौवश्व्यं यो वनवत सवश्वो वर्त्रा समत्सु सासहदमित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: ya ojiṣṭha indra taṃ su no dā mado vṛṣan svabhiṣṭirdāsvān sauvaśvyaṃ yo vanavat svaśvo vṛtrā samatsu sāsahadamitrān

translations.griffith: GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero,  That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vṛtras and the foes in battle.

verses.sanskrit: तवां हीन्द्रावसे विवाचो हवन्ते चर्षणयः शूरसातौ तवं विप्रेभिर्वि पणीन्रशायस्त्वोत इत सनिता वाजमर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ hīndrāvase vivāco havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau tvaṃ viprebhirvi paṇīnraśāyastvota it sanitā vājamarvā

translations.griffith: For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes.  Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Paṇis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तानिन्द्रोभयानमित्रान दासा वर्त्राण्यार्या च शूर वधीर्वनेव सुधितेभिरत्कैरा पर्त्सु दर्षि नर्णां नर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tānindrobhayānamitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇyāryā ca śūra vadhīrvaneva sudhitebhiratkairā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇāṃ nṛtama

translations.griffith: Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Ārya and the Dāsa,  Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chieftain!

verses.sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्राकवाभिरूती सखा विश्वायुरविता वर्धे भूः सवर्षाता यद धवयामसि तवा युध्यन्तो नेमधिताप्र्त्सु शूर |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indrākavābhirūtī sakhā viśvāyuravitā vṛdhe bhūḥ svarṣātā yad dhvayāmasi tvā yudhyanto nemadhitāpṛtsu śūra

translations.griffith: Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth,  When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.

verses.sanskrit: नूनं न इन्द्रापराय च सया भवा मर्ळीक उत नो अभिष्टौ इत्था गर्णन्तो महिनस्य शर्मन दिवि षयाम पार्ये गोषतमाः |||
verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ na indrāparāya ca syā bhavā mṛḷīka uta no abhiṣṭau itthā ghṛṇanto mahinasya śarman divi ṣyāma pārye ghoṣatamāḥ

translations.griffith: Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us.  Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.

verses.sanskrit: सं च तवे जग्मुर्गिर इन्द्र पूर्वीर्वि च तवद यन्ति विभ्वोमनीषाः पूरा नूनं च सतुतय रषीणां पस्प्र्ध्र इन्द्रे अध्युक्थार्का |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ ca tve jaghmurghira indra pūrvīrvi ca tvad yanti vibhvomanīṣāḥ pūrā nūnaṃ ca stutaya ṛṣīṇāṃ paspṛdhra indre adhyukthārkā

translations.griffith: FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth.  Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुहूतो यः पुरुगूर्त रभ्वानेकः पुरुप्रशस्तो अस्ति यज्ञैः रथो न महे शवसे युजानो.अस्माभिरिन्द्रो अनुमाद्यो भूत |||
verses.transliteration: puruhūto yaḥ purughūrta ṛbhvānekaḥ purupraśasto asti yajñaiḥ ratho na mahe śavase yujāno.asmābhirindro anumādyo bhūt

translations.griffith: He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices.  Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.

verses.sanskrit: न यं हिंसन्ति धीतयो न वाणीरिन्द्रं नक्षन्तीदभि वर्धयन्तीः यदि सतोतारः शतं यत सहस्रं गर्णन्ति गिर्वणसं शं तदस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ hiṃsanti dhītayo na vāṇīrindraṃ nakṣantīdabhi vardhayantīḥ yadi stotāraḥ śataṃ yat sahasraṃ ghṛṇanti ghirvaṇasaṃ śaṃ tadasmai

translations.griffith: They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble;  For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा एतद दिव्यर्चेव मासा मिमिक्ष इन्द्रे नययामि सोमः जनं न धन्वन्नभि सं यदापः सत्रा वाव्र्धुर्हवनानि यज्ञैः |||
verses.transliteration: asmā etad divyarceva māsā mimikṣa indre nyayāmi somaḥ janaṃ na dhanvannabhi saṃ yadāpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhurhavanāni yajñaiḥ

translations.griffith: As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra.  Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा एतन मह्याङगूषमस्मा इन्द्राय सतोत्रं मतिभिरवाचि असद यथा महति वर्त्रतूर्य इन्द्रो विश्वायुरविता वर्धश्च |||
verses.transliteration: asmā etan mahyāṅghūṣamasmā indrāya stotraṃ matibhiravāci asad yathā mahati vṛtratūrya indro viśvāyuravitā vṛdhaśca

translations.griffith: To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets,  That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.

verses.sanskrit: कदा भुवन रथक्षयाणि बरह्म कदा सतोत्रे सहस्रपोष्यन्दाः कदा सतोमं वासयो.अस्य राया कदा धियः करसि वाजरत्नाः |||
verses.transliteration: kadā bhuvan rathakṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasrapoṣyandāḥ kadā stomaṃ vāsayo.asya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vājaratnāḥ

translations.griffith: WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands?  When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

verses.sanskrit: कर्हि सवित तदिन्द्र यन नर्भिर्नॄन वीरैर्वीरान नीळयासे जयाजीन तरिधातु गा अधि जयासि गोष्विन्द्र दयुम्नंस्वर्वद धेह्यस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: karhi svit tadindra yan nṛbhirnṝn vīrairvīrān nīḷayāse jayājīn tridhātu ghā adhi jayāsi ghoṣvindra dyumnaṃsvarvad dhehyasme

translations.griffith: When wilt thou gatber men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat?  Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.

verses.sanskrit: कर्हि सवित तदिन्द्र यज्जरित्रे विष्वप्सु बरह्म कर्णवः शविष्ठ कदा धियो न नियुतो युवासे कदा गोमघा हवनानि गछाः |||
verses.transliteration: karhi svit tadindra yajjaritre viṣvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha kadā dhiyo na niyuto yuvāse kadā ghomaghā havanāni ghachāḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer?  When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

verses.sanskrit: स गोमघा जरित्रे अश्वश्चन्द्रा वाजश्रवसो अधि धेहि पर्क्षः पीपिहीषः सुदुघामिन्द्र धेनुं भरद्वाजेषु सुरुचो रुरुच्याः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghomaghā jaritre aśvaścandrā vājaśravaso adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ pīpihīṣaḥ sudughāmindra dhenuṃ bharadvājeṣu suruco rurucyāḥ

translations.griffith: Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches.  Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvājas.

verses.sanskrit: तमा नूनं वर्जनमन्यथा चिच्छूरो यच्छक्र वि दुरोग्र्णीषे मा निररं शुक्रदुघस्य धेनोराङगिरसान बरह्मणा विप्र जिन्व |||
verses.transliteration: tamā nūnaṃ vṛjanamanyathā cicchūro yacchakra vi duroghṛṇīṣe mā niraraṃ śukradughasya dhenorāṅghirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva

translations.griffith: Lead otherwise this present foeman, Śakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer  Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Aṅgirases by devotion.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रा मदासस्तव विश्वजन्याः सत्रा रायो.अध ये पार्थिवासः सत्रा वाजानामभवो विभक्ता यद देवेषु धारयथा असुर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: satrā madāsastava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyo.adha ye pārthivāsaḥ satrā vājānāmabhavo vibhaktā yad deveṣu dhārayathā asuryam

translations.griffith: THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches.  Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.

verses.sanskrit: अनु पर येजे जन ओजो अस्य सत्रा दधिरे अनु वीर्याय सयूमग्र्भे दुधये.अर्वते च करतुं वर्ञ्जन्त्यपि वर्त्रहत्ये |||
verses.transliteration: anu pra yeje jana ojo asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya syūmaghṛbhe dudhaye.arvate ca kratuṃ vṛñjantyapi vṛtrahatye

translations.griffith: Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour.  For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vṛtra's slaughter.

verses.sanskrit: तं सध्रीचीरूतयो वर्ष्ण्यानि पौंस्यानि नियुतः सश्चुरिन्द्रम समुद्रं न सिन्धव उक्थशुष्मा उरुव्यचसं गिरा विशन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ sadhrīcīrūtayo vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścurindram samudraṃ na sindhava ukthaśuṣmā uruvyacasaṃ ghiraā viśanti

translations.griffith: Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra.  As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.

verses.sanskrit: स रायस खामुप सर्जा गर्णानः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य तवमिन्द्रवस्वः पतिर्बभूथासमो जनानामेको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: sa rāyas khāmupa sṛjā ghṛṇānaḥ puruścandrasya tvamindravasvaḥ patirbabhūthāsamo janānāmeko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā

translations.griffith: Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches.  For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.

verses.sanskrit: स तु शरुधि शरुत्या यो दुवोयुर्द्यौर्न भूमाभि रायोर्यः असो यथा नः शवसा चकानो युगे-युगे वयसा चेकितानः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yo duvoyurdyaurna bhūmābhi rāyoaryaḥ aso yathā naḥ śavasā cakāno yughe-yughe vayasā cekitānaḥ

translations.griffith: Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treasure;  Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाग रथं विश्ववारं त उग्रेन्द्र युक्तासो हरयो वहन्तु कीरिश्चिद धि तवा हवते सवर्वान रधीमहि सधमादस्तेद्य |||
verses.transliteration: arvāgh rathaṃ viśvavāraṃ ta ughrendra yuktāso harayo vahantu kīriścid dhi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādasteadya

translations.griffith: LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing.  For thee, the Heavenly, e’en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.

verses.sanskrit: परो दरोणे हरयः कर्माग्मन पुनानास रज्यन्तो अभूवन इन्द्रो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पपीयाद दयुक्षो मदस्य सोम्यस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: pro droṇe harayaḥ karmāghman punānāsa ṛjyanto abhūvan indro no asya pūrvyaḥ papīyād dyukṣo madasya somyasya rājā

translations.griffith: Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward.  May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: आसस्राणासः शवसानमछेन्द्रं सुचक्रे रथ्यासो अश्वाः अभि शरव रज्यन्तो वहेयुर्नू चिन नु वायोरम्र्तं विदस्येत |||
verses.transliteration: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānamachendraṃ sucakre rathyāso aśvāḥ abhi śrava ṛjyanto vaheyurnū cin nu vāyoramṛtaṃ vidasyet

translations.griffith: Bringing us hitherward all-potent Indra on well-wheeled chariot, may the Steeds who bear him  Convey him on the road direct to glory, and ne’er may Vāyu's Amṛta cease and fail him.

verses.sanskrit: वरिष्ठो अस्य दक्षिणामियर्तीन्द्रो मघोनां तुविकूर्मितमः यया वज्रिवः परियास्यंहो मघा च धर्ष्णो दयसे वि सूरीन |||
verses.transliteration: variṣṭho asya dakṣiṇāmiyartīndro maghonāṃ tuvikūrmitamaḥ yayā vajrivaḥ pariyāsyaṃho maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn

translations.griffith: Supreme, he stirs this man to give the guerdon,—Indra, most efficacious of the princes,—  Wherewith, O Thunderer, thou removest sorrow, and, Bold One! partest wealth among the nobles.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वाजस्य सथविरस्य दातेन्द्रो गीर्भिर्वर्धतां वर्द्धमहाः इन्द्रो वर्त्रं हनिष्ठो अस्तु सत्वा ता सूरिः पर्णति तूतुजानः |||
verses.transliteration: indro vājasya sthavirasya dātendro ghīrbhirvardhatāṃ vṛddhamahāḥ indro vṛtraṃ haniṣṭho astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra is hewho gives enduring vigour: may our songs magnify the God Most Mighty.  Best Vṛtra-slayer be the Hero Indra these things he gives as Prince, with strong endeavour.

verses.sanskrit: अपादित उदु नश्चित्रतमो महीं भर्षद दयुमतीमिन्द्रहूतिम पन्यसीं धीतिं दैव्यस्य यामञ जनस्य रातिं वनते सुदानुः |||
verses.transliteration: apādita udu naścitratamo mahīṃ bharṣad dyumatīmindrahūtim panyasīṃ dhītiṃ daivyasya yāmañ janasya rātiṃ vanate sudānuḥ

translations.griffith: HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra.  The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.

verses.sanskrit: दूराच्चिदा वसतो अस्य कर्णा घोषादिन्द्रस्य तन्यति बरुवाणः एयमेनं देवहूतिर्वव्र्त्यान मद्र्यगिन्द्रमियं रच्यमाना |||
verses.transliteration: dūrāccidā vasato asya karṇā ghoṣādindrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ eyamenaṃ devahūtirvavṛtyān madryaghindramiyaṃ ṛcyamānā

translations.griffith: The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e’en from a distance.  May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.

verses.sanskrit: तं वो धिया परमया पुराजामजरमिन्द्रमभ्यनूष्यर्कैः बरह्मा च गिरो दधिरे समस्मिन महांश्च सतोमो अधि वर्धदिन्द्रे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vo dhiyā paramayā purājāmajaramindramabhyanūṣyarkaiḥ brahmā ca ghiro dadhire samasmin mahāṃśca stomo adhi vardhadindre

translations.griffith: Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting.  For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:

verses.sanskrit: वर्धाद यं यज्ञ उत सोम इन्द्रं वर्धाद बरह्म गिर उक्था च मन्म वर्धाहैनमुषसो यामन्नक्तोर्वर्धान मासाः शरदो दयाव इन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: vardhād yaṃ yajña uta soma indraṃ vardhād brahma ghira ukthā ca manma vardhāhainamuṣaso yāmannaktorvardhān māsāḥ śarado dyāva indram
