translations.griffith: Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion,  Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and autumns.

verses.sanskrit: एवा जज्ञानं सहसे असामि वाव्र्धानं राधसे च शरुताय महामुग्रमवसे विप्र नूनमा विवासेम वर्त्रतूर्येषु |||
verses.transliteration: evā jajñānaṃ sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānaṃ rādhase ca śrutāya mahāmughramavase vipra nūnamā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu

translations.griffith: Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory,  Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रस्य कवेर्दिव्यस्य वह्नेर्विप्रमन्मनो वचनस्य मध्वः अपा नस्तस्य सचनस्य देवेषो युवस्व गर्णते गोग्राः |||
verses.transliteration: mandrasya kaverdivyasya vahnervipramanmano vacanasya madhvaḥ apā nastasya sacanasya deveṣo yuvasva ghṛṇate ghoaghrāḥ

translations.griffith: OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion,  Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.

verses.sanskrit: अयमुशानः पर्यद्रिमुस्र रतधीतिभिर्र्तयुग युजानः रुजदरुग्णं वि वलस्य सानुं पणीन्र्वचोभिरभि योधदिन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: ayamuśānaḥ paryadrimusra ṛtadhītibhirṛtayugh yujānaḥ rujadarughṇaṃ vi valasya sānuṃ paṇīnrvacobhirabhi yodhadindraḥ

translations.griffith: Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades,  He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Paṇis.

verses.sanskrit: अयं दयोतयदद्युतो वयक्तून दोषा वस्तोः शरद इन्दुरिन्द्र इमं केतुमदधुर्नू चिदह्नां शुचिजन्मन उषसश्चकार |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ dyotayadadyuto vyaktūn doṣā vastoḥ śarada indurindra imaṃ ketumadadhurnū cidahnāṃ śucijanmana uṣasaścakāra

translations.griffith: This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening.  Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.

verses.sanskrit: अयं रोचयदरुचो रुचानो.अयं वासयद वय रतेन पूर्वीः अयमीयत रतयुग्भिरश्वैः सवर्विदा नाभिना चर्षणिप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ rocayadaruco rucāno.ayaṃ vāsayad vy ṛtena pūrvīḥ ayamīyata ṛtayughbhiraśvaiḥ svarvidā nābhinā carṣaṇiprāḥ

translations.griffith: He shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings.  He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit: नू गर्णानो गर्णते परत्न राजन्निषः पिन्व वसुदेयाय पूर्वीः अप ओषधीरविषा वनानि गा अर्वतो नॄन रचसे रिरीहि |||
verses.transliteration: nū ghṛṇāno ghṛṇate pratna rājanniṣaḥ pinva vasudeyāya pūrvīḥ apa oṣadhīraviṣā vanāni ghā arvato nṝn ṛcase rirīhi

translations.griffith: Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures.  Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब तुभ्यं सुतो मदायाव सय हरी वि मुचा सखाया उत पर गाय गण आ निषद्याथा यज्ञाय गर्णते वयो धाः |||
verses.transliteration: indra piba tubhyaṃ suto madāyāva sya harī vi mucā sakhāyā uta pra ghāya ghaṇa ā niṣadyāthā yajñāya ghṛṇate vayo dhāḥ

translations.griffith: DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom.  Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य पिब यस्य जज्ञान इन्द्र मदाय करत्वे अपिबो विरप्शिन तमु ते गावो नर आपो अद्रिरिन्दुं समह्यन पीतये समस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: asya piba yasya jajñāna indra madāya kratve apibo virapśin tamu te ghāvo nara āpo adririnduṃ samahyan pītaye samasmai

translations.griffith: Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture.  The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धे अग्नौ सुत इन्द्र सोम आ तवा वहन्तु हरयो वहिष्ठाः तवायता मनसा जोहवीमीन्द्रा याहि सुविताय महे नः |||
verses.transliteration: samiddhe aghnau suta indra soma ā tvā vahantu harayo vahiṣṭhāḥ tvāyatā manasā johavīmīndrā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ

translations.griffith: The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither.  With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि शश्वदुशता ययाथेन्द्र महा मनसा सोमपेयम उप बरह्माणि शर्णव इमा नो.अथा ते यज्ञस्तन्वे वयो धात |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi śaśvaduśatā yayāthendra mahā manasā somapeyam upa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā no.athā te yajñastanve vayo dhāt

translations.griffith: Indra, come hither: evermore thou camest through our great strong desire to drink the Soma.  Listen and hear the prayers which now we offer, and let this sacrifice increase thy vigour.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र दिवि पार्ये यद रधग यद वा सवे सदने यत्र वासि अतो नो यज्ञमवसे नियुत्वान सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra divi pārye yad ṛdhagh yad vā sve sadane yatra vāsi ato no yajñamavase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi ghirvaṇo marudbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Mayst thou, O Indra, on the day of trial, present or absent, wheresoe’er thou dwellest,  Thence, with thy team, accordant with the Maruts, Song-lover! guard our sacrifice, to help us.

verses.sanskrit: अहेळमान उप याहि यज्ञं तुभ्यं पवन्त इन्दवः सुतासः गावो न वज्रिन सवमोको अछेन्द्रा गहि परथमो यज्ञियानाम |||
verses.transliteration: aheḷamāna upa yāhi yajñaṃ tubhyaṃ pavanta indavaḥ sutāsaḥ ghāvo na vajrin svamoko achendrā ghahi prathamo yajñiyānām

translations.griffith: COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee.  As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.

verses.sanskrit: या ते काकुत सुक्र्ता या वरिष्ठा यया शश्वत पिबसि मध्व ऊर्मिम तया पाहि पर ते अध्वर्युरस्थात सं ते वज्रोवर्ततामिन्द्र गव्युः |||
verses.transliteration: yā te kākut sukṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhva ūrmim tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryurasthāt saṃ te vajrovartatāmindra ghavyuḥ

translations.griffith: With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness,  Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.

verses.sanskrit: एष दरप्सो वर्षभो विश्वरूप इन्द्राय वर्ष्णे समकारि सोमः एतं पिब हरिव सथातरुग्र यस्येशिषे परदिवि यस्तेन्नम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa drapso vṛṣabho viśvarūpa indrāya vṛṣṇe samakāri somaḥ etaṃ piba hariva sthātarughra yasyeśiṣe pradivi yasteannam

translations.griffith: This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India.  Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.

verses.sanskrit: सुतः सोमो असुतादिन्द्र वस्यानयं शरेयाञ्चिकितुषे रणाय एतं तितिर्व उप याहि यज्ञं तेन विश्वास्तविषीरा पर्णस्व |||
verses.transliteration: sutaḥ somo asutādindra vasyānayaṃ śreyāñcikituṣe raṇāya etaṃ titirva upa yāhi yajñaṃ tena viśvāstaviṣīrā pṛṇasva

translations.griffith: Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure.  Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.

verses.sanskrit: हवयामसि तवेन्द्र याह्यर्वां अरं ते सोमस्तन्वे भवाति शतक्रतो मादयस्वा सुतेषु परास्मानव पर्तनासु पर विक्षु |||
verses.transliteration: hvayāmasi tvendra yāhyarvāṃ araṃ te somastanve bhavāti śatakrato mādayasvā suteṣu prāsmānava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu

translations.griffith: We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body.  Rejoice thee, Śatakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यस्मै पिपीषते विश्वानि विदुषे भर अरंगमाय जग्मये.अपश्चाद्दघ्वने नरे |||
verses.transliteration: pratyasmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara araṃghamāya jaghmaye.apaścāddaghvane nare

translations.griffith: BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink,  The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.

verses.sanskrit: एमेनं परत्येतन सोमेभिः सोमपातमम अमत्रेभिर्र्जीषिणमिन्द्रं सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: emenaṃ pratyetana somebhiḥ somapātamam amatrebhirṛjīṣiṇamindraṃ sutebhirindubhiḥ

translations.griffith: With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice:  With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.

verses.sanskrit: यदी सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः सोमेभिः परतिभूषथ वेदा विश्वस्य मेधिरो धर्षत तं-तमिदेषते |||
verses.transliteration: yadī sutebhirindubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣat taṃ-tamideṣate

translations.griffith: What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God,  Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा-अस्मा इदन्धसो.अध्वर्यो पर भरा सुतम कुवित समस्य जेन्यस्य शर्धतो.अभिशस्तेरवस्परत |||
verses.transliteration: asmā-asmā idandhaso.adhvaryo pra bharā sutam kuvit samasya jenyasya śardhato.abhiśasteravasparat

translations.griffith: To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed.  Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तयच्छम्बरं मदे दिवोदासाय रन्धयः अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tyacchambaraṃ made divodāsāya randhayaḥ ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba

translations.griffith: IN whose wild joy thou madest once Śambara Divodāsa's prey,  This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तीव्रसुतं मदं मध्यमन्तं च रक्षसे अयं स... |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tīvrasutaṃ madaṃ madhyamantaṃ ca rakṣase ayaṃ sa...

translations.griffith: Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end,  This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

verses.sanskrit: यस्य गा अन्तरश्मनो मदे दर्ळ्हा अवास्र्जः अयं स .. . |||
verses.transliteration: yasya ghā antaraśmano made dṛḷhā avāsṛjaḥ ayaṃ sa .. .

translations.griffith: In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock,  This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

verses.sanskrit: यस्य मन्दानो अन्धसो माघोनं दधिषे शवः अयं स... |||
verses.transliteration: yasya mandāno andhaso māghonaṃ dadhiṣe śavaḥ ayaṃ sa...

translations.griffith: This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan,  This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

verses.sanskrit: यो रयिवो रयिन्तमो यो दयुम्नैर्द्युम्नवत्तमः सोमः सुतः स इन्द्र ते.अस्ति सवधापते मदः |||
verses.transliteration: yo rayivo rayintamo yo dyumnairdyumnavattamaḥ somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te.asti svadhāpate madaḥ

translations.griffith: THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious,  Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

verses.sanskrit: यः शग्मस्तुविशग्म ते रायो दामा मतीनाम सोमः सुतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śaghmastuviśaghma te rāyo dāmā matīnām somaḥ sutaḥ ...

translations.griffith: Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns,  Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

verses.sanskrit: येन वर्द्धो न शवसा तुरो न सवाभिरूतिभिः सोमः सुतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yena vṛddho na śavasā turo na svābhirūtibhiḥ somaḥ sutaḥ ...

translations.griffith: Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids,  Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

verses.sanskrit: तयमु वो अप्रहणं गर्णीषे शवसस पतिम इन्द्रं विश्वासाहं नरं मंहिष्ठं विश्वचर्षणिम |||
verses.transliteration: tyamu vo aprahaṇaṃ ghṛṇīṣe śavasas patim indraṃ viśvāsāhaṃ naraṃ maṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim

translations.griffith: Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none,  The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.

verses.sanskrit: यं वर्धयन्तीद गिरः पतिं तुरस्य राधसः तमिन्न्वस्य रोदसी देवी शुष्मं सपर्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ vardhayantīd ghiraḥ patiṃ turasya rādhasaḥ taminnvasya rodasī devī śuṣmaṃ saparyataḥ

translations.griffith: Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him,  Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.

verses.sanskrit: तद व उक्थस्य बर्हणेन्द्रायोपस्त्र्णीषणि विपो न यस्योतयो वि यद रोहन्ति सक्षितः |||
verses.transliteration: tad va ukthasya barhaṇendrāyopastṛṇīṣaṇi vipo na yasyotayo vi yad rohanti sakṣitaḥ

translations.griffith: To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise.  The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.

verses.sanskrit: अविदद दक्षं मित्रो नवीयान पपानो देवेभ्यो वस्यो अचैत ससवान सतौलाभिर्धौतरीभिरुरुष्या पायुरभवत सखिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: avidad dakṣaṃ mitro navīyān papāno devebhyo vasyo acait sasavān staulābhirdhautarībhiruruṣyā pāyurabhavat sakhibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods.  He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य पथि वेधा अपायि शरिये मनांसि देवासो अक्रन दधानो नाम महो वचोभिर्वपुर्द्र्शये वेन्यो वयावः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya pathi vedhā apāyi śriye manāṃsi devāso akran dadhāno nāma maho vacobhirvapurdṛśaye venyo vyāvaḥ

translations.griffith: In course of Law the sapient juice was quaffed: the Deities to glory turned their mind.  Winning through hymns a lofty title, he, the Lovely, made his beauteous form apparent.

verses.sanskrit: दयुमत्तमं दक्षं धेह्यस्मे सेधा जनानां पूर्वीररातीः वर्षीयो वयः कर्णुहि शचीभिर्धनस्य सातावस्मानविड्ढि |||
verses.transliteration: dyumattamaṃ dakṣaṃ dhehyasme sedhā janānāṃ pūrvīrarātīḥ varṣīyo vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhirdhanasya sātāvasmānaviḍḍhi

translations.griffith: Bestow on us the most illustrious strength ward off men's manifold malignities.  Give with thy might abundant vital force, and aid us graciously in gaining riches.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र तुभ्यमिन मघवन्नभूम वयं दात्रे हरिवो मा विवेनः नकिरापिर्दद्र्शे मर्त्यत्रा किमङग रध्रचोदनन्त्वाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: indra tubhyamin maghavannabhūma vayaṃ dātre harivo mā vivenaḥ nakirāpirdadṛśe martyatrā kimaṅgha radhracodanantvāhuḥ

translations.griffith: We turn to thee as Giver, liberal Indra. Lord of the Bay Steeds, be not thou ungracious.  No friend among mankind have we to lookto: why have men called thee him who spurs the niggard?

verses.sanskrit: मा जस्वने वर्षभ नो ररीथा मा ते रेवतः सख्ये रिषाम पूर्वीष ट इन्द्र निष्षिधो जनेषु जह्यसुष्वीन पर वर्हाप्र्णतः |||
verses.transliteration: mā jasvane vṛṣabha no rarīthā mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma pūrvīṣ ṭa indra niṣṣidho janeṣu jahyasuṣvīn pra vṛhāpṛṇataḥ

translations.griffith: Give us not up, Strong Hero! to the hungry: unharmed be we whom thou, so rich, befriendest.  Full many a boon hast thou for men demolish those who present no gifts nor pour oblations.

verses.sanskrit: उदभ्राणीव सतनयन्नियर्तीन्द्रो राधांस्यश्व्यानि गव्या तवमसि परदिवः कारुधाया मा तवादामान आ दभन्मघोनः |||
verses.transliteration: udabhrāṇīva stanayanniyartīndro rādhāṃsyaśvyāni ghavyā tvamasi pradivaḥ kārudhāyā mā tvādāmāna ā dabhanmaghonaḥ

translations.griffith: As Indra thundering impels the rain-clouds, so doth he send us store of kine and horses.  Thou art of old the Cherisher of singers let not the rich who bring no gifts deceive thee.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यो वीर पर महे सुतानामिन्द्राय भर स हयस्य राजा यः पूर्व्याभिरुत नूतनाभिर्गीर्भिर्वाव्र्धे गर्णतां रषीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānāmindrāya bhara sa hyasya rājā yaḥ pūrvyābhiruta nūtanābhirghīrbhirvāvṛdhe ghṛṇatāṃ ṛṣīṇām

translations.griffith: Adbyaryu, hero, bring to mighty Indrafor he is King thereof-the pressed-out juices;  To him exalted by the hymns and praises, ancient and modern, of the singing Ṛṣis.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य मदे पुरु वर्पांसि विद्वानिन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रती जघान तमु पर होषि मधुमन्तमस्मै सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे पिबध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: asya made puru varpāṃsi vidvānindro vṛtrāṇyapratī jaghāna tamu pra hoṣi madhumantamasmai somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai

translations.griffith: In the wild joy of this hath Indra, knowing full many a form, struck down resistless Vṛtras.  Proclaim aloud to him the savoury Soma so that the Hero, strong of jaw, may drink it.

verses.sanskrit: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं हन्ता वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः गन्ता यज्ञं परावतश्चिदछा वसुर्धीनामविता कारुधायाः |||
verses.transliteration: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ hantā vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ ghantā yajñaṃ parāvataścidachā vasurdhīnāmavitā kārudhāyāḥ

translations.griffith: May Indra drink this Soma poured to please him, and cheered therewith slay Vṛtra with his thunder.  Come to our sacrifice even from a distance, good lover of our songs, the bard's Supporter.

verses.sanskrit: इदं तयत पात्रमिन्द्रपानमिन्द्रस्य परियमम्र्तमपायि मत्सद यथा सौमनसाय देवं वयस्मद दवेषो युयवद वयंहः |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ tyat pātramindrapānamindrasya priyamamṛtamapāyi matsad yathā saumanasāya devaṃ vyasmad dveṣo yuyavad vyaṃhaḥ

translations.griffith: The cup whence Indra drinks the draught is present: the Amṛta dear to Indra hath been drunken,  That it may cheer the God to gracious favour, and keep far from us hatred and affliction.

verses.sanskrit: एना मन्दानो जहि शूर शत्रूञ जामिमजामिं मघवन्नमित्रान अभिषेणानभ्यादेदिशानान पराच इन्द्र पर मर्णाजही च |||
verses.transliteration: enā mandāno jahi śūra śatrūñ jāmimajāmiṃ maghavannamitrān abhiṣeṇānabhyādediśānān parāca indra pra mṛṇājahī ca

translations.griffith: Therewith enraptured, Hero, slay our foemen, the unfriendly, Maghavan be they kin or strangers,  Those who still aim their hostile darts to smite us, turn them to flight, O Indra, crush and kill them.

verses.sanskrit: आसु षमा णो मघवन्निन्द्र पर्त्स्वस्मभ्यं महि वरिवः सुगं कः अपां तोकस्य तनयस्य जेष इन्द्र सूरीन कर्णुहिस्मा नो अर्धम |||
verses.transliteration: āsu ṣmā ṇo maghavannindra pṛtsvasmabhyaṃ mahi varivaḥ sughaṃ kaḥ apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣa indra sūrīn kṛṇuhismā no ardham

translations.griffith: O Indra Maghavan, in these our battles win easy paths for us and ample freedom.  That we may gain waters and seed and offspring, set thou our princes on thy side, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा हरयो वर्षणो युजाना वर्षरथासो वर्षरश्मयो.अत्याः अस्मत्राञ्चो वर्षणो वज्रवाहो वर्ष्णे मदाय सुयुजोवहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā harayo vṛṣaṇo yujānā vṛṣarathāso vṛṣaraśmayo.atyāḥ asmatrāñco vṛṣaṇo vajravāho vṛṣṇe madāya suyujovahantu

translations.griffith: Let thy Bay Stallions, harnessed, bring thee hither, Steeds with strong chariot and strong reins to hold them,  Strong Horses, speeding hither, bearing thunder, well-harnessed, for the strong exciting potion.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते वर्षन वर्षणो दरोणमस्थुर्घ्र्तप्रुषो नोर्मयो मदन्तः इन्द्र पर तुभ्यं वर्षभिः सुतानां वर्ष्णे भरन्तिव्र्षभाय सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: ā te vṛṣan vṛṣaṇo droṇamasthurghṛtapruṣo normayo madantaḥ indra pra tubhyaṃ vṛṣabhiḥ sutānāṃ vṛṣṇe bharantivṛṣabhāya somam

translations.griffith: Beside the vat, Strong God! stand thy strong Horses, shining with holy oil, like waves exulting.  Indra, they bring to thee, the Strong and Mighty, Soma of juices shed by mighty press-stones.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षासि दिवो वर्षभः पर्थिव्या वर्षा सिन्धूनां वर्षभस्तियानाम वर्ष्णे त इन्दुर्व्र्षभ पीपाय सवादू रसो मधुपेयो वराय |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣāsi divo vṛṣabhaḥ pṛthivyā vṛṣā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabhastiyānām vṛṣṇe ta indurvṛṣabha pīpāya svādū raso madhupeyo varāya

translations.griffith: Thou art the Bull of earth, the Bull of heaven, Bull of the rivers, Bull of standing waters.  For thee, the Strong, O Bull, hath Indu swollen. juice pleasant, sweet to drink, for thine election.

verses.sanskrit: अयं देवः सहसा जायमान इन्द्रेण युजा पणिमस्तभायत अयं सवस्य पितुरायुधानीन्दुरमुष्णादशिवस्य मायाः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ devaḥ sahasā jāyamāna indreṇa yujā paṇimastabhāyat ayaṃ svasya piturāyudhānīnduramuṣṇādaśivasya māyāḥ

translations.griffith: This God, with might, when first he had his being, with Indra for ally, held fast the Paṇi.  This Indu stole away the warlike weapons, and foiled the arts of his malignant father.

verses.sanskrit: अयमक्र्णोदुषसः सुपत्नीरयं सूर्ये अदधाज्ज्योतिरन्तः अयं तरिधातु दिवि रोचनेषु तरितेषु विन्ददम्र्तं निगूळ्हम |||
verses.transliteration: ayamakṛṇoduṣasaḥ supatnīrayaṃ sūrye adadhājjyotirantaḥ ayaṃ tridhātu divi rocaneṣu triteṣu vindadamṛtaṃ nighūḷham

translations.griffith: The Dawns he wedded to a glorious Consort, and set within the Sun the light that lights him.  He found in heaven, in the third lucid regions, the threefold Amṛta in its close concealment.

verses.sanskrit: अयं दयावाप्र्थिवी वि षकभायदयं रथमयुनक सप्तरश्मिम अयं गोषु शच्या पक्वमन्तः सोमो दाधार दशयन्त्रमुत्सम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī vi ṣkabhāyadayaṃ rathamayunak saptaraśmim ayaṃ ghoṣu śacyā pakvamantaḥ somo dādhāra daśayantramutsam

translations.griffith: He stayed and held the heaven and earth asunder: the chariot with the sevenfold reins he harnessed.  This Soma Set with power within the milch-kine a spring whose ripe contents ten fingers empty.

verses.sanskrit: य आनयत परावतः सुनीती तुर्वशं यदुम इन्द्रः सनो युवा सखा |||
verses.transliteration: ya ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turvaśaṃ yadum indraḥ sano yuvā sakhā

translations.griffith: THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led  Turvaśa, Yadu from afar.

verses.sanskrit: अविप्रे चिद वयो दधदनाशुना चिदर्वता इन्द्रो जेता हितं धनम |||
verses.transliteration: avipre cid vayo dadhadanāśunā cidarvatā indro jetā hitaṃ dhanam

translations.griffith: Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins  Even with slow steed the offered prize.

verses.sanskrit: महीरस्य परणीतयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः नास्य कषीयन्त ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: mahīrasya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ nāsya kṣīyanta ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Great are his ways of guiding us, andṅanilbld are Ins eulogies:  His kind protections never fail.

verses.sanskrit: सखायो बरह्मवाहसे.अर्चत पर च गायत स हि नः परमतिर्मही |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāyo brahmavāhase.arcata pra ca ghāyata sa hi naḥ pramatirmahī

translations.griffith: Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought:  For our great Providence is he.

verses.sanskrit: तवमेकस्य वर्त्रहन्नविता दवयोरसि उतेद्र्शे यथा वयम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamekasya vṛtrahannavitā dvayorasi utedṛśe yathā vayam

translations.griffith: Thou, Slaughterer of Vṛtra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two,  Yea, of a man like one of us.

verses.sanskrit: नयसीद वति दविषः कर्णोष्युक्थशंसिनः नर्भिः सुवीर उच्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: nayasīd vati dviṣaḥ kṛṇoṣyukthaśaṃsinaḥ nṛbhiḥ suvīra ucyase

translations.griffith: Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise:  Good hero art thou called by men.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्माणं बरह्मवाहसं गीर्भिः सखायं रग्मियम गांन दोहसे हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: brahmāṇaṃ brahmavāhasaṃ ghīrbhiḥ sakhāyaṃ ṛghmiyam ghāṃna dohase huve

translations.griffith: I call with hymns, as ’twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise,  The Brahman who accepts the prayer.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य विश्वानि हस्तयोरूचुर्वसूनि नि दविता वीरस्य पर्तनाषहः |||
verses.transliteration: yasya viśvāni hastayorūcurvasūni ni dvitā vīrasya pṛtanāṣahaḥ

translations.griffith: Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old,  The Hero, conquering in the fight.

verses.sanskrit: वि दर्ळ्हानि चिदद्रिवो जनानां शचीपते वर्ह माया अनानत |||
verses.transliteration: vi dṛḷhāni cidadrivo janānāṃ śacīpate vṛha māyā anānata

translations.griffith: Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men,  And foil their arts, unbending God!

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा सत्य सोमपा इन्द्र वाजानां पते अहूमहि शरवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā satya somapā indra vājānāṃ pate ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true,  We, fain for glory, have invoked.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा यः पुरासिथ यो वा नूनं हिते धने हव्यःस शरुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā yaḥ purāsitha yo vā nūnaṃ hite dhane havyaḥsa śrudhī havam

translations.griffith: Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize  lies ready, listen to our call.

verses.sanskrit: धीभिरर्वद्भिरर्वतो वाजानिन्द्र शरवाय्यान तवया जेष्म हितं धनम |||
verses.transliteration: dhībhirarvadbhirarvato vājānindra śravāyyān tvayā jeṣma hitaṃ dhanam

translations.griffith: With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil  Most glorious, and the proffered prize.

verses.sanskrit: अभूरु वीर गिर्वणो महानिन्द्र धने हिते भरे वितन्तसाय्यः |||
verses.transliteration: abhūru vīra ghirvaṇo mahānindra dhane hite bhare vitantasāyyaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been  Great in the contest for the prize.

verses.sanskrit: या त ऊतिरमित्रहन मक्षूजवस्तमासति तया नो हिनुही रथम |||
verses.transliteration: yā ta ūtiramitrahan makṣūjavastamāsati tayā no hinuhī ratham

translations.griffith: Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course,  With that impel our car to speed.

verses.sanskrit: स रथेन रथीतमो.अस्माकेनाभियुग्वना जेषि जिष्णो हितं धनम |||
verses.transliteration: sa rathena rathītamo.asmākenābhiyughvanā jeṣi jiṣṇo hitaṃ dhanam

translations.griffith: As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim,  O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.

verses.sanskrit: य एक इत तमु षटुहि कर्ष्टीनां विचर्षणिः पतिर्जज्ञे वर्षक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: ya eka it tamu ṣṭuhi kṛṣṭīnāṃ vicarṣaṇiḥ patirjajñe vṛṣakratuḥ

translations.griffith: Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men,  Most active, with heroic soul.

verses.sanskrit: यो गर्णतामिदासिथापिरूती शिवः सखा स तवंन इन्द्र मर्ळय |||
verses.transliteration: yo ghṛṇatāmidāsithāpirūtī śivaḥ sakhā sa tvaṃna indra mṛḷaya

translations.griffith: Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid,  As such, O Indra, favour us.

verses.sanskrit: धिष्व वज्रं गभस्त्यो रक्षोहत्याय वज्रिवः सासहीष्ठा अभि सप्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: dhiṣva vajraṃ ghabhastyo rakṣohatyāya vajrivaḥ sāsahīṣṭhā abhi spṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends:  Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.

verses.sanskrit: परत्नं रयीणां युजं सखायं कीरिचोदनम बरह्मवाहस्तमं हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: pratnaṃ rayīṇāṃ yujaṃ sakhāyaṃ kīricodanam brahmavāhastamaṃ huve

translations.griffith: I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man,  Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.

verses.sanskrit: स हि विश्वानि पार्थिवानेको वसूनि पत्यते गिर्वणस्तमो अध्रिगुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi viśvāni pārthivāneko vasūni patyate ghirvaṇastamo adhrighuḥ

translations.griffith: For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds  Hither, chief Lover of the Song.

verses.sanskrit: स नो नियुद्भिरा पर्ण कामं वाजेभिरश्विभिः गोमद्भिर्गोपते धर्षत |||
verses.transliteration: sa no niyudbhirā pṛṇa kāmaṃ vājebhiraśvibhiḥ ghomadbhirghopate dhṛṣat

translations.griffith: So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds  And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine!

verses.sanskrit: तद वो गाय सुते सचा पुरुहूताय सत्वने शं यद गवे |||
verses.transliteration: tad vo ghāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane śaṃ yad ghave

translations.griffith: Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked,  To please him as a mighty Steer.

verses.sanskrit: न शाकिने ||
verses.transliteration: na śākine

translations.griffith: He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine,  When he hath listened to our songs.

verses.sanskrit: न घा वसुर्नि यमते दानं वाजस्य गोमतः यत सीमुप शरवद गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: na ghā vasurni yamate dānaṃ vājasya ghomataḥ yat sīmupa śravad ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: May he with might unclose for us the cow's stall, whosesoe’er it be,  To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.

verses.sanskrit: कुवित्सस्य पर हि वरजं गोमन्तं दस्युहा गमत शचीभिरप नो वरत |||
verses.transliteration: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajaṃ ghomantaṃ dasyuhā ghamat śacībhirapa no varat

translations.griffith: O Indra Śatakratu, these our songs have called aloud to thee,  Like mother cows to meet their calves.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ तवा शतक्रतो.अभि पर णोनुवुर्गिरः इन्द्र वत्संन मातरः |||
verses.transliteration: imā u tvā śatakrato.abhi pra ṇonuvurghiraḥ indra vatsaṃna mātaraḥ

translations.griffith: Hard is thy love to win: thou art a Steer to him who longs for steers:  Be to one craving steeds a Steed.

verses.sanskrit: दूणाशं सख्यं तव गौरसि वीर गव्यते अश्वो अश्वायते भव |||
verses.transliteration: dūṇāśaṃ sakhyaṃ tava ghaurasi vīra ghavyate aśvo aśvāyate bhava

translations.griffith: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence:  Yield not thy singer to reproach.

verses.sanskrit: स मन्दस्वा हयन्धसो ... ||
verses.transliteration: sa mandasvā hyandhaso ...

translations.griffith: These songs with every draught we pour come, Lover of the Song, to thee,  As milch-kine hasten to their young

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ तवा सुते-सुते नक्षन्ते गिर्वणो गिरः वत्सं गावोन धेनवः |||
verses.transliteration: imā u tvā sute-sute nakṣante ghirvaṇo ghiraḥ vatsaṃ ghāvona dhenavaḥ

translations.griffith: To thee most oft invoked, amid the many singers' rivalry  Who beg with all their might for wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूतमं पुरूणां सतोतॄणां विवाचि वाजेभिर्वाजयताम |||
verses.transliteration: purūtamaṃ purūṇāṃ stotṝṇāṃ vivāci vājebhirvājayatām

translations.griffith: Nearest and most attractive may our laud, O Indra come to thee.  Urge thou us on to ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमिन्द्र भूतु ते सतोमो वाहिष्ठो अन्तमः अस्मान राये महे हिनु |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamindra bhūtu te stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ asmān rāye mahe hinu

translations.griffith: Brbu hath set himself above the Paṇis, o’er their highest head,  Like the wide bush on Gan!gā's bank.

verses.sanskrit: अधि बर्बुः पणीनां वर्षिष्ठे मूर्धन्नस्थात उरुः कक्षो न गाङगयः |||
verses.transliteration: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnāṃ varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhannasthāt uruḥ kakṣo na ghāṅghyaḥ

translations.griffith: He whose good bounty, thousandfold, swift as the rushing of the wind,  Suddenly offers as a gift.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य वायोरिव दरवद भद्रा रातिः सहस्रिणी सद्यो दानाय मंहते |||
verses.transliteration: yasya vāyoriva dravad bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī sadyo dānāya maṃhate

translations.griffith: So all our singers ever praise the pious Brbu's noble deed,  Chief, best to give his thousands, best to give a thousand liberal gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तत सु नो विश्वे अर्य आ सदा गर्णन्ति कारवः बर्बुं सहस्रदातमं सूरिं सहस्रसातमम |||
verses.transliteration: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā ghṛṇanti kāravaḥ bṛbuṃ sahasradātamaṃ sūriṃ sahasrasātamam

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: तवामिद धि हवामहे साता वाजस्य कारवः तवां वर्त्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं नरस्त्वां काष्ठास्वर्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmid dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ narastvāṃ kāṣṭhāsvarvataḥ

translations.griffith: THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee:  In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं नश्चित्र वज्रहस्त धर्ष्णुया मह सतवानो अद्रिवः गामश्वं रथ्यमिन्द्र सं किर सत्रा वाजं न जिग्युषे |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ naścitra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ ghāmaśvaṃ rathyamindra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jighyuṣe

translations.griffith: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone!  Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.

verses.sanskrit: यः सत्राहा विचर्षणिरिन्द्रं तं हूमहे वयम सहस्रमुष्क तुविन्र्म्ण सत्पते भवा समत्सु नो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇirindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam sahasramuṣka tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe

translations.griffith: We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe:  Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.

verses.sanskrit: बाधसे जनान वर्षभेव मन्युना घर्षौ मीळ्ह रचीषम अस्माकं बोध्यविता महाधने तनूष्वप्सु सूर्ये |||
verses.transliteration: bādhase janān vṛṣabheva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḷha ṛcīṣama asmākaṃ bodhyavitā mahādhane tanūṣvapsu sūrye

translations.griffith: Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray.  Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र जयेष्ठं न आ भरनोजिष्ठं पपुरि शरवः येनेमे चित्र वज्रहस्त रोदसी ओभे सुशिप्र पराः |||
verses.transliteration: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bharanojiṣṭhaṃ papuri śravaḥ yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent,  Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तवामुग्रमवसे चर्षणीसहं राजन देवेषु हूमहे विश्वा सु नो विथुरा पिब्दना वसो.अमित्रान सुषहान कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmughramavase carṣaṇīsahaṃ rājan deveṣu hūmahe viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso.amitrān suṣahān kṛdhi

translations.griffith: We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us.  All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र नाहुषीष्वानोजो नर्म्णं च कर्ष्टिषु यद वापञ्च कषितीनां दयुम्नमा भर सत्रा विश्वानि पौंस्या |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra nāhuṣīṣvānojo nṛmṇaṃ ca kṛṣṭiṣu yad vāpañca kṣitīnāṃ dyumnamā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā

translations.griffith: All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahusas, and all the splendid fame that the Five Tribes enjoy  Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा तर्क्षौ मघवन दरुह्यावा जने यत पूरौ कच्च वर्ष्ण्यम अस्मभ्यं तद रिरीहि सं नर्षाह्ये.अमित्रान पर्त्सुतुर्वणे |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāvā jane yat pūrau kacca vṛṣṇyam asmabhyaṃ tad rirīhi saṃ nṛṣāhye.amitrān pṛtsuturvaṇe

translations.griffith: Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Trksi lay, in Druhyus or in Paru's folk,  Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र तरिधातु शरणं तरिवरूथं सवस्तिमत छर्दिर्यछ मघवद्भ्यश्च मह्यं च यावया दिद्युमेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastimat chardiryacha maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyumebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong.  Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.

verses.sanskrit: ये गव्यता मनसा शत्रुमादभुरभिप्रघ्नन्ति धर्ष्णुया अध समा नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणस्तनूपा अन्तमो भव |||
verses.transliteration: ye ghavyatā manasā śatrumādabhurabhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā adha smā no maghavannindra ghirvaṇastanūpā antamo bhava

translations.griffith: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,—  From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.

verses.sanskrit: अध समा नो वर्धे भवेन्द्र नायमवा युधि यदन्तरिक्षेपतयन्ति पर्णिनो दिद्यवस्तिग्ममूर्धानः |||
verses.transliteration: adha smā no vṛdhe bhavendra nāyamavā yudhi yadantarikṣepatayanti parṇino didyavastighmamūrdhānaḥ

translations.griffith: And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight,  What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र शूरासस्तन्वो वितन्वते परिया शर्म पितॄणाम अध समा यछ तन्वे तने च छर्दिरचित्तं यावय दवेषः |||
verses.transliteration: yatra śūrāsastanvo vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām adha smā yacha tanve tane ca chardiracittaṃ yāvaya dveṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved.  To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र सर्गे अर्वतश्चोदयासे महाधने असमने अध्वनिव्र्जिने पथि शयेनानिव शरवस्यतह |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra sarghe arvataścodayāse mahādhane asamane adhvanivṛjine pathi śyenāniva śravasyatah

translations.griffith: When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed,  On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,

verses.sanskrit: सिन्धून्रिव परवण आशुया यतो यदि कलोशमनु षवणि आ ये वयो न वर्व्र्तत्यामिषि गर्भीता बाह्वोर्गवि |||
verses.transliteration: sindhūnriva pravaṇa āśuyā yato yadi klośamanu ṣvaṇi ā ye vayo na varvṛtatyāmiṣi ghṛbhītā bāhvorghavi

translations.griffith: Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call,  That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.

verses.sanskrit: सवादुष किलायं मधुमानुतायं तीव्रः किलायं रसवानुतायम उतो नवस्य पपिवांसमिन्द्रं न कश्चनसहत आहवेषु |||
verses.transliteration: svāduṣ kilāyaṃ madhumānutāyaṃ tīvraḥ kilāyaṃ rasavānutāyam uto nvasya papivāṃsamindraṃ na kaścanasahata āhaveṣu

translations.griffith: YEA, this is good to taste and full of. sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour.  No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सवादुरिह मदिष्ठ आस यस्येन्द्रो वर्त्रहत्ये ममाद पुरूणि यश्च्यौत्ना शम्बरस्य वि नवतिं नव च देह्यो हन |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ svāduriha madiṣṭha āsa yasyendro vṛtrahatye mamāda purūṇi yaścyautnā śambarasya vi navatiṃ nava ca dehyo han

translations.griffith: This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vṛtra,  When he defeated Śambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.

verses.sanskrit: अयं मे पीत उदियर्ति वचमयं मनीषामुशतीमजीगः अयं षळ उर्वीरमिमीत धीरो न याभ्यो भुवनं कच्चनारे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ me pīta udiyarti vacamayaṃ manīṣāmuśatīmajīghaḥ ayaṃ ṣaḷ urvīramimīta dhīro na yābhyo bhuvanaṃ kaccanāre

translations.griffith: This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit.  This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.

verses.sanskrit: अयं स यो वरिमाणं पर्थिव्या वर्ष्माणं दिवो अक्र्णोदयं सः अयं पीयूषं तिस्र्षु परवत्सु सोमो दाधारोर्वन्तरिक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sa yo varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyā varṣmāṇaṃ divo akṛṇodayaṃ saḥ ayaṃ pīyūṣaṃ tisṛṣu pravatsu somo dādhārorvantarikṣam

translations.griffith: This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven.  He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.

verses.sanskrit: अयं विदच्चित्रद्र्शीकमर्णः शुक्रसद्मनामुषसामनीके अयं महान महता सकम्भनेनोद दयामस्तभ्नाद वर्षभोमरुत्वान |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vidaccitradṛśīkamarṇaḥ śukrasadmanāmuṣasāmanīke ayaṃ mahān mahatā skambhanenod dyāmastabhnād vṛṣabhomarutvān

translations.griffith: He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness.  This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.

verses.sanskrit: धर्षत पिब कलशे सोममिन्द्र वर्त्रहा शूर समरे वसूनाम माध्यन्दिने सवन आ वर्षस्व रयिस्थानो रयिमस्मासु धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somamindra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām mādhyandine savana ā vṛṣasva rayisthāno rayimasmāsu dhehi

translations.griffith: Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vṛtra-slayer!  Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र पर णः पुरेतेव पश्य पर नो नय परतरं वस्यो अछ भवा सुपारो अतिपारयो नो भवा सुनीतिरुत वामनीतिः |||
verses.transliteration: indra pra ṇaḥ puraeteva paśya pra no naya prataraṃ vasyo acha bhavā supāro atipārayo no bhavā sunītiruta vāmanītiḥ

translations.griffith: Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure.  Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.

verses.sanskrit: उरुं नो लोकमनु नेषि विद्वान सवर्वज्ज्योतिरभयं सवस्ति रष्वा त इन्द्र सथविरस्य बाहू उप सथेयाम शरणा बर्हन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: uruṃ no lokamanu neṣi vidvān svarvajjyotirabhayaṃ svasti ṛṣvā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā

translations.griffith: Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight.  High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.

verses.sanskrit: वरिष्ठे न इन्द्र वन्धुरे धा वहिष्ठयोः शतावन्नश्वयोरा इषमा वक्षीषां वर्षिष्ठां मा नस्तारीन मघवन रायो अर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: variṣṭhe na indra vandhure dhā vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvannaśvayorā iṣamā vakṣīṣāṃ varṣiṣṭhāṃ mā nastārīn maghavan rāyo aryaḥ

translations.griffith: Set us on widest chariot-seat, O Indra, with two steeds best to draw, O Lord of Hundreds!  Bring us the best among all sorts of viands: let not the foe's wealth, Maghavan, subdue us.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र मर्ळ मह्यं जीवातुमिछ चोदय धियमयसो न धाराम यत किं चाहं तवायुरिदं वदामि तज्जुषस्व कर्धि मा देववन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: indra mṛḷa mahyaṃ jīvātumicha codaya dhiyamayaso na dhārām yat kiṃ cāhaṃ tvāyuridaṃ vadāmi tajjuṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam

translations.griffith: Be gracious, Indra, let my days be lengthened: sharpen my thought as ’twere a blade of iron  Approve whatever words I speak, dependent on thee, and grant me thy divine protection.

verses.sanskrit: तरातारमिन्द्रमवितारमिन्द्रं हवे-हवे सुहवं शूरमिन्द्रम हवयामि शक्रं पुरुहूतमिन्द्रं सवस्ति नो मघवाधात्विन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: trātāramindramavitāramindraṃ have-have suhavaṃ śūramindram hvayāmi śakraṃ puruhūtamindraṃ svasti no maghavādhātvindraḥ

translations.griffith: Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation,  Śakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan prosper and bless us.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा सववानवोभिः सुम्र्ळीको भवतु विश्ववेदाः बाधतां दवेषो अभयं कर्णोतु सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: May helpful Indra as our good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour,  Baffle our foes, and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.

verses.sanskrit: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम स सुत्रामा सववानिन्द्रो अस्मे आराच्चिद दवेषः सनुतर्युयोतु |||
verses.transliteration: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma sa sutrāmā svavānindro asme ārāccid dveṣaḥ sanutaryuyotu

translations.griffith: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour.  May helpful Indra as our good Preserver drive from us, even from afar, our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: अव तवे इन्द्र परवतो नोर्मिर्गिरो बरह्माणि नियुतो धवन्ते उरू न राधः सवना पुरूण्यपो गा वज्रिन युवसे समिन्दून |||
verses.transliteration: ava tve indra pravato normirghiro brahmāṇi niyuto dhavante urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇyapo ghā vajrin yuvase samindūn

translations.griffith: Like rivers rushing down a slope, O Indra, to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses.  Thou gatherest, Thunderer! like widespread bounty, kine, water, drops, and manifold libations.

verses.sanskrit: क ईं सतवत कः पर्णात को यजाते यदुग्रमिन मघवा विश्वहावेत पादाविव परहरन्नन्यम-अन्यं कर्णोति पूर्वमपरं शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ka īṃ stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt ko yajāte yadughramin maghavā viśvahāvet pādāviva praharannanyam-anyaṃ kṛṇoti pūrvamaparaṃ śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Who lauds him, satisfies him, pays him worship? E’en the rich noble still hath found him mighty.  With power, as when one moves his feet alternate, he makes the last precede, the foremost follow.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ण्वे वीर उग्रम-उग्रं दमायन्नन्यम अन्यमतिनेनीयमानः एधमानद्विळ उभयस्य राजा चोष्कूयते विश इन्द्रो मनुष्यान |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇve vīra ughram-ughraṃ damāyannanyam anyamatinenīyamānaḥ edhamānadviḷ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśa indro manuṣyān

translations.griffith: Famed is the Hero as each strong man's tamer, ever advancing one and then another.  King of both worlds, hating the high and haughty, Indra protects the men who are his people.

verses.sanskrit: परा पूर्वेषां सख्या वर्णक्ति वितर्तुराणो अपरेभिरेति अनानुभूतीरवधून्वानः पूर्वीरिन्द्रः शरदस्तर्तरीति |||
verses.transliteration: parā pūrveṣāṃ sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇo aparebhireti anānubhūtīravadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīrindraḥ śaradastartarīti

translations.griffith: He loves no more the men he loved aforetime: he turns and moves away allied with others.  Rejecting those who disregard his worship, Indra victorious lives through many autumns.

verses.sanskrit: रूपं-रूपं परतिरूपो बभूव तदस्य रूपं परतिचक्षणाय इन्द्रो मायाभिः पुरुरूप ईयते युक्ता हयस्य हरयःशता दश |||
verses.transliteration: rūpaṃ-rūpaṃ pratirūpo babhūva tadasya rūpaṃ praticakṣaṇāya indro māyābhiḥ pururūpa īyate yuktā hyasya harayaḥśatā daśa

translations.griffith: In every figure he hath been the mode: this is his only form for us to look on.  Indra moves multiform by his illusions; for his Bay Steeds are yoked, ten times a hundred.

verses.sanskrit: युजानो हरिता रथे भूरि तवष्टेह राजति को विश्वाहा दविषतः पक्ष आसत उतासीनेषु सूरिषु |||
verses.transliteration: yujāno haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭeha rājati ko viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣa āsata utāsīneṣu sūriṣu

translations.griffith: Here Tvaṣṭar, yoking to the car the Bay Steeds, hath extended sway.  Who will for ever stand upon the foeman's side, even when our princes sit at ease?

verses.sanskrit: अगव्यूति कषेत्रमागम्न देवा उर्वी सती भूमिरंहूरणाभूत बर्हस्पते पर चिकित्सा गविष्टावित्था सते जरित्रैन्द्र पन्थाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghavyūti kṣetramāghamna devā urvī satī bhūmiraṃhūraṇābhūt bṛhaspate pra cikitsā ghaviṣṭāvitthā sate jaritraindra panthām

translations.griffith: Gods, we have reached a country void of pasture the land, though spacious, was too small to hold us.  Bṛhaspati, provide in war for cattle; find a path, Indra, for this faithful singer.

verses.sanskrit: दिवे-दिवे सद्र्शीरन्यमर्धं कर्ष्णा असेधतप सद्मनोजाः अहन दासा वर्षभो वस्नयन्तोदव्रजे वर्चिनं शम्बरं च |||
verses.transliteration: dive-dive sadṛśīranyamardhaṃ kṛṣṇā asedhatapa sadmanojāḥ ahan dāsā vṛṣabho vasnayantodavraje varcinaṃ śambaraṃ ca

translations.griffith: Day after day far from their seat he drove them, alike, from place to place, those darksome creatures.  The Hero slew the meanly-huckstering Dāsas, Varcin and Śambara, where the waters gather.

verses.sanskrit: परस्तोक इन नु राधसस्त इन्द्र दश कोशयीर्दश वाजिनो.अदात दिवोदासादतिथिग्वस्य राधः शाम्बरं वसु परत्यग्रभीष्म |||
verses.transliteration: prastoka in nu rādhasasta indra daśa kośayīrdaśa vājino.adāt divodāsādatithighvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaraṃ vasu pratyaghrabhīṣma

translations.griffith: Out of thy bounty, Indra, hath Prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses.  We have received in turn from Divodāsa Śambara's wealth, the gift of Atithigva.

verses.sanskrit: दशाश्वान दश कोशान दश वस्त्राधिभोजना दशो हिरण्यपिण्डान दिवोदासादसानिषम |||
verses.transliteration: daśāśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrādhibhojanā daśo hiraṇyapiṇḍān divodāsādasāniṣam

translations.griffith: Ten horses and ten treasure-chests, ten garments as an added gift,  These and ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodāsa's hand.

verses.sanskrit: दश रथान परष्टिमतः शतं गा अथर्वभ्यः अश्वथः पायवे.अदात |||
verses.transliteration: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śataṃ ghā atharvabhyaḥ aśvathaḥ pāyave.adāt

translations.griffith: Ten cars with extra steed to each, for the Atharvans hundred cows,  Hath Asvatha to Payu given.

verses.sanskrit: महि राधो विश्वजन्यं दधानान भरद्वाजान सार्ञ्जयो अभ्ययष्ट ||
verses.transliteration: mahi rādho viśvajanyaṃ dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayo abhyayaṣṭa

translations.griffith: Thus Sṛñjaya's son honoured the Bharadvājas, recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पते वीड्वङगो हि भूया अस्मत्सखा परतरणः सुवीरः गोभिः संनद्धो असि वीळयस्वास्थाता ते जयतु जेत्वानि |||
verses.transliteration: vanaspate vīḍvaṅgho hi bhūyā asmatsakhā prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ ghobhiḥ saṃnaddho asi vīḷayasvāsthātā te jayatu jetvāni

translations.griffith: Lord of the wood, be firm and strong in body: be, bearing us, a brave victorious hero  Show forth thy strength, compact with straps of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.

verses.sanskrit: दिवस पर्थिव्याः पर्योज उद्भ्र्तं वनस्पतिभ्यः पर्याभ्र्तं सहः अपामोज्मानं परि गोभिराव्र्तमिन्द्रस्य वज्रं हविषा रथं यज |||
verses.transliteration: divas pṛthivyāḥ paryoja udbhṛtaṃ vanaspatibhyaḥ paryābhṛtaṃ sahaḥ apāmojmānaṃ pari ghobhirāvṛtamindrasya vajraṃ haviṣā rathaṃ yaja

translations.griffith: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood.  Honour with holy gifts the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car bound round with straps, the vigour of the floods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य वज्रो मरुतामनीकं मित्रस्य गर्भो वरुणस्य नाभिः सेमां नो हव्यदातिं जुषाणो देव रथ परति हव्या गर्भाय |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya vajro marutāmanīkaṃ mitrasya gharbho varuṇasya nābhiḥ semāṃ no havyadātiṃ juṣāṇo deva ratha prati havyā ghṛbhāya

translations.griffith: Thou Bolt of Indra, Vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuṇa and Child of Mitra,—  As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O Godlike Chariot, these oblations.

verses.sanskrit: उप शवासय पर्थिवीमुत दयां पुरुत्रा ते मनुतां विष्ठितं जगत स दुन्दुभे सजूरिन्द्रेण देवैर्दूराद दवीयोप सेध शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīmuta dyāṃ purutrā te manutāṃ viṣṭhitaṃ jaghat sa dundubhe sajūrindreṇa devairdūrād davīyoapa sedha śatrūn

translations.griffith: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee;  O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: आ करन्दय बलमोजो न आ धा नि षटनिहि दुरिता बाधमानः अप परोथ दुन्दुभे दुछुना इत इन्द्रस्य मुष्टिरसि वीळयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: ā krandaya balamojo na ā dhā ni ṣṭanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ apa protha dundubhe duchunā ita indrasya muṣṭirasi vīḷayasva

translations.griffith: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour: yea, thunder forth and drive away all dangers.  Drive hence, O War-drum, drive away misfortune: thou art the Fist of Indra: show thy firmness.

verses.sanskrit: आमूरज परत्यावर्तयेमाः केतुमद दुन्दुभिर्वावदीति समश्वपर्णाश्चरन्ति नो नरो.अस्माकमिन्द्र रथिनो जयन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: āmūraja pratyāvartayemāḥ ketumad dundubhirvāvadīti samaśvaparṇāścaranti no naro.asmākamindra rathino jayantu

translations.griffith: Drive hither those, and these again bring hither: the War-drum speaks aloud as battle's signal.  Our heroes, winged with horses, come together. Let our car-warriors, Indra, be triumphant.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञा-यज्ञा वो अग्नये गिरा-गिरा च दक्षसे पर-पर वयमम्र्तं जातवेदसं परियं मित्रं न शंसिषम |||
verses.transliteration: yajñā-yajñā vo aghnaye ghirā-ghirā ca dakṣase pra-pra vayamamṛtaṃ jātavedasaṃ priyaṃ mitraṃ na śaṃsiṣam

translations.griffith: SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength.  Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जो नपातं स हिनायमस्मयुर्दाशेम हव्यदातये भुवद वाजेष्वविता भुवद वर्ध उत तराता तनूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjo napātaṃ sa hināyamasmayurdāśema havyadātaye bhuvad vājeṣvavitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām

translations.griffith: The Son of Strength; for is he not our gracious Lord? Let us serve him who bears our gifts.  In battle may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा हयग्ने अजरो महान विभास्यर्चिषा अजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचच्छुचे सुदीतिभिः सु दीदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā hyaghne ajaro mahān vibhāsyarciṣā ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucacchuce sudītibhiḥ su dīdihi

translations.griffith: Agni, thou beamest forth with light, great Hero, never changed by time.  Shining, pure Agni! with a light that never fades, beam with thy fair beams brilliantly.

verses.sanskrit: महो देवान यजसि यक्ष्यानुषक तव करत्वोत दंसना अर्वाचः सीं कर्णुह्यग्ने.अवसे रास्व वाजोत वंस्व |||
verses.transliteration: maho devān yajasi yakṣyānuṣak tava kratvota daṃsanā arvācaḥ sīṃ kṛṇuhyaghne.avase rāsva vājota vaṃsva

translations.griffith: Thou worshippest great Gods: bring them without delay by wisdom and thy wondrous power.  O Agni, make them turn hither to succour us. Give strength, and win it for thyself.

verses.sanskrit: यमापो अद्रयो वना गर्भं रतस्य पिप्रति सहसा यो मथितो जायते नर्भिः पर्थिव्या अधि सानवि |||
verses.transliteration: yamāpo adrayo vanā gharbhaṃ ṛtasya piprati sahasā yo mathito jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyā adhi sānavi

translations.griffith: He whom floods, stones, and trees support, the offspring of eternal Law;  He who when rubbed with force is brought to life by men upon the lofty height of earth;

verses.sanskrit: आ यः पप्रौ भानुना रोदसी उभे धूमेन धावते दिवि तिरस्तमो दद्र्श ऊर्म्यास्वा शयावास्वरुषो वर्षा शयावा अरुषो वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi tirastamo dadṛśa ūrmyāsvā śyāvāsvaruṣo vṛṣā śyāvā aruṣo vṛṣā

translations.griffith: He who hath filled both worlds fult with his brilliant shine, who hastens with his smoke to heaven;  He made himself apparent through the gloom by night, the Red Bull in the darksome nights, the Red Bull in the darksome nights.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हद्भिरग्ने अर्चिभिः शुक्रेण देव शोचिषा भरद्वाजे समिधानो यविष्ठ्य रेवन नः शुक्र दीदिहि दयुमत पावक दीदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhadbhiraghne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā bharadvāje samidhāno yaviṣṭhya revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi

translations.griffith: O Agni, with thy lofty beams, with thy pure brilliancy, O God,  Kindled, Most Youthful One! by Bharadvāja's hand, shine on us, O pure God, with wealth, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वासां गर्हपतिर्विशामसि तवमग्ने मानुषीणाम शतं पूर्भिर्यविष्ठ पाह्यंहसः समेद्धारं शतं हिमा सतोत्र्भ्यो ये च ददति |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāsāṃ ghṛhapatirviśāmasi tvamaghne mānuṣīṇām śataṃ pūrbhiryaviṣṭha pāhyaṃhasaḥ sameddhāraṃ śataṃ himā stotṛbhyo ye ca dadati

translations.griffith: Thou art the Lord of house and home of all the tribes, O Agni, of all tribes of men.  Guard with a hundred forts thy kindler from distress, through hundred winters, Youngest God! and those who make thy singers rich.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नश्चित्र ऊत्या वसो राधांसि चोदय अस्य रायस्त्वमग्ने रथीरसि विदा गाधं तुचे तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naścitra ūtyā vaso rādhāṃsi codaya asya rāyastvamaghne rathīrasi vidā ghādhaṃ tuce tu naḥ

translations.griffith: Wonderful, with thy favouring help, send us thy bounties, gracious Lord.  Thou art the Charioteer, Agni, of earthly wealth: find rest and safety for our seed.

verses.sanskrit: पर्षि तोकं तनयं पर्त्र्भिष टवमदब्धैरप्रयुत्वभिः अग्ने हेळांसि दैव्या युयोधि नो.अदेवानि हवरांसि च |||
verses.transliteration: parṣi tokaṃ tanayaṃ partṛbhiṣ ṭvamadabdhairaprayutvabhiḥ aghne heḷāṃsi daivyā yuyodhi no.adevāni hvarāṃsi ca

translations.griffith: With guards unfailing never negligent speed thou our children and our progeny.  Keep far from us, O Agni, all celestial wrath and wickedness of godless men.

verses.sanskrit: आ सखायः सबर्दुघां धेनुमजध्वमुप नव्यसा वचः सर्जध्वमनपस्फुराम |||
verses.transliteration: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughāṃ dhenumajadhvamupa navyasā vacaḥ sṛjadhvamanapasphurām

translations.griffith: Hither, O friends, with newest song drive her who freely pours her milk;  Loose her who never turns away;

verses.sanskrit: या शर्धाय मारुताय सवभानवे शरवो.अम्र्त्यु धुक्षत या मर्ळीके मरुतां तुराणां या सुम्नैरेवयावरी |||
verses.transliteration: yā śardhāya mārutāya svabhānave śravo.amṛtyu dhukṣata yā mṛḷīke marutāṃ turāṇāṃ yā sumnairevayāvarī

translations.griffith: Who, for the host of Maruts bright with native sheen, hath shed immortal fame like milk;  Whom the impetuous Maruts look upon with love, who moves in splendour on their ways.

verses.sanskrit: भरद्वाजायाव धुक्षत दविता धेनुं च विश्वदोहसमिषं च विश्वभोजसम |||
verses.transliteration: bharadvājāyāva dhukṣata dvitā dhenuṃ ca viśvadohasamiṣaṃ ca viśvabhojasam

translations.griffith: For Bharadvāja she poured down in days of old  The milch-cow yielding milk for all, and food that gives all nourishment.

verses.sanskrit: तं व इन्द्रं न सुक्रतुं वरुणमिव मायिनम अर्यमणं न मन्द्रं सर्प्रभोजसं विष्णुं न सतुष आदिशे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ va indraṃ na sukratuṃ varuṇamiva māyinam aryamaṇaṃ na mandraṃ sṛprabhojasaṃ viṣṇuṃ na stuṣa ādiśe

translations.griffith: Your friend like Indra passing wise, with magic power like Varuṇa.  Like Aryaman joy-giving, bringing plenteous food like ViSnxu for my wish, I praise,

verses.sanskrit: तवेषं शर्धो न मारुतं तुविष्वण्यनर्वाणं पूषणं सं यथा शता सं सहस्रा कारिषच्चर्षणिभ्य आनाविर्गूळ्हा वसू करत सुवेदा नो वसू करत |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣaṃ śardho na mārutaṃ tuviṣvaṇyanarvāṇaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ saṃ yathā śatā saṃ sahasrā kāriṣaccarṣaṇibhya ānāvirghūḷhā vasū karat suvedā no vasū karat

translations.griffith: Bright as the host of Maruts mighty in their roar. May they bring Pūṣan free from foes;  May they bring hither hundreds, thousands for our men: may they bring hidden stores to light, and make wealth easy to be found.

verses.sanskrit: आ मा पूषन्नुप दरव शंसिषं नु ते अपिकर्ण आघ्र्णे अघा अर्यो अरातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā mā pūṣannupa drava śaṃsiṣaṃ nu te apikarṇa āghṛṇe aghā aryo arātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Haste to me, Pūṣan, in thine car, bright Deity: I fain would speak:  Most sinful is our foeman's hate.

verses.sanskrit: मा काकम्बीरमुद वर्हो वनस्पतिमशस्तीर्वि हि नीनशः मोत सूरो अह एवा चन गरीवा आदधते वेः |||
verses.transliteration: mā kākambīramud vṛho vanaspatimaśastīrvi hi nīnaśaḥ mota sūro aha evā cana ghrīvā ādadhate veḥ

translations.griffith: Tear not up by the roots the Kakambira tree: destroy thou all malignity.  Let them not snare by day the neck of that Celestial Bird the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: दर्तेरिव ते.अव्र्कमस्तु सख्यम अछिद्रस्य दधन्वतः सुपूर्णस्य दधन्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: dṛteriva te.avṛkamastu sakhyam achidrasya dadhanvataḥ supūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ

translations.griffith: Uninjured let thy friendship be, like the smooth surface of a skin,  A flawless skin, containing curds, full to the mouth, containing curds.

verses.sanskrit: परो हि मर्त्यैरसि समो देवैरुत शरिया अभि खयः पूषन पर्तनासु नस्त्वमवा नूनं यथा पुरा |||
verses.transliteration: paro hi martyairasi samo devairuta śriyā abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu nastvamavā nūnaṃ yathā purā

translations.griffith: For thou art high above mankind, in glory equal to the Gods.  Therefore, O Pūṣan, look upon us in the fight: now help us as in days of old.

verses.sanskrit: वामी वामस्य धूतयः परणीतिरस्तु सून्र्ता देवस्य वामरुतो मर्त्यस्य वेजानस्य परयज्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītirastu sūnṛtā devasya vāmaruto martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ

translations.griffith: May the kind excellence of him the Kind, loud Roarers! be our guide,  Be it the God's, O Maruts, or a mortal man's who worships, ye impetuous Ones!

verses.sanskrit: सद्यश्चिद यस्य चर्क्र्तिः परि दयां देवो नैति सूर्यः तवेषं शवो दधिरे नाम यज्ञियं मरुतो वर्त्रहं शवो जयेष्ठं वर्त्रहं शवः |||
verses.transliteration: sadyaścid yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyāṃ devo naiti sūryaḥ tveṣaṃ śavo dadhire nāma yajñiyaṃ maruto vṛtrahaṃ śavo jyeṣṭhaṃ vṛtrahaṃ śavaḥ

translations.griffith: They whose high glory in a moment like the God, the Sun, goes round the space of heaven,  The Maruts have obtained bright strength, a sacred name, strength that destroys the Vṛtras, strength Vṛtra-destroying excellent.

verses.sanskrit: सक्र्द ध दयौरजायत सक्र्द भूमिरजायत पर्श्न्या दुग्धं सक्र्त पयस्तदन्यो नानु जायते |||
verses.transliteration: sakṛd dha dyaurajāyata sakṛd bhūmirajāyata pṛśnyā dughdhaṃ sakṛt payastadanyo nānu jāyate

translations.griffith: Once, only once, the heaven was made, once only once, the earth was formed-  Once, only Pṛśni's milk was shed: no second, after this, is born.

verses.sanskrit: सतुषे जनं सुव्रतं नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणा सुम्नयन्ता त आ गमन्तु त इह शरुवन्तु सुक्षत्रासो वरुणोमित्रो अग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: stuṣe janaṃ suvrataṃ navyasībhirghīrbhirmitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā ta ā ghamantu ta iha śruvantu sukṣatrāso varuṇomitro aghniḥ

translations.griffith: I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuṇa who make us happy.  Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuṇa, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.

verses.sanskrit: विशो-विश ईड्यमध्वरेष्वद्र्प्तक्रतुमरतिं युवत्योः दिवः शिशुं सहसः सूनुमग्निं यज्ञस्य केतुमरुषं यजध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: viśo-viśa īḍyamadhvareṣvadṛptakratumaratiṃ yuvatyoḥ divaḥ śiśuṃ sahasaḥ sūnumaghniṃ yajñasya ketumaruṣaṃ yajadhyai

translations.griffith: Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald,  The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.

verses.sanskrit: अरुषस्य दुहितरा विरूपे सत्र्भिरन्या पिपिशे सूरो अन्या मिथस्तुरा विचरन्ती पावके मन्म शरुतं नक्षत रच्यमाने |||
verses.transliteration: aruṣasya duhitarā virūpe stṛbhiranyā pipiśe sūro anyā mithasturā vicarantī pāvake manma śrutaṃ nakṣata ṛcyamāne

translations.griffith: Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other.  Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.

verses.sanskrit: पर वायुमछा बर्हती मनीषा बर्हद्रयिं विश्ववारं रथप्राम दयुतद्यामा नियुतः पत्यमानः कविः कविमियक्षसि परयज्यो |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāyumachā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṃ viśvavāraṃ rathaprām dyutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavimiyakṣasi prayajyo

translations.griffith: I with a lofty song call hither Vāyu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy.  Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.

verses.sanskrit: स मे वपुश्छदयदश्विनोर्यो रथो विरुक्मान मनसा युजानः येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयाय तमने च |||
verses.transliteration: sa me vapuśchadayadaśvinoryo ratho virukmān manasā yujānaḥ yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartiryāthastanayāya tmane ca

translations.griffith: That chariot of the Aśvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent,  Wherewith, Nāsatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.

verses.sanskrit: पर्जन्यवाता वर्षभा पर्थिव्याः पुरीषाणि जिन्वतमप्यानि सत्यश्रुतः कवयो यस्य गीर्भिर्जगत सथातर्जगदाक्र्णुध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: parjanyavātā vṛṣabhā pṛthivyāḥ purīṣāṇi jinvatamapyāni satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yasya ghīrbhirjaghata sthātarjaghadākṛṇudhvam

translations.griffith: Bulls of the Earth, O Vāta and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water.  Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.

verses.sanskrit: पावीरवी कन्या चित्रायुः सरस्वती वीरपत्नी धियं धात गनाभिरछिद्रं शरणं सजोषा दुराधर्षं गर्णते शर्म यंसत |||
verses.transliteration: pāvīravī kanyā citrāyuḥ sarasvatī vīrapatnī dhiyaṃ dhāt ghnābhirachidraṃ śaraṇaṃ sajoṣā durādharṣaṃ ghṛṇate śarma yaṃsat

translations.griffith: So may Sarasvatī, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us,  And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.

verses.sanskrit: पथस-पथः परिपतिं वचस्या कामेन कर्तो अभ्यानळ अर्कम स नो रासच्छुरुधश्चन्द्राग्रा धियं-धियं सीषधाति पर पूषा |||
verses.transliteration: pathas-pathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhyānaḷ arkam sa no rāsacchurudhaścandrāghrā dhiyaṃ-dhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā

translations.griffith: I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka.  May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pūṣan make each prayer of ours efective.

verses.sanskrit: परथमभाजं यशसं वयोधां सुपाणिं देवं सुगभस्तिं रभ्वम होता यक्षद यजतं पस्त्यानामग्निस्त्वष्टारं सुहवं विभावा |||
verses.transliteration: prathamabhājaṃ yaśasaṃ vayodhāṃ supāṇiṃ devaṃ sughabhastiṃ ṛbhvam hotā yakṣad yajataṃ pastyānāmaghnistvaṣṭāraṃ suhavaṃ vibhāvā

translations.griffith: May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvaṣṭar adored, in homes and swift to listen,  Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.

verses.sanskrit: भुवनस्य पितरं गीर्भिराभी रुद्रं दिवा वर्धया रुद्रमक्तौ बर्हन्तं रष्वमजरं सुषुम्नं रधग घुवेम कविनेषितासः |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvanasya pitaraṃ ghīrbhirābhī rudraṃ divā vardhayā rudramaktau bṛhantaṃ ṛṣvamajaraṃ suṣumnaṃ ṛdhagh ghuvema kavineṣitāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father.  Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.

verses.sanskrit: आ युवानः कवयो यज्ञियासो मरुतो गन्त गर्णतो वरस्याम अचित्रं चिद धि जिन्वथा वर्धन्त इत्था नक्षन्तो नरो अङगिरस्वत |||
verses.transliteration: ā yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso maruto ghanta ghṛṇato varasyām acitraṃ cid dhi jinvathā vṛdhanta itthā nakṣanto naro aṅghirasvat

translations.griffith: Ye who are youthful, wise, and meet for worship, come, Martits, to the longing of the singer.  Coming, as erst to Aṅgiras, O Heroes, ye animate and quicken e’en the desert.

verses.sanskrit: पर वीराय पर तवसे तुरायाजा यूथेव पशुरक्षिरस्तम स पिस्प्र्शति तन्वि शरुतस्य सत्र्भिर्न नाकं वचनस्यविपः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāyājā yūtheva paśurakṣirastam sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhirna nākaṃ vacanasyavipaḥ

translations.griffith: Even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle, I urge my songs to him the strong swift Hero  May he, the glorious, lay upon his body the singer's hymns, as stars bedeck the heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यो रजांसि विममे पार्थिवानि तरिश्चिद विष्णुर्मनवे बाधिताय तस्य ते शर्मन्नुपदद्यमाने राया मदेम तन्वा तना च |||
verses.transliteration: yo rajāṃsi vimame pārthivāni triścid viṣṇurmanave bādhitāya tasya te śarmannupadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca

translations.griffith: He who for man's behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions, Viṣṇu-  When one so great as thou affordeth shelter, may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यो अब्धिरर्कैस्तत पर्वतस्तत सविता चनो धात तदोषधीभिरभि रातिषाचो भगः पुरन्धिर्जिन्वतु पर राये |||
verses.transliteration: tan no.ahirbudhnyo abdhirarkaistat parvatastat savitā cano dhāt tadoṣadhībhirabhi rātiṣāco bhaghaḥ purandhirjinvatu pra rāye

translations.griffith: Sweet be this song of mine to Ahibudhnya, Parvata, Savitar, with Floods and Lightnings;  Sweet, with the Plants, to Gods who seek oblations. May liberal Bhaga speed us on to riches.

verses.sanskrit: नु नो रयिं रथ्यं चर्षणिप्रां पुरुवीरं मह रतस्य गोपाम कषयं दाताजरं येन जनान सप्र्धो अदेवीरभि चक्रमाम विश आदेवीरभ्यश्नवाम |||
verses.transliteration: nu no rayiṃ rathyaṃ carṣaṇiprāṃ puruvīraṃ maha ṛtasya ghopām kṣayaṃ dātājaraṃ yena janān spṛdho adevīrabhi cakramāma viśa ādevīrabhyaśnavāma

translations.griffith: Give riches borne on cars, with many heroes, contenting men, the guard of mighty Order.  Give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us, and meet with tribes to whom the Gods are gracious.

verses.sanskrit: हुवे वो देवीमदितिं नमोभिर्म्र्ळीकाय वरुणं मित्रमग्निम अभिक्षदामर्यमणं सुशेवं तरातॄन देवान सवितारं भगं च |||
verses.transliteration: huve vo devīmaditiṃ namobhirmṛḷīkāya varuṇaṃ mitramaghnim abhikṣadāmaryamaṇaṃ suśevaṃ trātṝn devān savitāraṃ bhaghaṃ ca

translations.griffith: I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa for favour,  On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit: सुज्योतिषः सूर्य दक्षपितॄननागास्त्वे सुमहो वीहि देवान दविजन्मानो य रतसापः सत्याः सवर्वन्तो यजता अग्निजिह्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: sujyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣapitṝnanāghāstve sumaho vīhi devān dvijanmāno ya ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvanto yajatā aghnijihvāḥ

translations.griffith: Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Sūrya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Dakṣa,  Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.

verses.sanskrit: उत दयावाप्र्थिवी कषत्रमुरु बर्हद रोदसी शरणं सुषुम्ने महस करथो वरिवो यथा नो.अस्मे कषयाय धिषणे अनेहः |||
verses.transliteration: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatramuru bṛhad rodasī śaraṇaṃ suṣumne mahas karatho varivo yathā no.asme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ

translations.griffith: And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter,  Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो रुद्रस्य सूनवो नमन्तामद्या हूतासो वसवो.अध्र्ष्टाः यदीमर्भे महति वा हितासो बाधे मरुतो अह्वाम देवान |||
verses.transliteration: ā no rudrasya sūnavo namantāmadyā hūtāso vasavo.adhṛṣṭāḥ yadīmarbhe mahati vā hitāso bādhe maruto ahvāma devān

translations.griffith: This day invited may the Sons of Rudra, resistless, excellent, stoop down to meet us;  For, when beset with slight or sore affliction, we ever call upon the Gods, the Maruts;

verses.sanskrit: मिम्यक्ष येषु रोदसी नु देवी सिषक्ति पूषा अभ्यर्धयज्वा शरुत्वा हवं मरुतो यद ध याथ भूमा रेजन्ते अध्वनि परविक्ते |||
verses.transliteration: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardhayajvā śrutvā havaṃ maruto yad dha yātha bhūmā rejante adhvani pravikte

translations.griffith: To whom the Goddess Rodasī clings closely, whom Pūṣan follows bringing ample bounty.  What time ye hear our call and come, O Maruts, upon your separate path all creatures tremble.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तयं वीरं गिर्वणसमर्चेन्द्रं बरह्मणा जरितर्नवेन शरवदिद धवमुप च सतवानो रासद वाजानुप महो गर्णानः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tyaṃ vīraṃ ghirvaṇasamarcendraṃ brahmaṇā jaritarnavena śravadid dhavamupa ca stavāno rāsad vājānupa maho ghṛṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: With a new hymn extol, O thou who singest, the Lover of the Song, the Hero Indra.  May he, exalted, hear our invocation, and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.

verses.sanskrit: ओमानमापो मानुषीरम्र्क्तं धात तोकाय तनयाय शंयोः यूयं हि षठा भिषजो मात्र्तमा विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतो जनित्रीः |||
verses.transliteration: omānamāpo mānuṣīramṛktaṃ dhāta tokāya tanayāya śaṃyoḥ yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā bhiṣajo mātṛtamā viśvasya sthāturjaghato janitrīḥ

translations.griffith: Give full protection, Friends of man, ye Waters, in peace and trouble, to our sons and grandsons.  For ye are our most motherly physicians, parents of all that standeth, all that moveth.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो देवः सविता तरायमाणो हिरण्यपाणिर्यजतो जगम्यात यो दत्रवानुषसो न परतीकं वयूर्णुते दाशुषे वार्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: ā no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇo hiraṇyapāṇiryajato jaghamyāt yo datravānuṣaso na pratīkaṃ vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi

translations.griffith: May Savitar come hither and approach us, the God who rescues, Holy, goldenhanded,  The God who, bounteous as the face of Morning, discloses precious gifts for him who worships.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवं सूनो सहसो नो अद्या देवानस्मिन्नध्वरे वव्र्त्याः सयामहं ते सदमिद रातौ तव सयामग्ने.अवसा सुवीरः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adyā devānasminnadhvare vavṛtyāḥ syāmahaṃ te sadamid rātau tava syāmaghne.avasā suvīraḥ

translations.griffith: And thou, O Son of Strength, do thou turn hither the Gods to-day to this our holy service.  May I for evermore enjoy thy bounty and, Agni, by thy grace be rich in heroes.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया मे हवमा जग्म्यातं नासत्या धीभिर्युवमङग विप्रा अत्रिं न महस्तमसो.अमुमुक्तं तूर्वतं नरा दुरितादभीके |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā me havamā jaghmyātaṃ nāsatyā dhībhiryuvamaṅgha viprā atriṃ na mahastamaso.amumuktaṃ tūrvataṃ narā duritādabhīke

translations.griffith: Come also to my call, O ye Nāsatyas, yea, verily, through my prayers, ye Holy Sages.  As from great darkness ye delivered Atri, protect us, Chiefs, from danger in the conflict.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो रायो दयुमतो वाजवतो दातारो भूत नर्वतः पुरुक्षोः दशस्यन्तो दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता अप्या मर्लता चदेवाः |||
verses.transliteration: te no rāyo dyumato vājavato dātāro bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ daśasyanto divyāḥ pārthivāso ghojātā apyā mṛlatā cadevāḥ

translations.griffith: O Gods, bestow upon us riches, splendid with strength and heroes, bringing food in plenty.  Be gracious, helpful Gods of earth, of heaven, born of the Cow, and dwellers in the waters.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो रुद्रः सरस्वती सजोषा मीळ्हुष्मन्तो विष्णुर्म्र्ळन्तु वायुः रभुक्षा वाजो दैव्यो विधाता पर्जन्यावाता पिप्यतामिषं नः |||
verses.transliteration: te no rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣā mīḷhuṣmanto viṣṇurmṛḷantu vāyuḥ ṛbhukṣā vājo daivyo vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyatāmiṣaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: May Rudra and Sarasvatī, accordant, Viṣṇu and Vāyu, pour down gifts and bless us;  Ṛbhukṣan, Vāja, and divine Vidhatar, Parjanya, Vāta make our food abundant.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय देवः सविता भगो नो.अपां नपादवतु दानु पप्रिः तवष्टा देवेभिर्जनिभिः सजोषा दयौर्देवेभिः पर्थिवी समुद्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhagho no.apāṃ napādavatu dānu papriḥ tvaṣṭā devebhirjanibhiḥ sajoṣā dyaurdevebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ

translations.griffith: May this God Savitar, the Lord, the Offspring of Waters, pouring down his dew be gracious,  And, with the Gods and Dames accordant, Tvaṣṭar; Dyaus with the Gods and Prthivi with oceans.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यः शर्णोत्वज एकपात पर्थिवी समुद्रः विश्वे देवा रताव्र्धो हुवाना सतुता मन्त्राः कविशस्ता अवन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: uta no.ahirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇotvaja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānā stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu

translations.griffith: May Aja-Ekapād and Ahibudhnya, and Earth and Ocean hear our invocation;  All Gods who strengthen Law, invoked and lauded, and holy texts uttered by sages, help us.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नपातो मम तस्य धीभिर्भरद्वाजा अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः गना हुतासो वसवो.अध्र्ष्टा विश्वे सतुतासो भूता यजत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: evā napāto mama tasya dhībhirbharadvājā abhyarcantyarkaiḥ ghnā hutāso vasavo.adhṛṣṭā viśve stutāso bhūtā yajatrāḥ

translations.griffith: So with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of Bharadvāja sing aloud to please you.  The Dames invoked, and the resistless Vasus, and all ye Holy Ones have been exalted.

verses.sanskrit: उदु तयच्चक्षुर्महि मित्रयोरानेति परियं वरुणयोरदब्धम रतस्य शुचि दर्शतमनीकं रुक्मो न दिव उदिताव्यद्यौत |||
verses.transliteration: udu tyaccakṣurmahi mitrayorāneti priyaṃ varuṇayoradabdham ṛtasya śuci darśatamanīkaṃ rukmo na diva uditāvyadyaut

translations.griffith: THAT mighty eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward.  The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.

verses.sanskrit: वेद यस्त्रीणि विदथान्येषां देवानां जन्म सनुतरा च विप्रः रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना च पश्यन्नभि चष्टे सूरो अर्य एवान |||
verses.transliteration: veda yastrīṇi vidathānyeṣāṃ devānāṃ janma sanutarā ca vipraḥ ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyannabhi caṣṭe sūro arya evān

translations.griffith: The Sage who knows these Gods’ three ranks and orders, and all their generations near and distant,  Beholding good and evil acts of mortals, Sūra marks well the doing of the pious.

verses.sanskrit: सतुष उ वो मह रतस्य गोपानदितिं मित्रं वरुणं सुजातान अर्यमणं भगमदब्धधीतीनछा वोचे सधन्यः पावकान |||
verses.transliteration: stuṣa u vo maha ṛtasya ghopānaditiṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sujātān aryamaṇaṃ bhaghamadabdhadhītīnachā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān

translations.griffith: I praise you Guards of mighty Law eternal, Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, the noble,  Aryaman, Bhaga, all whose thoughts are faithful: hither I call the Bright who share in common.

verses.sanskrit: रिशादसः सत्पतीन्रदब्धान महो राज्ञः सुवसनस्य दातॄन यूनः सुक्षत्रान कषयतो दिवो नॄनादित्यान याम्यदितिं दुवोयु |||
verses.transliteration: riśādasaḥ satpatīnradabdhān maho rājñaḥ suvasanasya dātṝn yūnaḥ sukṣatrān kṣayato divo nṝnādityān yāmyaditiṃ duvoyu

translations.griffith: Lords of the brave, infallible, foe-destroyers, great Kings, bestowers of fair homes to dwell in,  Young, Heroes, ruling heaven with strong dominion, Ādityas, Aditi I seek with worship.

verses.sanskrit: दयौष पितः पर्थिवि मातरध्रुगग्ने भरातर्वसवो मर्ळता नः विश्व आदित्या अदिते सजोषा अस्मभ्यं शर्म बहुलं वि यन्त |||
verses.transliteration: dyauṣ pitaḥ pṛthivi mātaradhrughaghne bhrātarvasavo mṛḷatā naḥ viśva ādityā adite sajoṣā asmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yanta

translations.griffith: O Heaven our Father, Earth our guileless Mother, O Brother Agni, and ye Vasus, bless us.  Grant us, O Aditi and ye Ādityas, all of one mind, your manifold protection.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो वर्काय वर्क्ये समस्मा अघायते रीरधता यजत्राः यूयं हि षठा रथ्यो नस्तनूनां यूयं दक्षस्य वचसो बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: mā no vṛkāya vṛkye samasmā aghāyate rīradhatā yajatrāḥ yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā rathyo nastanūnāṃ yūyaṃ dakṣasya vacaso babhūva

translations.griffith: Give us not up to any evil creature, as spoil to wolf or she-wolf, O ye Holy.  For ye are they who guide aright our bodies, ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour.

verses.sanskrit: मा व एनो अन्यक्र्तं भुजेम मा तत कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे विश्वस्य हि कषयथ विश्वदेवाः सवयं रिपुस्तन्वं रीरिषीष्ट |||
verses.transliteration: mā va eno anyakṛtaṃ bhujema mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśvadevāḥ svayaṃ ripustanvaṃ rīriṣīṣṭa

translations.griffith: Let us not suffer for the sin of others, nor do the deed which ye, O Vasus, punish.  Ye, Universal Gods! are all-controllers: may he do harm unto himself who hates Me.

verses.sanskrit: नम इदुग्रं नम आ विवासे नमो दाधार पर्थिवीमुत दयाम नमो देवेभ्यो नम ईश एषां कर्तं चिदेनो नमसाविवासे |||
verses.transliteration: nama idughraṃ nama ā vivāse namo dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām namo devebhyo nama īśa eṣāṃ kṛtaṃ cideno namasāvivāse

translations.griffith: Mighty is homage: I adopt and use it. Homage hath held in place the earth and heaven.  Homage to Gods! Homage commands and rules them. I banish even committed sin by homage

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य वो रथ्यः पूतदक्षान रतस्य पस्त्यसदो अदब्धान ताना नमोभिरुरुचक्षसो नॄन विश्वान व आ नमे महो यजत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya vo rathyaḥ pūtadakṣān ṛtasya pastyasado adabdhān tānā namobhirurucakṣaso nṝn viśvān va ā name maho yajatrāḥ

translations.griffith: You Furtherers of Law, pure in your spirit, infallible, dwellers in the home of Order,  To you all Heroes mighty and far-seeing I bow me down, O Holy Ones, with homage.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि शरेष्ठवर्चसस्त उ नस्तिरो विश्वानि दुरिता नयन्ति सुक्षत्रासो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निरतधीतयो वक्मराजसत्याः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi śreṣṭhavarcasasta u nastiro viśvāni duritā nayanti sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro aghnirtadhītayo vakmarājasatyāḥ

translations.griffith: For these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely-  Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, mighty Rulers, trueminded, faithful to the hymn's controllers.

verses.sanskrit: ते न इन्द्रः पर्थिवी कषाम वर्धन पूषा भगो अदितिः पञ्च जनाः सुशर्माणः सववसः सुनीथा भवन्तु नःसुत्रात्रासः सुगोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: te na indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhagho aditiḥ pañca janāḥ suśarmāṇaḥ svavasaḥ sunīthā bhavantu naḥsutrātrāsaḥ sughopāḥ

translations.griffith: May they, Earth, Aditi, Indra, Bhaga, Pūṣan increase our laud, increase the Fivefold people.  Giving good help, good refuge, goodly guidance, be they our good deliverers, good protectors.
