verses.sanskrit: नू सद्मानं दिव्यं नंशि देवा भारद्वाजः सुमतिं याति होता आसानेभिर्यजमानो मियेधैर्देवानां जन्म वसूयुर्ववन्द |||
verses.transliteration: nū sadmānaṃ divyaṃ naṃśi devā bhāradvājaḥ sumatiṃ yāti hotā āsānebhiryajamāno miyedhairdevānāṃ janma vasūyurvavanda

translations.griffith: Come now, O Gods, to your celestial station: the Bharadvājas' priest entreats your favour.  He, sacrificing, fain for wealth, hath honoured the Gods vath those who sit and share oblations.

verses.sanskrit: अप तयं वर्जिनं रिपुं सतेनमग्ने दुराध्यम दविष्ठमस्य सत्पते कर्धी सुगम |||
verses.transliteration: apa tyaṃ vṛjinaṃ ripuṃ stenamaghne durādhyam daviṣṭhamasya satpate kṛdhī sugham

translations.griffith: Agni, drive thou the wicked foe, the evil-hearted thief away,  Far, far, Lord of the brave I and give us easy paths.

verses.sanskrit: गरावाणः सोम नो हि कं सखित्वनाय वावशुः जही नयत्रिणं पणिं वर्को हि षः |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvāṇaḥ soma no hi kaṃ sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ jahī nyatriṇaṃ paṇiṃ vṛko hi ṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, these pressing-stones have called aloud to win thee for our Friend.  Destroy the greedy Paṇi, for a wolf is he.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं हि षठा सुदानव इन्द्रज्येष्ठा अभिद्यवः कर्ता नो अध्वन्ना सुगं गोपा अमा |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ kartā no adhvannā sughaṃ ghopā amā

translations.griffith: Ye, O most bountiful, are they who, led by Indra, seek the sky.  Give us good paths for travel: guard us ivell at home.

verses.sanskrit: अपि पन्थामगन्महि सवस्तिगामनेहसम येन विश्वाः परिद्विषो वर्णक्ति विन्दते वसु |||
verses.transliteration: api panthāmaghanmahi svastighāmanehasam yena viśvāḥ paridviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu

translations.griffith: Now have we entered on the road that leads to bliss, without a foe,  The road whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth.

verses.sanskrit: न तद दिवा न पर्थिव्यानु मन्ये न यज्ञेन नोत शमीभिराभिः उब्जन्तु तं सुभ्वः पर्वतासो नि हीयतामतियाजस्य यष्टा |||
verses.transliteration: na tad divā na pṛthivyānu manye na yajñena nota śamībhirābhiḥ ubjantu taṃ subhvaḥ parvatāso ni hīyatāmatiyājasya yaṣṭā

translations.griffith: THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties.  May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.

verses.sanskrit: अति वा यो मरुतो मन्यते नो बरह्म वा यः करियमाणं निनित्सात तपूंषि तस्मै वर्जिनानि सन्तु बरह्मद्विषमभि तं शोचतु दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: ati vā yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇaṃ ninitsāt tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣamabhi taṃ śocatu dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making,  May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.

verses.sanskrit: किमङग तवा बरह्मणः सोम गोपां किमङग तवाहुरभिशस्तिपां नः किमङग नः पश्यसि निद्यमानान बरह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य |||
verses.transliteration: kimaṅgha tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma ghopāṃ kimaṅgha tvāhurabhiśastipāṃ naḥ kimaṅgha naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya

translations.griffith: Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches?  Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अवन्तु मामुषसो जायमाना अवन्तु मा सिन्धवः पिन्वमानाः अवन्तु मा पर्वतासो धरुवासो.अवन्तु मा पितरो देवहूतौ |||
verses.transliteration: avantu māmuṣaso jāyamānā avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ avantu mā parvatāso dhruvāso.avantu mā pitaro devahūtau

translations.griffith: May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me.  My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!

verses.sanskrit: विश्वदानीं सुमनसः सयाम पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम तथा करद वसुपतिर्वसूनां देवानोहानो.अवसागमिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvadānīṃ sumanasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam tathā karad vasupatirvasūnāṃ devānohāno.avasāghamiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises.  Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो नेदिष्ठमवसागमिष्ठः सरस्वती सिन्धुभिः पिन्वमाना पर्जन्यो न ओषधीभिर्मयोभुरग्निः सुशंसः सुहवः पितेव |||
verses.transliteration: indro nediṣṭhamavasāghamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā parjanyo na oṣadhībhirmayobhuraghniḥ suśaṃsaḥ suhavaḥ piteva

translations.griffith: Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvatī, who swells with rivers -  Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवास आ गत शर्णुता म इमं हवम एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāsa ā ghata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam edaṃ barhirni ṣīdata

translations.griffith: Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods,  Be seated on this holy grass.

verses.sanskrit: यो वो देवा घर्तस्नुना हव्येन परतिभूषति तं विश्व उप गछथ |||
verses.transliteration: yo vo devā ghṛtasnunā havyena pratibhūṣati taṃ viśva upa ghachatha

translations.griffith: To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil-  Approach ye, one and all, to him.

verses.sanskrit: उप नः सूनवो गिरः शर्ण्वन्त्वम्र्तस्य ये सुम्र्ळीका भवन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: upa naḥ sūnavo ghiraḥ śṛṇvantvamṛtasya ye sumṛḷīkā bhavantu naḥ

translations.griffith: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing,  And be exceeding good to us.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवा रताव्र्ध रतुभिर्हवनश्रुतः जुषन्तां युज्यं पयः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtubhirhavanaśrutaḥ juṣantāṃ yujyaṃ payaḥ

translations.griffith: May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Ṛtus, listening to our call,  Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.

verses.sanskrit: सतोत्रमिन्द्रो मरुद्गणस्त्वष्ट्र्मान मित्रो अर्यमा इमा हव्या जुषन्त नः |||
verses.transliteration: stotramindro marudghaṇastvaṣṭṛmān mitro aryamā imā havyā juṣanta naḥ

translations.griffith: May Indra, with the Marut host, with Tvaṣṭar, Mitra, Aryaman,  Accept the laud and these our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं होतर्वयुनशो यज चिकित्वान दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ no aghne adhvaraṃ hotarvayunaśo yaja cikitvān daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours,  Remembering the Heavenly Folk.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवाः शर्णुतेमं हवं मे ये अन्तरिक्षे य उप दयवि षठ ये अग्निजिह्वा उत वा यजत्रा आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṃ havaṃ me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha ye aghnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam

translations.griffith: Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions,  All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवा मम शर्ण्वन्तु यज्ञिया उभे रोदसी अपां नपाच्च मन्म मा वो वचांसि परिचक्ष्याणि वोचं सुम्नेष्विद वो अन्तमा मदेम |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyā ubhe rodasī apāṃ napācca manma mā vo vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumneṣvid vo antamā madema

translations.griffith: May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters’ Child.  Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.

verses.sanskrit: ये के च जमा महिनो अहिमाया दिवो जज्ञिरे अपां सधस्थे ते अस्मभ्यमिषये विश्वमायुः कषप उस्रा वरिवस्यन्तुदेवाः |||
verses.transliteration: ye ke ca jmā mahino ahimāyā divo jajñire apāṃ sadhasthe te asmabhyamiṣaye viśvamāyuḥ kṣapa usrā varivasyantudevāḥ

translations.griffith: And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather-  May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीपर्जन्याववतं धियं मे.अस्मिन हवे सुहवा सुष्टुतिंनः इळामन्यो जनयद गर्भमन्यः परजावतीरिष आ धत्तमस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīparjanyāvavataṃ dhiyaṃ me.asmin have suhavā suṣṭutiṃnaḥ iḷāmanyo janayad gharbhamanyaḥ prajāvatīriṣa ā dhattamasme

translations.griffith: At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation.  One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.

verses.sanskrit: सतीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्नौ सूक्तेन महा नमसा विवासे अस्मिन नो अद्य विदथे यजत्रा विश्वे देवा हविषि मादयध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne aghnau sūktena mahā namasā vivāse asmin no adya vidathe yajatrā viśve devā haviṣi mādayadhvam

translations.griffith: When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you.  All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.

verses.sanskrit: वयमु तवा पथस पते रथं न वाजसातये धिये पूषन्नयुज्महि |||
verses.transliteration: vayamu tvā pathas pate rathaṃ na vājasātaye dhiye pūṣannayujmahi

translations.griffith: LORD of the path, O Pūṣan, we have yoked and bound thee to our hymn,  Even as a car, to win the prize.

verses.sanskrit: अभि नो नर्यं वसु वीरं परयतदक्षिणम वामं गर्हपतिं नय |||
verses.transliteration: abhi no naryaṃ vasu vīraṃ prayatadakṣiṇam vāmaṃ ghṛhapatiṃ naya

translations.griffith: Bring us the wealth that men require, a manly master of a house,  Free-handed with the liberal meed.

verses.sanskrit: अदित्सन्तं चिदाघ्र्णे पूषन दानाय चोदय पणेश्चिद विम्रदा मनः |||
verses.transliteration: aditsantaṃ cidāghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya paṇeścid vimradā manaḥ

translations.griffith: Even him who would not give, do thou,  O glowing Pūṣan, urge to give,  And make the niggard's soul grow soft.

verses.sanskrit: वि पथो वाजसातये चिनुहि वि मर्धो जहि साधन्तामुग्र नो धियः |||
verses.transliteration: vi patho vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdho jahi sādhantāmughra no dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Clear paths that we may win the prize; scatter our enemies afar.  Strong God, be all our thoughts fulfilled.

verses.sanskrit: परि तर्न्धि पणीनामारया हर्दया कवे अथेमस्मभ्यं रन्धय |||
verses.transliteration: pari tṛndhi paṇīnāmārayā hṛdayā kave athemasmabhyaṃ randhaya

translations.griffith: Penetrate with an awl, O Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls,  And make them subject to our will.

verses.sanskrit: वि पूषन्नारया तुद पणेरिछ हर्दि परियम अथें ... |||
verses.transliteration: vi pūṣannārayā tuda paṇericha hṛdi priyam atheṃ ...

translations.griffith: Thrust with thine awl, O Pūṣan: seek that which the niggard's heart holds dear,  And make him subject to our will.

verses.sanskrit: आ रिख किकिरा कर्णु पणीनां हर्दया कवे अथें ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu paṇīnāṃ hṛdayā kave atheṃ ...

translations.griffith: Tear up and read in pieces, Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls,  And make them subject to our will.

verses.sanskrit: यां पूषन बरह्मचोदनीमारां बिभर्ष्याघ्र्णे तया समस्य हर्दयमा रिख किकिरा कर्णु |||
verses.transliteration: yāṃ pūṣan brahmacodanīmārāṃ bibharṣyāghṛṇe tayā samasya hṛdayamā rikha kikirā kṛṇu

translations.griffith: Thou, glowing Pūṣan, carriest an awl that urges men to prayer;  Therewith do thou tear up and rend to shreds the heart of every one.

verses.sanskrit: या ते अष्ट्रा गोोपशाघ्र्णे पशुसाधनी तस्यास्ते सुम्नमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: yā te aṣṭrā ghoopaśāghṛṇe paśusādhanī tasyāste sumnamīmahe

translations.griffith: Thou bearest, glowing Lord! a goad with horny point that guides the cows  Thence do we seek thy gift of bliss.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो गोषणिं धियमश्वसां वाजसामुत नर्वत कर्णुहि वीतये |||
verses.transliteration: uta no ghoṣaṇiṃ dhiyamaśvasāṃ vājasāmuta nṛvat kṛṇuhi vītaye

translations.griffith: And make this hymn of ours produce kine, horses, and a store of wealth  For our delight and use as men.

verses.sanskrit: सं पूषन विदुषा नय यो अञ्जसानुशासति य एवेदमिति बरवत |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ pūṣan viduṣā naya yo añjasānuśāsati ya evedamiti bravat

translations.griffith: O PUSAN, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight,  And say unto us, It is here.

verses.sanskrit: समु पूष्णा गमेमहि यो गर्हानभिशासति इम एवेति चब्रवत |||
verses.transliteration: samu pūṣṇā ghamemahi yo ghṛhānabhiśāsati ima eveti cabravat

translations.griffith: May we go forth with Pūṣan who shall point the houses out to us,  And say to us, These same are they.

verses.sanskrit: पूष्णश्चक्रं न रिष्यति न कोशो.अव पद्यते नो अस्य वयथते पविः |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣṇaścakraṃ na riṣyati na kośo.ava padyate no asya vyathate paviḥ

translations.griffith: Unharmed is Pūṣan's chariot wheel; the box ne’er falleth to the ground,  Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.

verses.sanskrit: यो अस्मै हविषाविधन न तं पूषापि मर्ष्यते परथमो विदते वसु |||
verses.transliteration: yo asmai haviṣāvidhan na taṃ pūṣāpi mṛṣyate prathamo vidate vasu

translations.griffith: Pūṣan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift:  That man is first to gather wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पूषा गा अन्वेतु नः पुषा रक्षत्वर्वतः पूषा वाजं सनोतु नः |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣā ghā anvetu naḥ puṣā rakṣatvarvataḥ pūṣā vājaṃ sanotu naḥ

translations.griffith: May Pūṣan follow near our kine; may Pūṣan keep our horses safe:  May Pūṣan gather gear for us.

verses.sanskrit: पूषन्ननु पर गा इहि यजमानस्य सुन्वतः अस्माकं सतुवतामुत |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣannanu pra ghā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ asmākaṃ stuvatāmuta

translations.griffith: Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee;  And ours who sing thee songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit: माकिर्नेशन माकीं रिषन माकीं सं शारि केवटे अथारिष्टाभिरा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: mākirneśan mākīṃ riṣan mākīṃ saṃ śāri kevaṭe athāriṣṭābhirā ghahi

translations.griffith: Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb.  Return with these all safe and sound.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ण्वन्तं पूषणं वयमिर्यमनष्टवेदसम ईशानंराय ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇvantaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ vayamiryamanaṣṭavedasam īśānaṃrāya īmahe

translations.griffith: Pūṣan who listens to our prayers, the Strong whose wealth is never lost,  The Lord of riches, we implore.

verses.sanskrit: पूषन तव वरते वयं न रिष्येम कदा चन सतोतारस्त इह समसि |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana stotārasta iha smasi

translations.griffith: Secure in thy protecting care, O Pūṣan, never may we fail.  We here are they who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: परि पूषा परस्ताद धस्तं दधातु दक्षिणम पुनर्नो नष्टमाजतु |||
verses.transliteration: pari pūṣā parastād dhastaṃ dadhātu dakṣiṇam punarno naṣṭamājatu

translations.griffith: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pūṣan stretch his right hand forth,  And drive our lost again to us.

verses.sanskrit: एहि वां विमुचो नपादाघ्र्णे सं सचावहै रथीरतस्य नो भव |||
verses.transliteration: ehi vāṃ vimuco napādāghṛṇe saṃ sacāvahai rathīrtasya no bhava

translations.griffith: SON of Deliverance, come, bright God!  Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: रथीतमं कपर्दिनमीशानं राधसो महः रायः सखायमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: rathītamaṃ kapardinamīśānaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ rāyaḥ sakhāyamīmahe

translations.griffith: We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair,  Lord of great riches, and our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: रायो धारास्याघ्र्णे वसो राशिरजाश्व धीवतो-धीवतः सखा |||
verses.transliteration: rāyo dhārāsyāghṛṇe vaso rāśirajāśva dhīvato-dhīvataḥ sakhā

translations.griffith: Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap,  The Friend of every pious man.

verses.sanskrit: पूषणं नवजाश्वमुप सतोषाम वाजिनम सवसुर्यो जार उच्यते |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣaṇaṃ nvajāśvamupa stoṣāma vājinam svasuryo jāra ucyate

translations.griffith: Pūṣan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called  His Sister's lover, will we laud.

verses.sanskrit: मातुर्दिधिषुमब्रवं सवसुर्जारः शर्णोतु नः भरातेन्द्रस्य सखा मम |||
verses.transliteration: māturdidhiṣumabravaṃ svasurjāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ bhrātendrasya sakhā mama

translations.griffith: His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear,  Brother of Indra, and my Friend.

verses.sanskrit: आजासः पूषणं रथे निश्र्म्भास्ते जनश्रियम देवं वहन्तु बिभ्रतः |||
verses.transliteration: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇaṃ rathe niśṛmbhāste janaśriyam devaṃ vahantu bibhrataḥ

translations.griffith: May the sure-footed goats come nigh, conveying Pūṣan on his car,  The God who visiteth mankind.

verses.sanskrit: य एनमादिदेशति करम्भादिति पूषणम न तेन देव आदिशे |||
verses.transliteration: ya enamādideśati karambhāditi pūṣaṇam na tena deva ādiśe

translations.griffith: WHOSO remembers Pūṣan as cater of mingled curd and meal  Need think no more upon the God.

verses.sanskrit: उत घा स रथीतमः सख्या सत्पतिर्युजा इन्द्रो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते |||
verses.transliteration: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatiryujā indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate

translations.griffith: And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied  With him as Friend, destroys the foes.

verses.sanskrit: उतादः परुषे गवि सूरश्चक्रं हिरण्ययम नयैरयद्रथीतमः |||
verses.transliteration: utādaḥ paruṣe ghavi sūraścakraṃ hiraṇyayam nyairayadrathītamaḥ

translations.griffith: And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud  The golden wheel of Sūra's car.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य तवा पुरुष्टुत बरवाम दस्र मन्तुमः तत सु नो मन्म साधय |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumaḥ tat su no manma sādhaya

translations.griffith: Whate’er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise,  Give thou fulfilment of our thought.

verses.sanskrit: इमं च नो गवेषणं सातये सीषधो गणम आरात पूषन्नसि शरुतः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ ca no ghaveṣaṇaṃ sātaye sīṣadho ghaṇam ārāt pūṣannasi śrutaḥ

translations.griffith: Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil:  Thou, Pūṣan, art renowned afar.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते सवस्तिमीमह आरेघामुपावसुम अद्या च सर्वतातये शवश्च सर्वतातये |||
verses.transliteration: ā te svastimīmaha āreaghāmupāvasum adyā ca sarvatātaye śvaśca sarvatātaye

translations.griffith: Prosperity we crave from thee, afar from sin and near to wealth,  Tending to perfect happiness both for to. morrow and to-day.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा नु पूषणा वयं सख्याय सवस्तये हुवेम वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayaṃ sakhyāya svastaye huvema vājasātaye

translations.griffith: INDRA and Pūṣan will we call for friend ship and prosperity  And for the winning of the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: सोममन्य उपासदत पातवे चम्वोः सुतम करम्भमन्य इछति |||
verses.transliteration: somamanya upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam karambhamanya ichati

translations.griffith: One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed:  The other longs for curd and meal.

verses.sanskrit: अजा अन्यस्य वह्नयो हरी अन्यस्य सम्भ्र्ता ताभ्यां वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते |||
verses.transliteration: ajā anyasya vahnayo harī anyasya sambhṛtā tābhyāṃ vṛtrāṇi jighnate

translations.griffith: Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand;  With both of these he slays the fiends.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्रो अनयद रितो महीरपो वर्षन्तमः तत्र पूषाभवत सचा |||
verses.transliteration: yadindro anayad rito mahīrapo vṛṣantamaḥ tatra pūṣābhavat sacā

translations.griffith: When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods,  Pūṣan was standing by his side.

verses.sanskrit: तां पूष्णः सुमतिं वयं वर्क्षस्य पर वयामिव इन्द्रस्य चा रभामहे |||
verses.transliteration: tāṃ pūṣṇaḥ sumatiṃ vayaṃ vṛkṣasya pra vayāmiva indrasya cā rabhāmahe

translations.griffith: To this, to Pūṣan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling,  As to a tree's extended bough.

verses.sanskrit: उत पूषणं युवामहे.अभीशून्रिव सारथिः मह्या इन्द्रं सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: ut pūṣaṇaṃ yuvāmahe.abhīśūnriva sārathiḥ mahyā indraṃ svastaye

translations.griffith: As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pūṣan near,  And Indra, for our great success.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्रं ते अन्यद यजतं ते अन्यद विषुरूपे अहनी दयौरिवासि विश्वा हि माया अवसि सवधावो भद्रा ते पूषन्निहरातिरस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: śukraṃ te anyad yajataṃ te anyad viṣurūpe ahanī dyaurivāsi viśvā hi māyā avasi svadhāvo bhadrā te pūṣanniharātirastu

translations.griffith: LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour.  All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pūṣan.

verses.sanskrit: अजाश्वः पशुपा वाजपस्त्यो धियंजिन्वो भुवने विश्वे अर्पितः अष्ट्रां पूषा शिथिरामुद्वरीव्र्जत संचक्षाणोभुवना देव ईयते |||
verses.transliteration: ajāśvaḥ paśupā vājapastyo dhiyaṃjinvo bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ aṣṭrāṃ pūṣā śithirāmudvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇobhuvanā deva īyate

translations.griffith: Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world;  Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pūṣan, God, goes forth.

verses.sanskrit: यास्ते पूषन नावो अन्तः समुद्रे हिरण्ययीरन्तरिक्षे चरन्ति ताभिर्यासि दूत्यां सूर्यस्य कामेन कर्त शरव इछमानः |||
verses.transliteration: yāste pūṣan nāvo antaḥ samudre hiraṇyayīrantarikṣe caranti tābhiryāsi dūtyāṃ sūryasya kāmena kṛta śrava ichamānaḥ

translations.griffith: O Pūṣan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region,  Thou goest on an embassy to Sūrya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.

verses.sanskrit: पूषा सुबन्धुर्दिव आ पर्थिव्या इळस पतिर्मघवा दस्मवर्चाः यं देवासो अददुः सूर्यायै कामेन कर्तं तवसं सवञ्चम |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣā subandhurdiva ā pṛthivyā iḷas patirmaghavā dasmavarcāḥ yaṃ devāso adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtaṃ tavasaṃ svañcam

translations.griffith: Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pūṣan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous iustre,  Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: पर नु वोचा सुतेषु वां वीर्या यानि चक्रथुः हतासो वां पितरो देवशत्रव इन्द्राग्नी जीवथो युवम |||
verses.transliteration: pra nu vocā suteṣu vāṃ vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ hatāso vāṃ pitaro devaśatrava indrāghnī jīvatho yuvam

translations.griffith: I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done:  Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.

verses.sanskrit: बळ इत्था महिमा वामिन्द्राग्नी पनिष्ठ आ समानो वां जनिता भरातरा युवं यमाविहेहमातरा |||
verses.transliteration: baḷ itthā mahimā vāmindrāghnī paniṣṭha ā samāno vāṃ janitā bhrātarā yuvaṃ yamāvihehamātarā

translations.griffith: Thus, Indra-Agnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise,  Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.

verses.sanskrit: ओकिवांसा सुते सचानश्वा सप्ती इवादने इन्द्रा नवग्नी अवसेह वज्रिणा वयं देवा हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: okivāṃsā sute sacānaśvā saptī ivādane indrā nvaghnī avaseha vajriṇā vayaṃ devā havāmahe

translations.griffith: These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food,  Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्राग्नी सुतेषु वां सतवत तेष्व रताव्र्धा जोषवाकं वदतः पज्रहोषिणा न देवा भसथश्चन |||
verses.transliteration: ya indrāghnī suteṣu vāṃ stavat teṣv ṛtāvṛdhā joṣavākaṃ vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaścana

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind  To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne’er consume.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी को अस्य वां देवौ मर्तश्चिकेतति विषूचो अश्वान युयुजान ईयत एकः समान आ रथे |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī ko asya vāṃ devau martaściketati viṣūco aśvān yuyujāna īyata ekaḥ samāna ā rathe

translations.griffith: What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way?  One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी अपादियं पूर्वागात पद्वतीभ्यः हित्वी शिरो जिह्वया वावदच्चरत तरिंशत पदा नयक्रमीत |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī apādiyaṃ pūrvāghāt padvatībhyaḥ hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadaccarat triṃśat padā nyakramīt

translations.griffith: First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet.  Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी आ हि तन्वते नरो धन्वानि बाह्वोः मा नो अस्मिन महाधने परा वर्क्तं गविष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī ā hi tanvate naro dhanvāni bāhvoḥ mā no asmin mahādhane parā varktaṃ ghaviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: E’en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows.  Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी तपन्ति माघा अर्यो अरातयः अप दवेषांस्या कर्तं युयुतं सूर्यादधि |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī tapanti māghā aryo arātayaḥ apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛtaṃ yuyutaṃ sūryādadhi

translations.griffith: The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore.  Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी युवोरपि वसु दिव्यानि पार्थिवा आ न इह परयछतं रयिं विश्वायुपोषसम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī yuvorapi vasu divyāni pārthivā ā na iha prayachataṃ rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth.  Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी उक्थवाहसा सतोमेभिर्हवनश्रुता विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरा गतमस्य सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī ukthavāhasā stomebhirhavanaśrutā viśvābhirghīrbhirā ghatamasya somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: O Indra-Agni, who accept the laud, and hear us for our praise,  Come near us, drawn by all our songs, to drink of this our Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: शनथद वर्त्रमुत सनोति वाजमिन्द्रा यो अग्नी सहुरी सपर्यात इरज्यन्ता वसव्यस्य भूरेः सहस्तमा सहसा वाजयन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: śnathad vṛtramuta sanoti vājamindrā yo aghnī sahurī saparyāt irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā

translations.griffith: HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes,  Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.

verses.sanskrit: ता योधिष्टमभि गा इन्द्र नूनमपः सवरुषसो अग्न ऊळ्हः दिशः सवरुषस इन्द्र चित्रा अपो गा अग्ने युवसे नियुत्वान |||
verses.transliteration: tā yodhiṣṭamabhi ghā indra nūnamapaḥ svaruṣaso aghna ūḷhaḥ diśaḥ svaruṣasa indra citrā apo ghā aghne yuvase niyutvān

translations.griffith: So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings.  Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.

verses.sanskrit: आ वर्त्रहणा वर्त्रहभिः शुष्मैरिन्द्र यातं नमोभिरग्ने अर्वाक युवं राधोभिरकवेभिरिन्द्राग्ने अस्मे भवतमुत्तमेभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vṛtrahaṇā vṛtrahabhiḥ śuṣmairindra yātaṃ namobhiraghne arvāk yuvaṃ rādhobhirakavebhirindrāghne asme bhavatamuttamebhiḥ

translations.griffith: With Vṛtra-slaying might, Indra and Agni, come, drawn by homage, O ye Vṛtra-slayers.  Indra and Agni, show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.

verses.sanskrit: ता हुवे ययोरिदं पप्ने विश्वं पुरा कर्तम इन्द्राग्नी नमर्धतः |||
verses.transliteration: tā huve yayoridaṃ papne viśvaṃ purā kṛtam indrāghnī namardhataḥ

translations.griffith: I call the Twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days  O Indra-Agni, harm us not.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रा विघनिना मर्ध इन्द्राग्नी हवामहे ता नो मर्ळात ईद्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: ughrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāghnī havāmahe tā no mṛḷāta īdṛśe

translations.griffith: The Strong, the scatterers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke;  May they be kind to one like me.

verses.sanskrit: हतो वर्त्राण्यार्या हतो दासानि सत्पती हतो विश्वा अप दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: hato vṛtrāṇyāryā hato dāsāni satpatī hato viśvā apa dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: They slay our Ārya foes, these Lords of heroes, slay our Dasyu foes  And drive our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी युवामिमे.अभि सतोमा अनूषत पिबतं शम्भुवा सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī yuvāmime.abhi stomā anūṣata pibataṃ śambhuvā sutam

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you:  Ye who bring blessings! drink the juice.

verses.sanskrit: या वां सन्ति पुरुस्प्र्हो नियुतो दाशुषे नरा इन्द्राग्नी ताभिरा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā indrāghnī tābhirā ghatam

translations.griffith: Come, Indra-Agni, with those teams, desired of many, which ye have,  O Heroes, for the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: ताभिरा गछतं नरोपेदं सवनं सुतम इन्द्राग्नी सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: tābhirā ghachataṃ naropedaṃ savanaṃ sutam indrāghnī somapītaye

translations.griffith: With those to this libation poured, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, come:  Come ye to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: तमीळिष्व यो अर्चिषा वना विश्वा परिष्वजत कर्ष्णाक्र्णोति जिह्वया |||
verses.transliteration: tamīḷiṣva yo arciṣā vanā viśvā pariṣvajat kṛṣṇākṛṇoti jihvayā

translations.griffith: Glorify him who compasses all forests with his glowing flame,  And leaves them blackened with his tongue.

verses.sanskrit: य इद्ध आविवासति सुम्नमिन्द्रस्य मर्त्यः दयुम्नाय सुतरा अपः |||
verses.transliteration: ya iddha āvivāsati sumnamindrasya martyaḥ dyumnāya sutarā apaḥ

translations.griffith: He who gains Indra's bliss with fire enkindled finds an easy way  Over the floods to happiness.

verses.sanskrit: ता नो वाजवतीरिष आशून पिप्र्तमर्वतः इन्द्रमग्निं च वोळ्हवे |||
verses.transliteration: tā no vājavatīriṣa āśūn pipṛtamarvataḥ indramaghniṃ ca voḷhave

translations.griffith: Give us fleet coursers to convey Indra and Agni, and bestow  Abundant strengthening food on us.

verses.sanskrit: उभा वामिन्द्राग्नी आहुवध्या उभा राधसः सह मादयध्यै उभा दाताराविषां रयीणामुभा वाजस्य सातये हुवे वाम |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā vāmindrāghnī āhuvadhyā ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai ubhā dātārāviṣāṃ rayīṇāmubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, I will call you hither and make you joyful with the gifts I offer.  Ye Twain are givers both of food and riches: to win me strength and vigour I invoke you.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गव्येभिरश्व्यैर्वसव्यैरुप गछतम सखायौ देवौ सख्याय शम्भुवेन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghavyebhiraśvyairvasavyairupa ghachatam sakhāyau devau sakhyāya śambhuvendrāghnī tā havāmahe

translations.griffith: Come unto us with riches, come with wealth in horses and in kine.  Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, the Gods, as Friends for friendship, bringing bliss.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी शर्णुतं हवं यजमानस्य सुन्वतः वीतं हव्यान्या गतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yajamānasya sunvataḥ vītaṃ havyānyā ghataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, hear his call who worships. with libations poured.  Come and enjoy the offerings, drink the sweetly-flavoured Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इयमददाद रभसं रणच्युतं दिवोदासं वध्र्यश्वाय दाशुषे या शश्वन्तमाचखादावसं पणिं ता ते दात्राणि तविषा सरस्वति |||
verses.transliteration: iyamadadād rabhasaṃ ṛṇacyutaṃ divodāsaṃ vadhryaśvāya dāśuṣe yā śaśvantamācakhādāvasaṃ paṇiṃ tā te dātrāṇi taviṣā sarasvati

translations.griffith: To Vadhryasva when. be worshipped her with gifts she gave fierce Divodāsa, canceller of debts.  Consumer of the churlish niggard, one and all, thine, O Sarasvatī, are these effectual boons.

verses.sanskrit: इयं शुष्मेभिर्बिसखा इवारुजत सानु गिरीणां तविषेभिरूर्मिभिः पारावतघ्नीमवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः सरस्वतीमा विवासेम धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ śuṣmebhirbisakhā ivārujat sānu ghirīṇāṃ taviṣebhirūrmibhiḥ pārāvataghnīmavase suvṛktibhiḥ sarasvatīmā vivāsema dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: She with her might, like one who digs for lotus-stems, hath burst with her strong waves the ridges of the hills.  Let us invite with songs and holy hymns for help Sarasvatī who slayeth the Paravatas.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वति देवनिदो नि बर्हय परजां विश्वस्य बर्सयस्य मायिनः उत कषितिभ्यो.अवनीरविन्दो विषमेभ्यो अस्रवो वाजिनीवति |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvati devanido ni barhaya prajāṃ viśvasya bṛsayasya māyinaḥ uta kṣitibhyo.avanīravindo viṣamebhyo asravo vājinīvati

translations.griffith: Thou castest down, Sarasvatī, those who scorned the Gods, the brood of every Bṛsaya skilled in magic arts.  Thou hast discovered rivers for the tribes of men, and, rich in wealth! made poison flow away from them.

verses.sanskrit: पर णो देवी सरस्वती वाजेभिर्वाजिनीवती धीनामवित्र्यवतु |||
verses.transliteration: pra ṇo devī sarasvatī vājebhirvājinīvatī dhīnāmavitryavatu

translations.griffith: May the divine Sarasvatī, rich in her wealth, protect us well,  Furthering all our thoughts with might

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्वा देवि सरस्वत्युपब्रूते धने हिते इन्द्रं न वर्त्रतूर्ये |||
verses.transliteration: yastvā devi sarasvatyupabrūte dhane hite indraṃ na vṛtratūrye

translations.griffith: Whoso, divine Sarasvatī, invokes thee where the prize is set,  Like Indra when he smites the foe.

verses.sanskrit: तवं देवि सरस्वत्यवा वाजेषु वाजिनि रदा पूषेव नःसनिम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ devi sarasvatyavā vājeṣu vājini radā pūṣeva naḥsanim

translations.griffith: Aid us, divine Sarasvad, thou who art strong in wealth and power  Like Pūṣan, give us opulence.

verses.sanskrit: उत सया नः सरस्वती घोरा हिरण्यवर्तनिः वर्त्रघ्नी वष्टि सुष्टुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī ghorā hiraṇyavartaniḥ vṛtraghnī vaṣṭi suṣṭutim

translations.griffith: Yea, this divine Sarasvatī, terrible with her golden path,  Foe-slayer, claims our eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: यस्या अनन्तो अह्रुतस्त्वेषश्चरिष्णुरर्णवः अमश्चरति रोरुवत |||
verses.transliteration: yasyā ananto ahrutastveṣaścariṣṇurarṇavaḥ amaścarati roruvat

translations.griffith: Whose limitless unbroken flood, swift-moving with a rapid rush,  Comes onward with tempestuous roar.

verses.sanskrit: सा नो विश्वा अति दविषः सवसॄरन्या रतावरी अतन्नहेव सूर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sā no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ svasṝranyā ṛtāvarī atannaheva sūryaḥ

translations.griffith: She hath spread us beyond all foes, beyond her Sisters, Holy One,  As Sūrya spreadeth out the days.

verses.sanskrit: उत नः परिया परियासु सप्तस्वसा सुजुष्टा सरस्वती सतोम्या भूत |||
verses.transliteration: uta naḥ priyā priyāsu saptasvasā sujuṣṭā sarasvatī stomyā bhūt

translations.griffith: Yea, she most dear amid dear stream, Seven-sistered, graciously inclined,  Sarasvatī hath earned our praise.

verses.sanskrit: आपप्रुषी पार्थिवान्युरु रजो अन्तरिक्षम सरस्वती निदस पातु |||
verses.transliteration: āpapruṣī pārthivānyuru rajo antarikṣam sarasvatī nidas pātu

translations.griffith: Guard us from hate Sarasvatī, she who hath filled the realms of earth,  And that wide tract, the firmament!

verses.sanskrit: तरिषधस्था सप्तधातुः पञ्च जाता वर्धयन्ती वाजे-वाजे हव्या भूत |||
verses.transliteration: triṣadhasthā saptadhātuḥ pañca jātā vardhayantī vāje-vāje havyā bhūt

translations.griffith: Seven-sistered, sprung from threefold source, the Five Tribes' prosperer, she must be  Invoked in every deed of might.

verses.sanskrit: पर या महिम्ना महिनासु चेकिते दयुम्नेभिरन्या अपसामपस्तमा रथ इव बर्हती विभ्वने कर्तोपस्तुत्या चिकितुषा सरस्वती |||
verses.transliteration: pra yā mahimnā mahināsu cekite dyumnebhiranyā apasāmapastamā ratha iva bṛhatī vibhvane kṛtopastutyā cikituṣā sarasvatī

translations.griffith: Marked out by majesty among the Mighty Ones, in glory swifter than the other rapid Streams,  Created vast for victory like a chariot, Sarasvatī must be extolled by every sage.

verses.sanskrit: सरस्वत्यभि नो नेषि वस्यो माप सफरीः पयसा मा न आधक जुषस्व नः सख्या वेश्या च मा तवत कषेत्राण्यरणानि गन्म |||
verses.transliteration: sarasvatyabhi no neṣi vasyo māpa spharīḥ payasā mā na ādhak juṣasva naḥ sakhyā veśyā ca mā tvat kṣetrāṇyaraṇāni ghanma

translations.griffith: Guide us, Sarasvatī, to glorious treasure: refuse us not thy milk, nor spurn us from thee.  Gladly accept our friendship and obedience: let us not go from thee to distant countries.

verses.sanskrit: सतुषे नरा दिवो अस्य परसन्ताश्विना हुवे जरमाणो अर्कैः या सद्य उस्रा वयुषि जमो अन्तान युयूषतः पर्युरूवरांसि |||
verses.transliteration: stuṣe narā divo asya prasantāśvinā huve jaramāṇo arkaiḥ yā sadya usrā vyuṣi jmo antān yuyūṣataḥ paryurūvarāṃsi

translations.griffith: I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Aśvins,  Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.

verses.sanskrit: ता यज्ञमा शुचिभिश्चक्रमाणा रथस्य भानुं रुरुचूरजोभिः पुरू वरांस्यमिता मिमानापो धन्वान्यति याथो अज्रान |||
verses.transliteration: tā yajñamā śucibhiścakramāṇā rathasya bhānuṃ rurucūrajobhiḥ purū varāṃsyamitā mimānāpo dhanvānyati yātho ajrān

translations.griffith: Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them.  Traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.

verses.sanskrit: ता ह तयद वर्तिर्यदरध्रमुग्रेत्था धिय ऊहथुः शश्वदश्वैः मनोजवेभिरिषिरैः शयध्यै परि वयथिर्दाशुषो मर्त्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: tā ha tyad vartiryadaradhramughretthā dhiya ūhathuḥ śaśvadaśvaiḥ manojavebhiriṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathirdāśuṣo martyasya

translations.griffith: Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses,  Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.

verses.sanskrit: ता नव्यसो जरमाणस्य मन्मोप भूषतो युयुजानसप्ती शुभं पर्क्षमिषमूर्जं वहन्ता होता यक्षत परत्नो अध्रुग युवाना |||
verses.transliteration: tā navyaso jaramāṇasya manmopa bhūṣato yuyujānasaptī śubhaṃ pṛkṣamiṣamūrjaṃ vahantā hotā yakṣat pratno adhrugh yuvānā

translations.griffith: So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer.  Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.

verses.sanskrit: ता वल्गू दस्रा पुरुशाकतमा परत्ना नव्यसा वचसा विवासे या शंसते सतुवते शम्भविष्ठा बभूवतुर्ग्र्णते चित्रराती |||
verses.transliteration: tā valghū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse yā śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvaturghṛṇate citrarātī

translations.griffith: With newest hymn I call those Wonder-Workers, ancient and brilliant, and exceeding mighty,  Bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises, bestowing varied bounties on the singer.

verses.sanskrit: ता भुज्युं विभिरद्भ्यः समुद्रात तुग्रस्य सूनुमूहथूरजोभिः अरेणुभिर्योजनेभिर्भुजन्ता पतत्रिभिरर्णसोनिरुपस्थात |||
verses.transliteration: tā bhujyuṃ vibhiradbhyaḥ samudrāt tughrasya sūnumūhathūrajobhiḥ areṇubhiryojanebhirbhujantā patatribhirarṇasonirupasthāt

translations.griffith: So ye, with birds, out of the sea and waters bore Bhujyu, son of Tugra, through the regions.  Speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces, out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.

verses.sanskrit: वि जयुषा रथ्या यातमद्रिं शरुतं हवं वर्षणा वध्रिमत्याः दशस्यन्ता शयवे पिप्यथुर्गामिति चयवाना सुमतिं भुरण्यू |||
verses.transliteration: vi jayuṣā rathyā yātamadriṃ śrutaṃ havaṃ vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ daśasyantā śayave pipyathurghāmiti cyavānā sumatiṃ bhuraṇyū

translations.griffith: Victors, car-borne, ye rent the rock asunder: Bulls, heard the calling of the eunuch's consort.  Bounteous, ye filled the cow with milk for Śayu: thus, swift and zealous Ones, ye showed your favour.

verses.sanskrit: यद रोदसी परदिवो अस्ति भूमा हेळो देवानामुत मर्त्यत्रा तदादित्या वसवो रुद्रियासो रक्षोयुजे तपुरघं दधात |||
verses.transliteration: yad rodasī pradivo asti bhūmā heḷo devānāmuta martyatrā tadādityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣoyuje tapuraghaṃ dadhāta

translations.griffith: Whate’er from olden time, Heaven, Earth! existeth great object of the wrath of Gods and mortals,  Make that, Ādityas, Vasus, sons of Rudra, an evil brand to one allied with demons.

verses.sanskrit: य ईं राजानाव रतुथा विदधद रजसो मित्रो वरुणश्चिकेतत गम्भीराय रक्षसे हेतिमस्य दरोघाय चिद वचस आनवाय |||
verses.transliteration: ya īṃ rājānāv ṛtuthā vidadhad rajaso mitro varuṇaściketat ghambhīrāya rakṣase hetimasya droghāya cid vacasa ānavāya

translations.griffith: May he who knows, as Varuṇa and Mitra, air's realm, appointing both the Kings in season,  Against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon, against the lying words that strangers utter.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तरैश्चक्रैस्तनयाय वर्तिर्द्युमता यातं नर्वता रथेन सनुत्येन तयजसा मर्त्यस्य वनुष्यतामपि शीर्षावव्र्क्तम |||
verses.transliteration: antaraiścakraistanayāya vartirdyumatā yātaṃ nṛvatā rathena sanutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatāmapi śīrṣāvavṛktam

translations.griffith: Come to our home with friendly wheels, for offipring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes.  Strike off, ye Twain, the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us.

verses.sanskrit: आ परमाभिरुत मध्यमाभिर्नियुद्भिर्यातमवमाभिरर्वाक दर्ळ्हस्य चिद गोमतो वि वरजस्य दुरो वर्तं गर्णते चित्रराती |||
verses.transliteration: ā paramābhiruta madhyamābhirniyudbhiryātamavamābhirarvāk dṛḷhasya cid ghomato vi vrajasya duro vartaṃ ghṛṇate citrarātī

translations.griffith: Come hitherward to us with teams of horses, the highest and the midmost and the lowest.  Bountiful Lords, throw open to the singer doors e’en of the firm-closed stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: कव तया वल्गू पुरुहूताद्य दूतो न सतोमो.अविदन नमस्वान आ यो अर्वां नासत्या ववर्त परेष्ठा हयसथो अस्य मन्मन |||
verses.transliteration: kva tyā valghū puruhūtādya dūto na stomo.avidan namasvān ā yo arvāṃ nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hyasatho asya manman

translations.griffith: WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many-  Hymn that hath brought the two Nāsatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.

verses.sanskrit: अरं मे गन्तं हवनायास्मै गर्णाना यथा पिबाथो अन्धः परि ह तयद वर्तिर्याथो रिषो न यत परो नान्तरस्तुतुर्यात |||
verses.transliteration: araṃ me ghantaṃ havanāyāsmai ghṛṇānā yathā pibātho andhaḥ pari ha tyad vartiryātho riṣo na yat paro nāntarastuturyāt

translations.griffith: Come readily to this mine invocation, lauded with songs, that ye may drink the juices.  Compass this house to keep it from the foeman, that none may force it, either near or distant.

verses.sanskrit: अकारि वामन्धसो वरीमन्नस्तारि बर्हिः सुप्रायणतमम उत्तानहस्तो युवयुर्ववन्दा वां नक्षन्तो अद्रय आञ्जन |||
verses.transliteration: akāri vāmandhaso varīmannastāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam uttānahasto yuvayurvavandā vāṃ nakṣanto adraya āñjan

translations.griffith: Juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you: for you the grass is strewn, most soft to tread on.  With lifted hands your servant hath adored you. Yearningfor you the press-stones shed the liquid.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो वामग्निरध्वरेष्वस्थात पर रातिरेति जूर्णिनीघ्र्ताची पर होता गूर्तमना उराणो.अयुक्त यो नासत्या हवीमन |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo vāmaghniradhvareṣvasthāt pra rātireti jūrṇinīghṛtācī pra hotā ghūrtamanā urāṇo.ayukta yo nāsatyā havīman

translations.griffith: Agni uplifts him at your sacrifices: forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing.  Up stands the grateful-minded priest, elected, appointed to invoke the two Nāsatyas.

verses.sanskrit: अधि शरिये दुहिता सूर्यस्य रथं तस्थौ पुरुभुजा शतोतिम पर मायाभिर्मायिना भूतमत्र नरा नर्तू जनिमन यज्ञियानाम |||
verses.transliteration: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya rathaṃ tasthau purubhujā śatotim pra māyābhirmāyinā bhūtamatra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām

translations.griffith: Lords of great wealth! for glory, Sūrya's Daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours.  Famed for your magic arts were ye, magicians! amid the race of Gods, ye dancing Heroes!

verses.sanskrit: युवं शरीभिर्दर्शताभिराभिः शुभे पुष्टिमूहथुःसूर्यायाः पर वां वयो वपुषे.अनु पप्तन नक्षद वाणी सुष्टुता धिष्ण्या वाम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ śrībhirdarśatābhirābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭimūhathuḥsūryāyāḥ pra vāṃ vayo vapuṣe.anu paptan nakṣad vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām

translations.griffith: Ye Twain, with these your glories fair to look on, brought, to win victory, rich gifts for Sūrya.  After you flew your birds, marvels of beauty: dear to our hearts! the song, well lauded, reached you.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां वयो.अश्वासो वहिष्ठा अभि परयो नासत्या वहन्तु पर वां रथो मनोजवा असर्जीषः पर्क्ष इषिधो अनु पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ vayo.aśvāso vahiṣṭhā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahantu pra vāṃ ratho manojavā asarjīṣaḥ pṛkṣa iṣidho anu pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: May your winged coursers, best to draw. Nāsatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes.  Swift as the thought, your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands.

verses.sanskrit: पुरु हि वां पुरुभुजा देष्णं धेनुं न इषं पिन्वतमसक्राम सतुतश्च वां माध्वी सुष्टुतिश्च रसाश्च ये वामनु रातिमग्मन |||
verses.transliteration: puru hi vāṃ purubhujā deṣṇaṃ dhenuṃ na iṣaṃ pinvatamasakrām stutaśca vāṃ mādhvī suṣṭutiśca rasāśca ye vāmanu rātimaghman

translations.griffith: Lords of great wealth, manifold is your bounty: ye filled our cow with food that never faileth.  Lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers, and poured libations which have sought your favour.

verses.sanskrit: उत म रज्रे पुरयस्य रघ्वी सुमीळ्हे शतं पेरुके च पक्वा शाण्डो दाद धिरणिनः समद्दिष्टीन दश वशासो अभिषाच रष्वान |||
verses.transliteration: uta ma ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḷhe śataṃ peruke ca pakvā śāṇḍo dād dhiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāso abhiṣāca ṛṣvān

translations.griffith: Mine were two mares of Puraya, brown, swift-footed; a hundred with Sumidha, food with Peruk  Sanda gave ten gold-decked and well-trained horses, tame and obedient and of lofty stature.

verses.sanskrit: सं वां शता नासत्या सहस्राश्वानां पुरुपन्था गिरे दात भरद्वाजाय वीर नू गिरे दाद धता रक्षांसि पुरुदंससा सयुः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ vāṃ śatā nāsatyā sahasrāśvānāṃ purupanthā ghire dāt bharadvājāya vīra nū ghire dād dhatā rakṣāṃsi purudaṃsasā syuḥ

translations.griffith: Nāsatyas! Purupanthas offered hundreds, thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises,  Gave, Heroes! to the singer Bharadvāja. Ye-Wonder-Workers, let the fiends be slaughtered.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां सुम्ने वरिमन सूरिभिः षयाम ||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ sumne variman sūribhiḥ ṣyām

translations.griffith: May I with princes share your bliss in freedom.

verses.sanskrit: उदु शरिय उषसो रोचमाना अस्थुरपां नोर्मयो रुशन्तः कर्णोति विश्वा सुपथा सुगान्यभूदु वस्वी दक्षिणामघोनी |||
verses.transliteration: udu śriya uṣaso rocamānā asthurapāṃ normayo ruśantaḥ kṛṇoti viśvā supathā sughānyabhūdu vasvī dakṣiṇāmaghonī

translations.griffith: THE radiant Dawns have risen up for glory, in their white splendour like the waves of waters.  She maketh paths all easy, fair to travel, and, rich, hath shown herself benign and friendly.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रा दद्र्क्ष उर्विया वि भास्युत ते शोचिर्भानवो दयामपप्तन आविर्वक्षः कर्णुषे शुम्भमानोषो देवि रोचमानामहोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadrā dadṛkṣa urviyā vi bhāsyut te śocirbhānavo dyāmapaptan āvirvakṣaḥ kṛṇuṣe śumbhamānoṣo devi rocamānāmahobhiḥ

translations.griffith: We see that thou art good: far shines thy lustre; thy beams, thy splendours have flown up to heaven.  Decking thyself, thou makest bare thy bosom, shining in majesty, thou Goddess Morning.

verses.sanskrit: वहन्ति सीमरुणासो रुशन्तो गावः सुभगामुर्विया परथानाम अपेजते शूरो अस्तेव शत्रून बाधते तमो अजिरो नवोळ्हा |||
verses.transliteration: vahanti sīmaruṇāso ruśanto ghāvaḥ subhaghāmurviyā prathānām apejate śūro asteva śatrūn bādhate tamo ajiro navoḷhā

translations.griffith: Red are the kine and luminous that bear her the Blessed One who spreadeth through the distance.  The foes she chaseth like a valiant archer, like a swift warrior she repelleth darkness.

verses.sanskrit: सुगोत ते सुपथा पर्वतेष्ववाते अपस्तरसि सवभानो सा न आ वह पर्थुयामन्न्र्ष्वे रयिं दिवो दुहितरिषयध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: sughota te supathā parvateṣvavāte apastarasi svabhāno sā na ā vaha pṛthuyāmannṛṣve rayiṃ divo duhitariṣayadhyai

translations.griffith: Thy ways are easy on the hills: thou passest Invincible! Se1f-luminous! through waters.  So lofty Goddess with thine ample pathway, Daughter of Heaven, bring wealth to give us comfort.

verses.sanskrit: सा वह योक्षभिरवातोषो वरं वहसि जोषमनु तवं दिवो दुहितर्या ह देवी पूर्वहूतौ मंहना दर्शता भूः |||
verses.transliteration: sā vaha yokṣabhiravātoṣo varaṃ vahasi joṣamanu tvaṃ divo duhitaryā ha devī pūrvahūtau maṃhanā darśatā bhūḥ

translations.griffith: Dawn, bring me wealth: untroubled, with thine oxen thou bearest riches at thy will and pleasure;  Thou who, a Goddess, Child of Heaven, hast shown thee lovely through bounty when we called thee early.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते वयश ... ||
verses.transliteration: ut te vayaś ...

translations.griffith: As the birds fly forth from their restingplaces, so men with store of food rise at thy dawning.  Yea, to the liberal mortal who rernaineth at home, O Goddess Dawn, much good thou bringest.

verses.sanskrit: एषा सया नो दुहिता दिवोजाः कषितीरुछन्ती मानुषीरजीगः या भानुना रुशता राम्यास्वज्ञायि तिरस्तमसश्चिदक्तून |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā syā no duhitā divojāḥ kṣitīruchantī mānuṣīrajīghaḥ yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsvajñāyi tirastamasaścidaktūn

translations.griffith: SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber;  She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e’en through the shades of darkness.

verses.sanskrit: वि तद ययुररुणयुग्भिरश्वैश्चित्रं भान्त्युषसश्चन्द्ररथाः अग्रं यज्ञस्य बर्हतो नयन्तीर्वि ता बाधन्तेतम ऊर्म्यायाः |||
verses.transliteration: vi tad yayuraruṇayughbhiraśvaiścitraṃ bhāntyuṣasaścandrarathāḥ aghraṃ yajñasya bṛhato nayantīrvi tā bādhantetama ūrmyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion.  They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.

verses.sanskrit: शरवो वाजमिषमूर्जं वहन्तीर्नि दाशुष उषसो मर्त्याय मघोनीर्वीरवत पत्यमाना अवो धात विधते रत्नमद्य |||
verses.transliteration: śravo vājamiṣamūrjaṃ vahantīrni dāśuṣa uṣaso martyāya maghonīrvīravat patyamānā avo dhāta vidhate ratnamadya

translations.griffith: Dawns, bringing hither, to the man who worships, glory and power and might and food and vigour,  Opulent, with imperial sway like heroes, favour your servant and this day enrich him.

verses.sanskrit: इदा हि वो विधते रत्नमस्तीदा वीराय दाशुष उषासः इदा विप्राय जरते यदुक्था नि षम मावते वहथ पुर चित |||
verses.transliteration: idā hi vo vidhate ratnamastīdā vīrāya dāśuṣa uṣāsaḥ idā viprāya jarate yadukthā ni ṣma māvate vahatha pura cit

translations.griffith: Now is there treasure for the man who serves you, now for the hero, Dawns! who brings oblation;  Now for the singer when he sings the praise-song. Even to one like me ye brought aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: इदा हि त उषो अद्रिसानो गोत्रा गवामन्गिरसो गर्णन्ति वयर्केण बिभिदुर्ब्रह्मणा च सत्या नर्णामभवद देवहूतिः |||
verses.transliteration: idā hi ta uṣo adrisāno ghotrā ghavāmanghiraso ghṛṇanti vyarkeṇa bibhidurbrahmaṇā ca satyā nṛṇāmabhavad devahūtiḥ

translations.griffith: O Dawn who standest on the mountain ridges, Aṅgirases now praise thy stalls of cattle.  With prayer and holy hymn they burst them open: the heroes' calling on the Gods was fruitful.

verses.sanskrit: उछा दिवो दुहितः परत्नवन नो भरद्वाजवद विधते मघोनि सुवीरं रयिं गर्णते रिरीह्युरुगायमधि धेहि शरवो नः |||
verses.transliteration: uchā divo duhitaḥ pratnavan no bharadvājavad vidhate maghoni suvīraṃ rayiṃ ghṛṇate rirīhyurughāyamadhi dhehi śravo naḥ

translations.griffith: Shine on us as of old, thou Child of Heaven,on him, rich Maid! who serves like Bharadvāja.  Give to the singer wealth with noble heroes, and upon us bestow wide-spreading glory.

verses.sanskrit: वपुर्नु तच्चिकितुषे चिदस्तु समानं नाम धेनु पत्यमानम मर्तेष्वन्यद दोहसे पीपाय सक्र्च्छुक्रं दुदुहे पर्श्निरूधः |||
verses.transliteration: vapurnu taccikituṣe cidastu samānaṃ nāma dhenu patyamānam marteṣvanyad dohase pīpāya sakṛcchukraṃ duduhe pṛśnirūdhaḥ

translations.griffith: E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given.  The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Pṛśni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.

verses.sanskrit: ये अग्नयो न शोशुचन्निधाना दविर्यत तरिर्मरुतो वाव्र्धन्त अरेञवो हिरण्ययास एषां साकं नर्म्णैः पौंस्येभिश्च भूवन |||
verses.transliteration: ye aghnayo na śośucannidhānā dviryat trirmaruto vāvṛdhanta areñavo hiraṇyayāsa eṣāṃ sākaṃ nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiśca bhūvan

translations.griffith: They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty.  Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit: रुद्रस्य ये मीळ्हुषः सन्ति पुत्रा यांश्चो नु दाध्र्विर्भरध्यै विदे हि माता महो मही षा सेत पर्श्निः सुभ्वे गर्भमाधात |||
verses.transliteration: rudrasya ye mīḷhuṣaḥ santi putrā yāṃśco nu dādhṛvirbharadhyai vide hi mātā maho mahī ṣā set pṛśniḥ subhve gharbhamādhāt

translations.griffith: They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster:  The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Pṛśni is known to have received for man's advantage.

verses.sanskrit: न य इषन्ते जनुषो.अया नवन्तः सन्तो.अवद्यानि पुनानाः निर्यद दुह्रे शुचयो.अनु जोषमनु शरिया तन्वमुक्षमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: na ya iṣante januṣo.ayā nvantaḥ santo.avadyāni punānāḥ niryad duhre śucayo.anu joṣamanu śriyā tanvamukṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches.  When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू न येषु दोहसे चिदया आ नाम धर्ष्णु मारुतन्दधानाः न ये सतौना अयासो मह्ना नू चित सुदानुरव वासदुग्रान |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū na yeṣu dohase cidayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutandadhānāḥ na ye staunā ayāso mahnā nū cit sudānurava vāsadughrān

translations.griffith: Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking.  Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.

verses.sanskrit: त इदुग्राः शवसा धर्ष्णुषेणा उभे युजन्त रोदसी सुमेके अध समैषु रोदसी सवशोचिरामवत्सु तस्थौ न रोकः |||
verses.transliteration: ta idughrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇā ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke adha smaiṣu rodasī svaśocirāmavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ

translations.griffith: When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven,  Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.

verses.sanskrit: अनेनो वो मरुतो यामो अस्त्वनश्वश्चिद यमजत्यरथीः अनवसो अनभीशू रजस्तूर्वि रोदसी पथ्या याति साधन |||
verses.transliteration: aneno vo maruto yāmo astvanaśvaścid yamajatyarathīḥ anavaso anabhīśū rajastūrvi rodasī pathyā yāti sādhan

translations.griffith: No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it.  Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: नास्य वर्ता न तरुता नवस्ति मरुतो यमवथ वजसातौ तोके वा गोषु तनये यमप्सु स वरजं दर्ता पार्ये अध दयोः |||
verses.transliteration: nāsya vartā na tarutā nvasti maruto yamavatha vajasātau toke vā ghoṣu tanaye yamapsu sa vrajaṃ dartā pārye adha dyoḥ

translations.griffith: None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle  For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.

verses.sanskrit: पर चित्रमर्कं गर्णते तुराय मारुताय सवतवसे भरध्वम ये सहांसि सहसा सहन्ते रेजते अग्ने पर्थिवी मखेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pra citramarkaṃ ghṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate aghne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour,  Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तविषीमन्तो अध्वरस्येव दिद्युत तर्षुच्यवसो जुह्वो नाग्नेः अर्चत्रयो धुनयो न वीरा भराजज्जन्मानो मरुतो अध्र्ष्टाः |||
verses.transliteration: tviṣīmanto adhvarasyeva didyut tṛṣucyavaso juhvo nāghneḥ arcatrayo dhunayo na vīrā bhrājajjanmāno maruto adhṛṣṭāḥ

translations.griffith: Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset,  Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: तं वर्धन्तं मारुतं भराजद्र्ष्टिं रुद्रस्य सूनुं हवसा विवासे दिवः शर्धाय शुचयो मनीषा गिरयो नाप उग्रा अस्प्र्ध्रन |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vṛdhantaṃ mārutaṃ bhrājadṛṣṭiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā vivāse divaḥ śardhāya śucayo manīṣā ghirayo nāpa ughrā aspṛdhran

translations.griffith: That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances.  Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेषां वः सतां जयेष्ठतमा गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणावाव्र्धध्यै सं या रश्मेव यमतुर्यमिष्ठा दवा जनानसमा बाहुभिः सवैः |||
verses.transliteration: viśveṣāṃ vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamā ghīrbhirmitrāvaruṇāvāvṛdhadhyai saṃ yā raśmeva yamaturyamiṣṭhā dvā janānasamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ

translations.griffith: NOW Mitra-Varuṇa shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing;  They who, as ’twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.

verses.sanskrit: इयं मद वां पर सत्र्णीते मनीषोप परिया नमसा बर्हिरछ यन्तं नो मित्रावरुणावध्र्ष्टं छर्दिर्यद वां वरूथ्यं सुदानू |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ mad vāṃ pra stṛṇīte manīṣopa priyā namasā barhiracha yantaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvadhṛṣṭaṃ chardiryad vāṃ varūthyaṃ sudānū

translations.griffith: To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage.  Give us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!

verses.sanskrit: आ यातं मित्रावरुणा सुशस्त्युप परिया नमसा हूयमाना सं यावप्नः सथो अपसेव जनाञ्छ्रुधीयतश्चिद यतथो महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātaṃ mitrāvaruṇā suśastyupa priyā namasā hūyamānā saṃ yāvapnaḥ stho apaseva janāñchrudhīyataścid yatatho mahitvā

translations.griffith: Come hither, Mitra-Varuṇa, invited with eulogies and loving adoration,  Ye who with your might, as Work-Controllers, urge even men who quickly hear to labour.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वा न या वाजिना पूतबन्धू रता यद गर्भमदितिर्भरध्यै पर या महि महान्ता जायमाना घोरा मर्तायरिपवे नि दीधः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvā na yā vājinā pūtabandhū ṛtā yad gharbhamaditirbharadhyai pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāyaripave ni dīdhaḥ

translations.griffith: Whom, of pure origin, like two strong horses, Aditi bore as babes in proper season,  Whom, Mighty at your birth, the Mighty Goddess brought forth as terrors to the mortal foeman.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे यद वां मंहना मन्दमानाः कषत्रं देवासो अदधुः सजोषाः परि यद भूथो रोदसी चिदुर्वी सन्ति सपशो अदब्धासो अमूराः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve yad vāṃ maṃhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatraṃ devāso adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ pari yad bhūtho rodasī cidurvī santi spaśo adabdhāso amūrāḥ

translations.griffith: As all the Gods in their great joy and gladness gave you with one accord your high dominion,  As ye surround both worlds, though wide and spacious your spies are ever true and never bewildered.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि कषत्रं धारयेथे अनु दयून दरंहेथे सानुमुपमादिव दयोः दर्ळ्हो नक्षत्र उत विश्वदेवो भूमिमातान दयां धासिनायोः |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi kṣatraṃ dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṃhethe sānumupamādiva dyoḥ dṛḷho nakṣatra uta viśvadevo bhūmimātān dyāṃ dhāsināyoḥ

translations.griffith: So, through the days maintaining princely power. ye prop the height as ’twere from loftiest heaven.  The Star of all the Gods, established, filleth the heaven and earth with food of man who liveth.

verses.sanskrit: ता विग्रं धैथे जठरं पर्णध्या आ यत सद्म सभ्र्तयः पर्णन्ति न मर्ष्यन्ते युवतयो.अवाता वि यत पयो विश्वजिन्वा भरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: tā vighraṃ dhaithe jaṭharaṃ pṛṇadhyā ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti na mṛṣyante yuvatayo.avātā vi yat payo viśvajinvā bharante

translations.griffith: Take the strong drink, to quaff till ye are sated, when he and his attendants fill the chamber.  The young Maids brook not that none seeks to win them, when, Quickeners of all! they scatter moisture.

verses.sanskrit: ता जिह्वया सदमेदं सुमेधा आ यद वां सत्यो अरतिरते भूत तद वां महित्वं घर्तान्नावस्तु युवं दाशुषेवि चयिष्टमंहः |||
verses.transliteration: tā jihvayā sadamedaṃ sumedhā ā yad vāṃ satyo aratirte bhūt tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ ghṛtānnāvastu yuvaṃ dāśuṣevi cayiṣṭamaṃhaḥ

translations.griffith: So with your tongue come ever, when your envoy, faithful and very wise, attends our worship.  Nourished by holy oil! he this yGur glory: annihilate the sacrificer's trouble.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद वां मित्रावरुणा सपूर्धन परिया धाम युवधिता मिनन्ति न ये देवास ओहसा न मर्ता अयज्ञसाचो अप्यो नपुत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti na ye devāsa ohasā na martā ayajñasāco apyo naputrāḥ

translations.griffith: When, Mitra-Varuṇa, they strive against you and break tlie friendly laws ye have established,  They, neither Gods nor men in estimation, like Api's sons have godless sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: वि यद वाचं कीस्तासो भरन्ते शंसन्ति के चिन निविदो मनानाः आद वां बरवाम सत्यान्युक्था नकिर्देवेभिर्यतथो महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: vi yad vācaṃ kīstāso bharante śaṃsanti ke cin nivido manānāḥ ād vāṃ bravāma satyānyukthā nakirdevebhiryatatho mahitvā

translations.griffith: When singers in their song uplift their voices, some chant the Nivid texts with steady purpose.  Then may we sing you lauds that shall be fruitful: dp ye not rival all the Gods in greatness?

verses.sanskrit: अवोरित्था वां छर्दिषो अभिष्टौ युवोर्मित्रावरुणावस्क्र्धोयु अनु यद गाव सफुरान रजिप्यं धर्ष्णुं यद रणेव्र्षणं युनजन |||
verses.transliteration: avoritthā vāṃ chardiṣo abhiṣṭau yuvormitrāvaruṇāvaskṛdhoyu anu yad ghāva sphurān ṛjipyaṃ dhṛṣṇuṃ yad raṇevṛṣaṇaṃ yunajan

translations.griffith: O Mitra-Varuṇa, may your large bounty come to us hither, near to this our dwelling,  When the kine haste to us, and when they harness the fleet-foot mettled stallion for the battle.

verses.sanskrit: शरुष्टी वां यज्ञ उद्यतः सजोषा मनुष्वद वर्क्तबर्हिषो यजध्यै आ य इन्द्रावरुणाविषे अद्य महे सुम्नाय मह आववर्तत |||
verses.transliteration: śruṣṭī vāṃ yajña udyataḥ sajoṣā manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣo yajadhyai ā ya indrāvaruṇāviṣe adya mahe sumnāya maha āvavartat

translations.griffith: HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant,  The rite which Indra-Varuṇa shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि शरेष्ठा देवताता तुजा शूराणां शविष्ठाता हि भूतम मघोनां मंहिष्ठा तुविशुष्म रतेन वर्त्रतुरा सर्वसेना |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇāṃ śaviṣṭhātā hi bhūtam maghonāṃ maṃhiṣṭhā tuviśuṣma ṛtena vṛtraturā sarvasenā

translations.griffith: For at Gods’ worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes;  With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vṛtra's slayers.

verses.sanskrit: ता गर्णीहि नमस्येभिः शूषैः सुम्नेभिरिन्द्रावरुणा चकाना वज्रेणान्यः शवसा हन्ति वर्त्रं सिषक्त्यन्यो वर्जनेषु विप्रः |||
verses.transliteration: tā ghṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhirindrāvaruṇā cakānā vajreṇānyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtraṃ siṣaktyanyo vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ

translations.griffith: Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuṇa, for bliss, the joyous.  One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vṛtra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.

verses.sanskrit: गनाश्च यन नरश्च वाव्र्धन्त विश्वे देवासो नरां सवगूर्ताः परैभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा महित्वा दयौश्च पर्थिवि भूतमुर्वी |||
verses.transliteration: ghnāśca yan naraśca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāso narāṃ svaghūrtāḥ praibhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauśca pṛthivi bhūtamurvī

translations.griffith: Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes,  Ye, Indra-Varuṇa, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: स इत सुदानुः सववान रतावेन्द्रा यो वां वरुण दाशतित्मन इषा स दविषस्तरेद दास्वान वंसद रयिं रयिवतश्च जनान |||
verses.transliteration: sa it sudānuḥ svavān ṛtāvendrā yo vāṃ varuṇa dāśatitman iṣā sa dviṣastared dāsvān vaṃsad rayiṃ rayivataśca janān

translations.griffith: Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuṇa, brings you gifts with gladness.  That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.

verses.sanskrit: यं युवं दाश्वध्वराय देवा रयिं धत्थो वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम अस्मे स इन्द्रावरुणावपि षयात पर यो भनक्ति वनुषामशस्तीः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ yuvaṃ dāśvadhvarāya devā rayiṃ dhattho vasumantaṃ purukṣum asme sa indrāvaruṇāvapi ṣyāt pra yo bhanakti vanuṣāmaśastīḥ

translations.griffith: May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices,  Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuṇa, e’en our own possession.

verses.sanskrit: उत नः सुत्रात्रो देवगोपाः सूरिभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा रयिः षयात येषां शुष्मः पर्तनासु साह्वान पर सद्यो दयुम्नातिरते ततुरिः |||
verses.transliteration: uta naḥ sutrātro devaghopāḥ sūribhya indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ ṣyāt yeṣāṃ śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyo dyumnātirate taturiḥ

translations.griffith: So also, Indra-Varuṇa, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them-  They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.

verses.sanskrit: नू न इन्द्रावरुणा गर्णाना पर्ङकतं रयिं सौश्रवसाय देवा इत्था गर्णन्तो महिनस्य शर्धो.अपो न नावा दुरितातरेम |||
verses.transliteration: nū na indrāvaruṇā ghṛṇānā pṛṅktaṃ rayiṃ sauśravasāya devā itthā ghṛṇanto mahinasya śardho.apo na nāvā duritātarema

translations.griffith: Indra. and Varuṇa, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory.  May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.

verses.sanskrit: पर सम्राजे बर्हते मन्म नु परियमर्च देवाय वरुणाय सप्रथः अयं य उर्वी महिना महिव्रतः करत्वा विभात्यजरो न शोचिषा |||
verses.transliteration: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyamarca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ ayaṃ ya urvī mahinā mahivrataḥ kratvā vibhātyajaro na śociṣā

translations.griffith: Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuṇa the God, sublime, imperial Lord,  Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा सुतपाविमं सुतं सोमं पिबतं मद्यं धर्तव्रता युवो रथो अध्वरं देववीतये परति सवसरमुप याति पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā sutapāvimaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ pibataṃ madyaṃ dhṛtavratā yuvo ratho adhvaraṃ devavītaye prati svasaramupa yāti pītaye

translations.griffith: True to Law, Indra-Varuṇa, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy.  Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा मधुमत्तमस्य वर्ष्णः सोमस्य वर्षणा वर्षेथाम इदं वामन्धः परिषिक्तमस्मे आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām idaṃ vāmandhaḥ pariṣiktamasme āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma.  This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you

verses.sanskrit: सं वां कर्मणा समिषा हिनोमीन्द्राविष्णू अपसस परेस्य जुषेथां यज्ञं दरविणं च धत्तमरिष्टैर्नः पथिभिः पारयन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ vāṃ karmaṇā samiṣā hinomīndrāviṣṇū apasas pareasya juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattamariṣṭairnaḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā

translations.griffith: INDRA and Viṣṇu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service.  Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.

verses.sanskrit: या विश्वासां जनितरा मतीनामिन्द्राविष्णू कलशा सोमधाना पर वां गिरः शस्यमाना अवन्तु पर सतोमासो गीयमानासो अर्कैः |||
verses.transliteration: yā viśvāsāṃ janitarā matīnāmindrāviṣṇū kalaśā somadhānā pra vāṃ ghiraḥ śasyamānā avantu pra stomāso ghīyamānāso arkaiḥ

translations.griffith: Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Viṣṇu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices,  May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू मदपती मदानामा सोमं यातं दरविणो दधाना सं वामञ्जन्त्वक्तुभिर्मतीनां सं सतोमासः शस्यमानास उक्थैः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāviṣṇū madapatī madānāmā somaṃ yātaṃ draviṇo dadhānā saṃ vāmañjantvaktubhirmatīnāṃ saṃ stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsa ukthaiḥ

translations.griffith: Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Viṣṇu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma.  With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.

verses.sanskrit: आ वामश्वासो अभिमातिषाह इन्द्राविष्णू सधमादो वहन्तु जुषेथां विश्वा हवना मतीनामुप बरह्माणि शर्णुतं गिरो मे |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāmaśvāso abhimātiṣāha indrāviṣṇū sadhamādo vahantu juṣethāṃ viśvā havanā matīnāmupa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ ghiro me

translations.griffith: May your foe-conquering horses bring you hither, Indra and Viṣṇu, sharers of the banquet.  Of all our hymns accept the invocations list to my prayers and hear the songs I sing you.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू तत पनयाय्यं वां सोमस्य मद उरु चक्रमाथे अक्र्णुतमन्तरिक्षं वरीयो.अप्रथतं जीवसे नो रजांसि |||
verses.transliteration: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyaṃ vāṃ somasya mada uru cakramāthe akṛṇutamantarikṣaṃ varīyo.aprathataṃ jīvase no rajāṃsi

translations.griffith: This your deed, Indra-Viṣṇu, must be lauded: widely ye strode in the wild joy of Soma.  Ye made the firmament of larger compass, and made the regions broad for our existence.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू हविषा वाव्र्धानाग्राद्वाना नमसा रातहव्या घर्तासुती दरविणं धत्तमस्मे समुद्रः सथः कलशः सोमधानः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānāghrādvānā namasā rātahavyā ghṛtāsutī draviṇaṃ dhattamasme samudraḥ sthaḥ kalaśaḥ somadhānaḥ

translations.griffith: Strengthened with sacred offerings, IndraViṣṇu, first eaters, served with worship ana oblation,  Fed with the holy oil, vouchsafe us riches ye are the lake, the vat that holds the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू पिबतं मध्वो अस्य सोमस्य दस्रा जठरं पर्णेथाम आ वामन्धांसि मदिराण्यग्मन्नुप बरह्माणि शर्णुतं हवं मे |||
verses.transliteration: indrāviṣṇū pibataṃ madhvo asya somasya dasrā jaṭharaṃ pṛṇethām ā vāmandhāṃsi madirāṇyaghmannupa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ me

translations.griffith: Drink of this meath, O Indra, thou, and Viṣṇu; drink ye your fill of Soma, Wonder-Workers.  The sweet exhilarating juice hath reached you. Hear ye my prayers, give ear unto my calling.

verses.sanskrit: उभा जिग्यथुर्न परा जयेथे न परा जिग्ये कतरश्चनैनोः इन्द्रश्च विष्णो यदपस्प्र्धेथां तरेधा सहस्रं वि तदैरयेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā jighyathurna parā jayethe na parā jighye kataraścanainoḥ indraśca viṣṇo yadapaspṛdhethāṃ tredhā sahasraṃ vi tadairayethām

translations.griffith: Ye Twain have conquered, ne’er have yc been conquered: never hath either of the Twain been vanquished.  Ye, Indra-Viṣṇu, when ye fought the battle, produced this infinite with three divisions.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तवती भुवनानामभिश्रियोर्वी पर्थ्वी मधुदुघे सुपेशसा दयावाप्र्थिवी वरुणस्य धर्मणा विष्कभिते अजरेभूरिरेतसा |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānāmabhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajarebhūriretasā

translations.griffith: FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form,  The Heaven and the Earth by Varuṇa's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.

verses.sanskrit: असश्चन्ती भूरिधारे पयस्वती घर्तं दुहाते सुक्र्ते शुचिव्रते राजन्ती अस्य भुवनस्य रोदसी अस्मे रेतः सिञ्चतंयन मनुर्हितम |||
verses.transliteration: asaścantī bhūridhāre payasvatī ghṛtaṃ duhāte sukṛte śucivrate rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṃyan manurhitam

translations.griffith: The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man.  Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां रजवे करमणाय रोदसी मर्तो ददाश धिषणे स साधति पर परजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस परि युवोः सिक्ता विषुरूपाणि सव्रता |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī marto dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā

translations.griffith: Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds.  He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तेन दयावाप्र्थिवी अभीव्र्ते घर्तश्रिया घर्तप्र्चा घर्ताव्र्धा उर्वी पर्थ्वी होत्र्वूर्ये पुरोहिते ते इद विप्रा ईळते सुम्नमिष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛtaśriyā ghṛtapṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā urvī pṛthvī hotṛvūrye purohite te id viprā īḷate sumnamiṣṭaye

translations.griffith: Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still increase.  Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them.

verses.sanskrit: मधु नो दयावाप्र्थिवी मिमिक्षतां मधुश्चुता मधुदुघे मधुव्रते दधाने यज्ञं दरविणं च देवता महि शरवो वाजमस्मे सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: madhu no dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatāṃ madhuścutā madhudughe madhuvrate dadhāne yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca devatā mahi śravo vājamasme suvīryam

translations.griffith: May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your path,  Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जं नो दयौश्च पर्थिवी च पिन्वतां पिता माता विश्वविदा सुदंससा संरराणे रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा सनिं वाजं रयिमस्मे समिन्वताम |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjaṃ no dyauśca pṛthivī ca pinvatāṃ pitā mātā viśvavidā sudaṃsasā saṃrarāṇe rodasī viśvaśambhuvā saniṃ vājaṃ rayimasme saminvatām

translations.griffith: May Heaven and Earth make food swell plenteously for us, all-knowing Father, jother, wondrous in their works.  Pouring out bounties, may, in union, both the Worlds, all beneficial, send us gain, and power, and wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता हिरण्यया बाहू अयंस्त सवनायसुक्रतुः घर्तेन पाणी अभि परुष्णुते मखो युवा सुदक्षो रजसो विधर्मणि |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāyasukratuḥ ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makho yuvā sudakṣo rajaso vidharmaṇi

translations.griffith: FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life.  Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands.

verses.sanskrit: देवस्य वयं सवितुः सवीमनि शरेष्ठे सयाम वसुनश्चदावने यो विश्वस्य दविपदो यश्चतुष्पदो निवेशने परसवे चासि भूमनः |||
verses.transliteration: devasya vayaṃ savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaścadāvane yo viśvasya dvipado yaścatuṣpado niveśane prasave cāsi bhūmanaḥ

translations.griffith: May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth:  For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.

verses.sanskrit: अदब्धेभिः सवितः पायुभिष टवं शिवेभिरद्य परि पाहि नो गयम हिरण्यजिह्वः सुविताय नव्यसे रक्षा माकिर्नोघशंस ईशत |||
verses.transliteration: adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvaṃ śivebhiradya pari pāhi no ghayam hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākirnoaghaśaṃsa īśata

translations.griffith: Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true.  God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.

verses.sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता दमूना हिरण्यपाणिः परतिदोषमस्थात अयोहनुर्यजतो मन्द्रजिह्व आ दाशुषे सुवति भूरिवामम |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā damūnā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣamasthāt ayohanuryajato mandrajihva ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūrivāmam

translations.griffith: This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight.  With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.

verses.sanskrit: उदू अयानुपवक्तेव बाहू हिरण्यया सविता सुप्रतीका दिवो रोहांस्यरुहत पर्थिव्या अरीरमत पतयत कच्चिदभ्वम |||
verses.transliteration: udū ayānupavakteva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā supratīkā divo rohāṃsyaruhat pṛthivyā arīramat patayat kaccidabhvam

translations.griffith: Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on.  He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.

verses.sanskrit: वाममद्य सवितर्वाममु शवो दिवे-दिवे वाममस्मभ्यं सावीः वामस्य हि कषयस्य देव भूरेरया धिया वामभाजः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: vāmamadya savitarvāmamu śvo dive-dive vāmamasmabhyaṃ sāvīḥ vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes.  May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा महि तद वां महित्वं युवं महानि परथमानि चक्रथुः युवं सूर्यं विविदथुर्युवं सवर्विश्वा तमांस्यहतं निदश्च |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā mahi tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ yuvaṃ mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ yuvaṃ sūryaṃ vividathuryuvaṃ svarviśvā tamāṃsyahataṃ nidaśca

translations.griffith: GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements.  Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods’ blasphemers.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा वासयथ उषासमुत सूर्यं नयथो जयोतिषा सह उप दयां सकम्भथुः सकम्भनेनाप्रथतं पर्थिवीं मातरं वि |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā vāsayatha uṣāsamut sūryaṃ nayatho jyotiṣā saha upa dyāṃ skambhathuḥ skambhanenāprathataṃ pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃ vi

translations.griffith: Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour.  Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमावहिमपः परिष्ठां हथो वर्त्रमनु वां दयौरमन्यत परार्णांस्यैरयतं नदीनामा समुद्राणिपप्रथुः पुरूणि |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomāvahimapaḥ pariṣṭhāṃ hatho vṛtramanu vāṃ dyauramanyata prārṇāṃsyairayataṃ nadīnāmā samudrāṇipaprathuḥ purūṇi

translations.griffith: Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vṛtra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit.  Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा पक्वमामास्वन्तर्नि गवामिद दधथुर्वक्षणासु जग्र्भथुरनपिनद्धमासु रुशच्चित्रासु जगतीष्वन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā pakvamāmāsvantarni ghavāmid dadhathurvakṣaṇāsu jaghṛbhathuranapinaddhamāsu ruśaccitrāsu jaghatīṣvantaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma.  Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा युवमङग तरुत्रमपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं रराथे युवं शुष्मं नर्यं चर्षणिभ्यः सं विव्यथुः पर्तनाषाहमुग्रा |||
