verses.transliteration: indrāsomā yuvamaṅgha tarutramapatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthe yuvaṃ śuṣmaṃ naryaṃ carṣaṇibhyaḥ saṃ vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāhamughrā

translations.griffith: Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children.  Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.

verses.sanskrit: यो अद्रिभित परथमजा रतावा बर्हस्पतिराङगिरसो हविष्मान दविबर्हज्मा पराघर्मसत पिता न आ रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति |||
verses.transliteration: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatirāṅghiraso haviṣmān dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti

translations.griffith: SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Aṅgiras' son, Bṛhaspati, the Holy,  With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: जनाय चिद य ईवत उ लोकं बर्हस्पतिर्देवहूतौ चकार घनन वर्त्राणि वि पुरो दर्दरीति जयञ्छत्रून्रमित्रान पर्त्सु साहन |||
verses.transliteration: janāya cid ya īvata u lokaṃ bṛhaspatirdevahūtau cakāra ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayañchatrūnramitrān pṛtsu sāhan

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated,  Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिः समजयद वसूनि महो वरजान गोमतो देव एषः अपः सिषासन सवरप्रतीतो बर्हस्पतिर्हन्त्यमित्रमर्कैः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ samajayad vasūni maho vrajān ghomato deva eṣaḥ apaḥ siṣāsan svarapratīto bṛhaspatirhantyamitramarkaiḥ

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle.  Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Bṛhaspati with lightning smites the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा धारयेथामसुर्यं पर वामिष्टयो.अरमश्नुवन्तु दमे-दमे सप्त रत्ना दधाना शं नो भूतं दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे |||
verses.transliteration: somārudrā dhārayethāmasuryaṃ pra vāmiṣṭayo.aramaśnuvantu dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhānā śaṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade

translations.griffith: HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you.  Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा वि वर्हतं विषूचीममीवा या नो गयमाविवेश आरे बाधेथां निरतिं पराचैरस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: somārudrā vi vṛhataṃ viṣūcīmamīvā yā no ghayamāviveśa āre bādhethāṃ nirtiṃ parācairasme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu

translations.griffith: Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling.  Drive Nirrti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.

verses.sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा युवमेतान्यस्मे विश्वा तनूषु भेषजानि धत्तम अव सयतं मुञ्चतं यन नो अस्ति तनूषु बद्धं कर्तमेनो अस्मत |||
verses.transliteration: somārudrā yuvametānyasme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam ava syataṃ muñcataṃ yan no asti tanūṣu baddhaṃ kṛtameno asmat

translations.griffith: Provide, O Soma-Rudra, for our bodies all needful medicines to heal and cure us.  Set free and draw away the sin committed which we have still inherent in our persons.

verses.sanskrit: तिग्मायुधौ तिग्महेती सुशेवौ सोमारुद्राविह सु मर्ळतं नः पर नो मुञ्चतं वरुणस्य पाशाद गोपायतं नः सुमनस्यमाना |||
verses.transliteration: tighmāyudhau tighmahetī suśevau somārudrāviha su mṛḷataṃ naḥ pra no muñcataṃ varuṇasya pāśād ghopāyataṃ naḥ sumanasyamānā

translations.griffith: Armed with keen shafts and weapons, kind and loving, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra.  Release us from the noose of Varuṇa; keep us from sorrow, in your tender loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit: जीमूतस्येव भवति परतीकं यद वर्मी याति समदामुपस्थे अनाविद्धया तन्वा जय तवं स तवा वर्मणो महिमा पिपर्तु |||
verses.transliteration: jīmūtasyeva bhavati pratīkaṃ yad varmī yāti samadāmupasthe anāviddhayā tanvā jaya tvaṃ sa tvā varmaṇo mahimā pipartu

translations.griffith: THE warrior's look is like a thunderous rain-cloud's, when, armed with mail, he seeks the lap of battle.  Be thou victorious with unwounded body: so let the thickness of thy mail protect thee.

verses.sanskrit: धन्वना गा धन्वनाजिं जयेम धन्वना तीव्राः समदो जयेम धनुः शत्रोरपकामं कर्णोति धन्वना सर्वाः परदिशो जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: dhanvanā ghā dhanvanājiṃ jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samado jayema dhanuḥ śatrorapakāmaṃ kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarvāḥ pradiśo jayema

translations.griffith: With Bow let us win kine, with Bow the battle, with Bow be victors in our hot encounters.  The Bow brings grief and sorrow to the foeman: armed with the Bow may we subdue all regions.

verses.sanskrit: वक्ष्यन्तीवेदा गनीगन्ति कर्णं परियं सखायं परिषस्वजाना योषेव शिङकते वितताधि धन्वञ जया इयं समने पारयन्ती |||
verses.transliteration: vakṣyantīvedā ghanīghanti karṇaṃ priyaṃ sakhāyaṃ pariṣasvajānā yoṣeva śiṅkte vitatādhi dhanvañ jyā iyaṃ samane pārayantī

translations.griffith: Close to his car, as fain to speak, She presses, holding her well-loved Friend in her embraces.  Strained on the Bow, She whispers like a woman-this Bowstring that preserves us in the combat.

verses.sanskrit: ते आचरन्ती समनेव योषा मातेव पुत्रं बिभ्र्तामुपस्थे अप शत्रून विध्यतां संविदाने आर्त्नी इमे विष्फुरन्तीमित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: te ācarantī samaneva yoṣā māteva putraṃ bibhṛtāmupasthe apa śatrūn vidhyatāṃ saṃvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantīamitrān

translations.griffith: These, meeting like a woman and her lover, bear, mother-like, their child upon their bosom.  May the two Bow-ends, starting swift asunder, scatter, in unison, the foes who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: बह्वीनां पिता बहुरस्य पुत्रश्चिश्चा कर्णोति समनावगत्य इषुधिः सङकाः पर्तनाश्च सर्वाः पर्ष्ठे निनद्धो जयति परसूतः |||
verses.transliteration: bahvīnāṃ pitā bahurasya putraściścā kṛṇoti samanāvaghatya iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāśca sarvāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddho jayati prasūtaḥ

translations.griffith: With many a son, father of many daughters, He clangs and clashes as he goes to battle.  Slung on the back, pouring his brood, the Quiver vanquishes all opposing bands and armies.

verses.sanskrit: रथे तिष्ठन नयति वाजिनः पुरो यत्र-यत्र कामयते सुषारथिः अभीशूनां महिमानं पनायत मनः पश्चादनु यछन्ति रश्मयः |||
verses.transliteration: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puro yatra-yatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ abhīśūnāṃ mahimānaṃ panāyata manaḥ paścādanu yachanti raśmayaḥ

translations.griffith: Upstanding in the Car the skilful Charioteer guides his strong Horses on whithersoe’er he will.  See and admire the strength of those controlling Reins which from behind declare the will of him who drives.

verses.sanskrit: तीव्रान घोषान कर्ण्वते वर्षपाणयो.अश्वा रथेभिः सहवाजयन्तः अवक्रामन्तः परपदैरमित्रान कषिणन्ति शत्रून्रनपव्ययन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣapāṇayo.aśvā rathebhiḥ sahavājayantaḥ avakrāmantaḥ prapadairamitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūnranapavyayantaḥ

translations.griffith: Horses whose hoofs rain dust are neighing loudly, yoked to the Chariots, showing forth their vigour,  With their forefeet descending on the foemen, they, never flinching, trample and destroy them.

verses.sanskrit: रथवाहनं हविरस्य नाम यत्रायुधं निहितमस्य वर्म तत्रा रथमुप शग्मं सदेम विश्वाहा वयं सुमनस्यमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: rathavāhanaṃ havirasya nāma yatrāyudhaṃ nihitamasya varma tatrā rathamupa śaghmaṃ sadema viśvāhā vayaṃ sumanasyamānāḥ

translations.griffith: Car-bearer is the name of his oblation, whercon are laid his Weapons and his Armour.  So let us here, each day that passes, honour the helpful Car with hearts exceeding joyful.

verses.sanskrit: सवादुषंसदः पितरो वयोधाः कर्छ्रेश्रितः शक्तीवन्तो गभीराः चित्रसेना इषुबला अम्र्ध्राः सतोवीरा उरवो वरातसाहाः |||
verses.transliteration: svāduṣaṃsadaḥ pitaro vayodhāḥ kṛchreśritaḥ śaktīvanto ghabhīrāḥ citrasenā iṣubalā amṛdhrāḥ satovīrā uravo vrātasāhāḥ

translations.griffith: In sweet association lived the fathers who gave us life, profound and strong in trouble,  Unwearied, armed with shafts and wondrous weapons, free, real heroes, conquerors of armies.

verses.sanskrit: बराह्मणासः पितरः सोम्यासः शिवे नो दयावाप्र्थिवी अनेहसा पूषा नः पातु दुरिताद रताव्र्धो रक्षा माकिर्नो अघशंस ईशत |||
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive no dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā pūṣā naḥ pātu duritād ṛtāvṛdho rakṣā mākirno aghaśaṃsa īśata

translations.griffith: The Brahmans, and the Fathers meet for Soma-draughts, and, graciously inclined, unequalled Heaven and Earth.  Guard us trom evil, Pūṣan, guard us strengtheners of Law: let not the evil-wisher master us.

verses.sanskrit: सुपर्णं वस्ते मर्गो अस्या दन्तो गोभिः संनद्धा पतति परसूता यत्रा नरः सं च वि च दरवन्ति तत्रास्मभ्यमिषवः शर्म यंसन |||
verses.transliteration: suparṇaṃ vaste mṛgho asyā danto ghobhiḥ saṃnaddhā patati prasūtā yatrā naraḥ saṃ ca vi ca dravanti tatrāsmabhyamiṣavaḥ śarma yaṃsan

translations.griffith: Her tooth a deer, dressed in an eagle's feathers, bound with cow-hide, launched forth, She flieth onward.  There where the heroes speed hither and thither, there may the Arrows shelter and protect us.

verses.sanskrit: रजीते परि वरंधि नो.अश्मा भवतु नस्तनूः सोमो अधि बरवीतु नो.अदितिः शर्म यछतु |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjīte pari vṛṃdhi no.aśmā bhavatu nastanūḥ somo adhi bravītu no.aditiḥ śarma yachatu

translations.griffith: Avoid us thou whose flight is straight, and let our bodies be as stone.  May Soma kindly speak to us, and Aditi protect us well.

verses.sanskrit: आ जङघन्ति सान्वेषां जघनानुप जिघ्नते अश्वाजनि परचेतसो.अश्वान समत्सु चोदय |||
verses.transliteration: ā jaṅghanti sānveṣāṃ jaghanānupa jighnate aśvājani pracetaso.aśvān samatsu codaya

translations.griffith: He lays his blows upon their backs, he deals his blows upon their thighs.  Thou, Whip, who urgest horses, drive sagacious horses in the fray.

verses.sanskrit: अहिरिव भोगैः पर्येति बाहुं जयाया हेतिं परिबाधमानः हस्तघ्नो विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान पुमान पुमांसं परि पातु विश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: ahiriva bhoghaiḥ paryeti bāhuṃ jyāyā hetiṃ paribādhamānaḥ hastaghno viśvā vayunāni vidvān pumān pumāṃsaṃ pari pātu viśvataḥ

translations.griffith: It compasses the arm with serpent windings, fending away the friction of the bowstring:  So may the Brace, well-skilled in all its duties, guard manfully the man from every quarter.

verses.sanskrit: आलाक्ता या रुरुशीर्ष्ण्यथो यस्या अयो मुखम इदं पर्जन्यरेतस इष्वै देव्यै बर्हन नमः |||
verses.transliteration: ālāktā yā ruruśīrṣṇyatho yasyā ayo mukham idaṃ parjanyaretasa iṣvai devyai bṛhan namaḥ

translations.griffith: Now to the Shaft with venom smeared, tipped with deer-horn, with iron mouth,  Celestial, of Parjanya's seed, be this great adoration paid.

verses.sanskrit: अवस्र्ष्टा परा पत शरव्ये बरह्मसंशिते गछामित्रान्प्र पद्यस्व मानूषां कं चनोच्छिषः |||
verses.transliteration: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahmasaṃśite ghachāmitrānpra padyasva mānūṣāṃ kaṃ canocchiṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Loosed from the Bowstring fly away, thou Arrow, sharpened by our prayer.  Go to the foemen, strike them home, and let not one be left alive.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र बाणाः सम्पतन्ति कुमारा विशिखा इव तत्रा नो बरह्मणस पतिरदितिः शर्म यछतु विश्वाहा शर्म यछतु |||
verses.transliteration: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārā viśikhā iva tatrā no brahmaṇas patiraditiḥ śarma yachatu viśvāhā śarma yachatu

translations.griffith: There where the flights of Arrows fall like boys whose locks are yet unshorn.  Even there may Brahmaṇaspati, and Aditi protect us well, protect us well through all our days.

verses.sanskrit: मर्माणि ते वर्मणा छादयामि सोमस्त्वा राजाम्र्तेनानु वस्ताम उरोर्वरीयो वरुणस्ते कर्णोतु जयन्तं तवानु देवामदन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somastvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām urorvarīyo varuṇaste kṛṇotu jayantaṃ tvānu devāmadantu

translations.griffith: Thy vital parts I cover with thine Armour: with immortality King Soma clothe thee.  Varuṇa give thee what is more than ample, and in thy triumph may the Gods be joyful.

verses.sanskrit: यो नः सवो अरणो यश्च निष्ट्यो जिघांसति देवास्तंसर्वे धूर्वन्तु बरह्म वर्म ममान्तरम |||
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ svo araṇo yaśca niṣṭyo jighāṃsati devāstaṃsarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mamāntaram

translations.griffith: Whoso shall seek to hurt us, whether he be a strange foe or one of us,  May the Gods dismember him for the nearest, closest armour is prayer.
